original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse beginning with “that” indicates:

original: bstan ma thag pa'i sdom can 'bad pas gzung bar bya'i /
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa'i sdom can 'bad pas gzung bar bya'i /
translated: The one who has taken vows should be held with effort, as just explained.

original: shin tu 'gal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu 'gal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not right to be in complete opposition to him.

original: 'di ci'i phyir snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: pha la sogs pas yongs su bzung ba bzung na ma byin par len pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: pha la sogs pas yongs su bzung ba bzung na ma byin par len pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bya ba ma yin te /
translated: If one holds what is owned by a father and so on, it is not right to do so because it belongs to the category of taking what is not given.

original: 'di ltar bdag gir byas pa gtang bar mi bya'o snyam du 'ba' zhig dogs par gyur pa la zhes bshad pa de bas na bsam pa de nyid kyi sgo nas gzung bar bya ba 'di bslab pa'i gzhi 'dir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gir byas pa gtang bar mi bya'o snyam du 'ba' zhig dogs par gyur pa la zhes bshad pa de bas na bsam pa de nyid kyi sgo nas gzung bar bya ba 'di bslab pa'i gzhi 'dir bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since it is explained that “it is only feared that what is owned will be given up,” therefore, this is taught as a basis of training from the perspective of that very intention.

original: de la 'gro 'dod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'gro 'dod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If one wishes to go there, what should one do at that time?🔽If one thinks, “I will go to another place,” then what?

original: ji ste skye bo rtsa lag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ste skye bo rtsa lag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse beginning with “if a person” indicates:

original: sdom can gang gi sems te bsam pa shes so //
analyzed: sdom can gang gi sems te bsam pa shes so //
translated: The mind of the one who has taken vows is known.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: skye bo rtsa lag dang rjes su mthun par gyur par ro //
analyzed: skye bo rtsa lag dang rjes su mthun par gyur par ro //
translated: He is in harmony with his relatives.

original: de dag gang gi sgo nas shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang gi sgo nas shes par bya zhe na /
translated: By what means are they known?

original: smras pa rtags te tshig la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: smras pa rtags te tshig la sogs pa las so //
translated: They are known by their signs, such as speech.

original: des dge tshul de gzung bar mi bya'i 'on kyang gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: des dge tshul de gzung bar mi bya'i 'on kyang gtang bar bya'o //
translated: The novice should not be accepted, but rather should be released.

original: ji ltar 'dul ba las nye dus lag pa gcig nas bzung ba na rab tu byung bas gnyis pa las gzung bar bya zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dul ba las nye dus lag pa gcig nas bzung ba na rab tu byung bas gnyis pa las gzung bar bya zhing /
translated: As it says in the Vinaya, “When a relative holds the hand of a novice, the novice should hold the other hand.

original: de la des 'di skad du lag pa gang na zhes dri bar @202a * //
analyzed: de la des 'di skad du lag pa gang na zhes dri bar @202a * //
translated: He should ask, ‘Which hand?’

original: bya'o ; / gal te nye du dag gis zhes smra bar byed na gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o ; / gal te nye du dag gis zhes smra bar byed na gzung bar bya'o //
translated: If he says, ‘My relative,’ he should be accepted.

original: 'on te khyed cag dag gis zhes smra bar byed na /
analyzed: 'on te khyed cag dag gis zhes smra bar byed na /
translated: If he says, ‘Yours,’

original: kye ma'o 'gro 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas na gzung bar mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: kye ma'o 'gro 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas na gzung bar mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: he should not be accepted, as it says, ‘Alas, he wants to go.’

original: dbyar gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan las rnyed pa'i rnyed pa gang dbang bar 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: dbyar gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan las rnyed pa'i rnyed pa gang dbang bar 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: If a novice is given a gift by a householder who is staying for the rainy season, who should receive it?

original: dbyar gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: dbyar gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The passage beginning with “during the rainy season” is stated.

original: dbyar gnas par gyur pa ni dbyar gnas te de dbang zhing bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyar gnas par gyur pa ni dbyar gnas te de dbang zhing bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has entered the rainy season is one who has entered the rainy season. He is the master and owner of the robe.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: yun ring bar yang zhes bya ba ni bya ba khyad par du byed pa yin te /🔽mang du zhes bya bar 'jug go yang gi sgra ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: yun ring bar yang zhes bya ba ni bya ba khyad par du byed pa yin te / mang du zhes bya bar 'jug go yang gi sgra ni 'di skad du /
translated: “For a long time” is a special activity.

original: ma lus par gnas pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi 'on kyang yun ring bar dbyar gnas par gyur pa yang zhes bya ba'i don du bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma lus par gnas pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi 'on kyang yun ring bar dbyar gnas par gyur pa yang zhes bya ba'i don du bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Many” is used. The word “also” indicates that it is not only the case that one who has entered the rainy season is the master of the robe, but also that one who has entered the rainy season for a long time is the master of the robe.

original: 'dir zla ba phyed dang gnyis las lhag pa dang bcas par gnas par gyur pa de ni yun ring bar ni dbyar gnas pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir zla ba phyed dang gnyis las lhag pa dang bcas par gnas par gyur pa de ni yun ring bar ni dbyar gnas pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, one who has entered the rainy season for more than one and a half months is one who has entered the rainy season for a long time.

original: rab tu byung ba de shi bar gyur na yang dbang bar 'gyur gyi yul gzhan du song bar gyur pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba de shi bar gyur na yang dbang bar 'gyur gyi yul gzhan du song bar gyur pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Even if that renunciate dies, he is the master of the robe, but not one who has merely gone to another place.

original: de dbang ba'i rnyed pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dbang ba'i rnyed pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the type of acquisition that is obtained by that?

original: dbyar gnas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dbyar gnas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “that which is for the rainy season.🔽”

original: dbyar gnas pa ni 'dug par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dbyar gnas pa ni 'dug par gyur pa ste /
translated: The rainy season is the time of staying.

original: dbyar gnas shing 'dug par gyur pa'i phyir dbyar gnas pa'i byed rgyu dang rgyu mtshan de'i sgo nas rnyed pa'i rnam pa 'byung ba ni rnyed pa kho na rnyed pa'i rnam pa nyid yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: dbyar gnas shing 'dug par gyur pa'i phyir dbyar gnas pa'i byed rgyu dang rgyu mtshan de'i sgo nas rnyed pa'i rnam pa 'byung ba ni rnyed pa kho na rnyed pa'i rnam pa nyid yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The type of acquisition that arises through the cause and reason of staying in the rainy season is called “the type of acquisition that is obtained by that.”

original: de la de lta bur gyur pa'i rnyed pa'i bdag por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la de lta bur gyur pa'i rnyed pa'i bdag por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One becomes the master of that type of acquisition.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi ched dang chos nyid la phul ba'i rnyed pa gang la rigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi ched dang chos nyid la phul ba'i rnyed pa gang la rigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the type of acquisition that is proper for the Three Jewels and for the Dharma?

original: smras pa sangs rgyas la phul pa yin ba de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gtsang khang dang mchod rten la sogs pa la nye bar sbyar bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: smras pa sangs rgyas la phul pa yin ba de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gtsang khang dang mchod rten la sogs pa la nye bar sbyar bar bya ba yin la /
translated: That which is offered to the Buddha is to be used in the Blessed One’s temple, stūpa, and so on.

original: dge 'dun la phul ba ni bgo bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun la phul ba ni bgo bar bya ba yin no //
translated: That which is offered to the Saṅgha is to be distributed.

original: chos la phul ba ni mi shes pas ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos la phul ba ni mi shes pas ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If one gives to the Dharma, what is the use of giving to the Sangha?

original: chos kyi rnyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi rnyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The verse states, “The acquisition of the Dharma, etc.”

original: chos kyi rnyed pa gang dag dbang bar 'gyur zhe na dam chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos kyi rnyed pa gang dag dbang bar 'gyur zhe na dam chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What is the acquisition of the Dharma? The verse states, “The verses of the true Dharma, etc.”

original: dam pa'i chos kyi tshigs bcad ni dam chos tshigs bshad do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi tshigs bcad ni dam chos tshigs bshad do //
translated: The verses of the true Dharma are the verses of the true Dharma.

original: tshigs bshad ni bka' la bya ste /
analyzed: tshigs bshad ni bka' la bya ste /
translated: The verses are the words of the Buddha.

original: sman pa nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin gyi khyad par can ma yin pa de'i phyir yang de tsam de yang rab tu byung ba gang gis klags par gyur pa de dag @202b kho na la dbang ba ste /
analyzed: sman pa nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin gyi khyad par can ma yin pa de'i phyir yang de tsam de yang rab tu byung ba gang gis klags par gyur pa de dag @202b kho na la dbang ba ste /
translated: They are like medicine, but they are not special. Therefore, only those who are fully ordained and who have memorized them have dominion over them.

original: bdag por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are the masters of them. This is the meaning.

original: yang gi sgra ni mdo sde la sogs ba klags pa de dag 'ba' zhig dbang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni mdo sde la sogs ba klags pa de dag 'ba' zhig dbang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “also” means that not only the verses of the sutras, etc., are to be mastered.

original: ni'i sgra ni de kho na zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni de kho na zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: The word “only” is for the purpose of excluding other things.

original: 'dir chos 'di gang yin zhes rnam par dpyad par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir chos 'di gang yin zhes rnam par dpyad par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Here, one should investigate what this Dharma is.

original: 'dir smras pa chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, it is said: Dharma is of two kinds:

original: bstan pa'i chos dang / don dam pa'i chos so //
analyzed: bstan pa'i chos dang / don dam pa'i chos so //
translated: the Dharma of the teaching and the Dharma of ultimate truth.

original: de la bstan pa'i chos ni mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung du bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de la bstan pa'i chos ni mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung du bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: The Dharma of the teaching is the twelve branches of the scriptures, such as the sutra, the geya, the vyakarana, etc.

original: don dam pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of ultimate truth is nirvana.

original: de la bstan pa'i chos kyi ched du phul ba'i rnyed pa ni 'dir bgo bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de la bstan pa'i chos kyi ched du phul ba'i rnyed pa ni 'dir bgo bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Here, the gifts given for the sake of the Dharma of the teaching are to be distributed.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyi ched du phul ba ni sangs rgyas la phul ba dang 'dra bar bgo bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyi ched du phul ba ni sangs rgyas la phul ba dang 'dra bar bgo bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: But the gifts given for the sake of the Dharma of ultimate truth are not to be distributed, like those given to the Buddha,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because nirvana is its nature.

original: de la ji ltar de dag bgo bar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar de dag bgo bar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How are they to be distributed?

original: smras pa gang gi tshe sbyin pa po bdag nyid kyis rnam par phye nas 'bul bar byed pa de'i tshe rab tu sbyin par bya zhing /
analyzed: smras pa gang gi tshe sbyin pa po bdag nyid kyis rnam par phye nas 'bul bar byed pa de'i tshe rab tu sbyin par bya zhing /
translated: If the donor himself distributes the articles, then they should be distributed.

original: rnam par ma phye ba yin na ni sbyin pa po des chos gang dag gi ched du phul ba yin zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma phye ba yin na ni sbyin pa po des chos gang dag gi ched du phul ba yin zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: But if they are not distributed, then the donor should be asked, “For the sake of which teachings did you offer them?”

original: de la yang gal te bstan pa'i chos 'bri ba'i ched du'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: de la yang gal te bstan pa'i chos 'bri ba'i ched du'o zhes zer na /
translated: If he says, “For the sake of the written teachings,”

original: de de kho na bzhin du bya'i bgo bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de de kho na bzhin du bya'i bgo bar mi bya'o //
translated: then they should be used in that way and not distributed.

original: ji ltar yon bdag gis rnyed pa nges par rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yon bdag gis rnyed pa nges par rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “As the donor has determined the use of the gift.”

original: gtsug lag khang du mar dbyar gnas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la gtsug lag khang kun gyi rung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du mar dbyar gnas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la gtsug lag khang kun gyi rung ngam zhe na /
translated: If one is to stay for the rains in many monasteries, can one receive the gifts of all of them?

original: gtsug lag khang du mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse text says, “In many monasteries, etc.”

original: gtsug lag khang du ma ni gtsug lag khang mang po ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du ma ni gtsug lag khang mang po ste /
translated: “In many monasteries” means in many monasteries.

original: de dag khas blangs shing dam bcas pa byas pa na'o //
analyzed: de dag khas blangs shing dam bcas pa byas pa na'o //
translated: When they have accepted and promised that.

original: gtsug lag khang gcig kho na las rnyed pa zhes bya ba dbyar gyi rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gcig kho na las rnyed pa zhes bya ba dbyar gyi rnyed pa ste /
translated: The term “from one monastery” refers to the gains of the rainy season retreat.

original: de len du dbang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de len du dbang ba ma yin no //
translated: One is not entitled to take them.

original: dang ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: dang ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The term “or” indicates an alternative.

original: kyang gi sgras gcig tu gnas par khas blangs pa gcig nas rnyed pa dbang ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang gtsug lag khang dum dag la yang zhes sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras gcig tu gnas par khas blangs pa gcig nas rnyed pa dbang ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang gtsug lag khang dum dag la yang zhes sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: The term “also” in the verse indicates that one is not only entitled to the gains of the rainy season retreat from one monastery, but also from several monasteries.

original: 'on te thams cad nas len par 'dod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe yang /🔽kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //🔽gal te gtsug lag khang thams cad nas rnyed pa len @203a * //
analyzed: 'on te thams cad nas len par 'dod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe yang / kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no // gal te gtsug lag khang thams cad nas rnyed pa len @203a * //
translated: But if one wishes to take the gains from all the monasteries, then the verse states:🔽“If one takes the gains from all the monasteries, one should act in accordance with the majority.”

original: pa'i bsam pa yod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe ji ltar khas blang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: pa'i bsam pa yod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe ji ltar khas blang bar bya zhe na /
translated: If one wishes to take the gains from all the monasteries, how should one act?

original: gtsug lag khang kun rnyed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang kun rnyed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The verse states: “If one takes the gains from all the monasteries, one should act in accordance with the majority.”

original: gtsug lag khang thams cad kyi rnyed pa ni gtsug lag khang kun rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang thams cad kyi rnyed pa ni gtsug lag khang kun rnyed pa ste /
translated: The property of all the monasteries is the property of all the monasteries.

original: gtsug lag khang thams cad kyi rnyed pa gcig tu bsdus pa de las so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang thams cad kyi rnyed pa gcig tu bsdus pa de las so //
translated: From that, which is the sum total of the property of all the monasteries.

original: gcig kyang yin la skal ba yang yin pas skal ba gcig go //
analyzed: gcig kyang yin la skal ba yang yin pas skal ba gcig go //
translated: It is one and it is a share, thus it is one share.

original: skal ba gcig tsam ste /
analyzed: skal ba gcig tsam ste /
translated: It is just one share.

original: dge tshul des de tsam zhig blang bar bya ba yin no //🔽de la skal ba gcig tsam zhes bya ba ni de gang du khas blangs pa'i gtsug lag khang de dag tu gang bshad par gyur pa'i dge tshul gyi skal ba ste /
analyzed: dge tshul des de tsam zhig blang bar bya ba yin no // de la skal ba gcig tsam zhes bya ba ni de gang du khas blangs pa'i gtsug lag khang de dag tu gang bshad par gyur pa'i dge tshul gyi skal ba ste /
translated: That is the amount that novice monk should take.🔽In this regard, just one share means that novice monk should take just that much property that is the share of a novice monk that is explained in those monasteries where he has taken vows.

original: rnyed pa gcig po de gtsug lag khang de dag gis grangs las char byas pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir skal ba gcig yin te de tsam zhig des blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnyed pa gcig po de gtsug lag khang de dag gis grangs las char byas pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir skal ba gcig yin te de tsam zhig des blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That single property is divided by the number of those monasteries. That is one share here. The meaning is that he should take just that much.

original: don 'di nyid slob dpon yon tan 'od kyis 'dir khas blang sa bdag la bdag nyid kyi grangs las cha nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don 'di nyid slob dpon yon tan 'od kyis 'dir khas blang sa bdag la bdag nyid kyi grangs las cha nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Master Guṇaprabha states here that “one’s share is from one’s own number.”

original: 'dir yang don ni 'di yin te khas blangs pa des sngags kyis gtsug lag khang dag tu khas blangs pa'i gtsug lag khang rang gi grangs de las cha ste skal ba sbyin par bya ba gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyi grangs kyi cha'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang don ni 'di yin te khas blangs pa des sngags kyis gtsug lag khang dag tu khas blangs pa'i gtsug lag khang rang gi grangs de las cha ste skal ba sbyin par bya ba gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyi grangs kyi cha'o //
translated: The meaning here is this: One’s share is from one’s own number, that is, from one’s own number of monks who have agreed to the distribution of the offerings in the monastery.

original: de'i dngos po ni bdag nyid kyi grangs kyi cha nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni bdag nyid kyi grangs kyi cha nyid do //
translated: The state of that is one’s own number’s share.

original: gtsug lag khang gi grangs las rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi grangs las rnyed pa ste /
translated: The offerings are distributed from the number of monks in the monastery.

original: skal bar byas nas gtsug lag khang tha dad pa'i dge slong dag gis sbyin par bya'i lhag par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skal bar byas nas gtsug lag khang tha dad pa'i dge slong dag gis sbyin par bya'i lhag par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: After the distribution of the offerings, the monks of the different monasteries should give their share to the monks of their own monastery. They should not give it to others.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang tshul 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang tshul 'di nyid yin no //
translated: This is the way of the world.

original: ji ltar dge slong dbyar gnas la sogs pa'i rnyed pa thob pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar dge slong dbyar gnas la sogs pa'i rnyed pa thob pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as monks who have entered the rains retreat receive offerings,

original: dge tshul dag yin nam 'on te rnam pa gzhan du yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge tshul dag yin nam 'on te rnam pa gzhan du yin zhe na /
translated: Are they novices or are they of another type?

original: dge slong gcig gi nges dang mtshungs pa las //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dge slong gcig gi nges dang mtshungs pa las // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: From the portion of one monk,🔽two parts are to be taken.

original: dge slong gcig gi nges pa ste rnyed pa las cha gnyis blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gcig gi nges pa ste rnyed pa las cha gnyis blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa las byung ba yin te /
translated: From the portion of one monk, two parts are to be taken.🔽This is the extensive explanation.

original: dbyar gyi rgyu mtshan nam gzhan dag las dge slong gcig gi rnyed pa'i nges pa gang yin pa de las dge tshul gyi cha gnyis blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi rgyu mtshan nam gzhan dag las dge slong gcig gi rnyed pa'i nges pa gang yin pa de las dge tshul gyi cha gnyis blang bar bya'o //
translated: From the portion of one monk, whether it is the sign of the rainy season or another, two parts are to be taken by the novice.🔽The word ni means “because” and the word hi means “thus.”

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don yin la de zhes bya ba ni de skad du zhes bya ba'i don yin pas gang gi phyir de skad du rgyas pa las gsungs pa'i phyir dang / rnyed pa len pa dpyad pa las kyang zhes @203b bya ba la ltos par bya ste /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don yin la de zhes bya ba ni de skad du zhes bya ba'i don yin pas gang gi phyir de skad du rgyas pa las gsungs pa'i phyir dang / rnyed pa len pa dpyad pa las kyang zhes @203b bya ba la ltos par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, because it is stated extensively in this way, and because it is analyzed in the scriptures on the taking of that which is obtained,

original: dge slong gcig gi skal ba'i tshad kyi rnyed pa cha gsum du gang byas pa las dge tshul gyi cha gnyis blang bar bya'o zhes 'dul ba rnyed par dpyad pa las gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong gcig gi skal ba'i tshad kyi rnyed pa cha gsum du gang byas pa las dge tshul gyi cha gnyis blang bar bya'o zhes 'dul ba rnyed par dpyad pa las gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the text is that the portion of a monk’s share of the estate is divided into three parts and the portion of a novice is taken as two parts.🔽Is it the same for one who wishes to be fully ordained?

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa la yang de kho na bzhin du yin nam ma yin zhe na 'di ltar bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa la ni rnyed pa mnyam po yin zhing zas la sogs pa de dang shi ba'i gos kyang yin te /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa la yang de kho na bzhin du yin nam ma yin zhe na 'di ltar bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa la ni rnyed pa mnyam po yin zhing zas la sogs pa de dang shi ba'i gos kyang yin te /
translated: It is the same for one who wishes to be fully ordained, but food and so on and the robes of the deceased are equal.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa ste rnyed pa mnyam po kho na dbang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa ste rnyed pa mnyam po kho na dbang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is the portion of one who wishes to be fully ordained is the portion of one who wishes to be fully ordained.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don yin te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don yin te /
translated: The word ni has the meaning of “because.”

original: gang gi phyir dge slong gi dngos po thob par 'dod pa yin pa de'i phyir mnyam po dbang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge slong gi dngos po thob par 'dod pa yin pa de'i phyir mnyam po dbang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because one who wishes to obtain the state of a fully ordained monk is equal, he obtains an equal portion.

original: 'di zas la sogs pa la yang yin nam sngar bshad pa'i cha gnyis dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di zas la sogs pa la yang yin nam sngar bshad pa'i cha gnyis dag yin zhe na /
translated: The two portions explained above are equal.

original: zas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The term “and so on” in the verse refers to food and so on.

original: zas dang por byas pa'i bza' ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni zas la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zas dang por byas pa'i bza' ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni zas la sogs pa ste /
translated: Food and so on refers to food and so forth that are taken first.

original: de la de ni bshad ma thag pa'i tshad mnyam po'i mtshan nyid kho na yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la de ni bshad ma thag pa'i tshad mnyam po'i mtshan nyid kho na yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The two portions should be understood to be equal in measure, as just explained.🔽The term “and so on” does not refer only to food and so on, but also to the robes and so on of a deceased renunciate.

original: yang gi sgra ni 'di 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi rab tu byung ba shi ba'i gos la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni shi ba'i rdzas yin te de la mnyam po kho nar 'gyur ro zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni 'di 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi rab tu byung ba shi ba'i gos la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni shi ba'i rdzas yin te de la mnyam po kho nar 'gyur ro zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The term “and so on” includes the robes of a deceased renunciate, which are equal.🔽Master Gunaprabha explains this point:

original: don 'di nyid ni slob dpon yon tan 'od kyis dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag ni cha gnyis ba dang gsum pa dag go //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni slob dpon yon tan 'od kyis dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag ni cha gnyis ba dang gsum pa dag go //
translated: Novices and female novices are the second and third portions.

original: zas la ni mnyam po nyid do //
analyzed: zas la ni mnyam po nyid do //
translated: Food is equal.

original: dge slong ma dang bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong ma dang bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dag kyang ngo //
translated: Bhikshus and those who wish to be fully ordained.

original: shi ba'i gos ni thams cad la 'os pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shi ba'i gos ni thams cad la 'os pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The clothing of the dead is suitable for all.

original: 'dri ba'i don 'di ni dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag la ni cha gsum pa dor ba'i rnyed pa sbyin par bya zhing zas ni mnyam por sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dri ba'i don 'di ni dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag la ni cha gsum pa dor ba'i rnyed pa sbyin par bya zhing zas ni mnyam por sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this question is that the property of a dead novice or female novice should be given to the three classes of monks, but food should be given equally to all.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa de dag dang / sngar bstan pa'i dge slob ma bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa ma yin du zin kyang mnyam po yin zhing /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa de dag dang / sngar bstan pa'i dge slob ma bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa ma yin du zin kyang mnyam po yin zhing /
translated: Even though those who wish to be fully ordained and the female probationers who were previously mentioned do not wish to be fully ordained, they are equal.

original: shi ba'i yo byad kyang dge slong ji lta ba de bzhin du dge tshul la yang zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: shi ba'i yo byad kyang dge slong ji lta ba de bzhin du dge tshul la yang zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that the property of the dead is like that of a monk, and also like that of a novice.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dag chos gos med pa'i phyir dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i yan lag ma tshang ba'i phyir zhes pa dag yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dag chos gos med pa'i phyir dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i yan lag ma tshang ba'i phyir zhes pa dag yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is because those who wish to be fully ordained do not have Dharma robes and because the branches of full ordination are incomplete.

original: gang gi tshe gcig gam gnyis sam gsum dag @204a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig gam gnyis sam gsum dag @204a * //
translated: When one, two, or three

original: gtsug lag khang na gnas par byed na de gtsug lag khang nyid kyi rnyed pa de dag bdag po nyid yin nam /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang na gnas par byed na de gtsug lag khang nyid kyi rnyed pa de dag bdag po nyid yin nam /
translated: If he resides in a monastery, is he the owner of the monastery’s property or not?

original: 'on te ma yin snyam du dogs pa la 'dod pa de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin snyam du dogs pa la 'dod pa de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To dispel doubt about this, he says:

original: gtsug lag khang na gcig pu su gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang na gcig pu su gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Whoever resides alone in a monastery, etc.”

original: gtsug lag khang gang du dge tshul gcig cig kyang gnas par byed na'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gang du dge tshul gcig cig kyang gnas par byed na'o //
translated: If a novice monk resides in a monastery,

original: kyang gi sgras mang po dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: kyang gi sgras mang po dag kyang yin te /
translated: the word “also” indicates that many people may also reside there.

original: gtsug lag khang de'i rnyed pa de nyid bdag po yin gyi dge 'dun ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang de'i rnyed pa de nyid bdag po yin gyi dge 'dun ni ma yin no //
translated: That monastery’s property belongs to him alone, not to the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du byung ba'i rnyed pa ni dge 'dun kho na dbang ba yin gyi gang zag ni ma yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du byung ba'i rnyed pa ni dge 'dun kho na dbang ba yin gyi gang zag ni ma yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
translated: The property that arises in a monastery belonging to the Saṅgha belongs to the Saṅgha alone, not to an individual. This is stated to dispel such a notion.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad du yin gyi dbyar kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad du yin gyi dbyar kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: “Resides” means in all cases, not just during the rainy season.

original: rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni dbyar gyi 'am gzhan dag gi ste de ltar ni gtsug lag khang 'ga' zhig tu dge tshul gyi mkhan po 'am /
analyzed: rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni dbyar gyi 'am gzhan dag gi ste de ltar ni gtsug lag khang 'ga' zhig tu dge tshul gyi mkhan po 'am /
translated: “Gain” means gain from the rainy season or from other times.

original: gnas kyi slob dpon shi bar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: gnas kyi slob dpon shi bar gyur pa'am /
translated: If the preceptor of a novice monk or the resident master of a monastery dies,

original: yul gzhan du song ba'am babs par gyur pas gcig pu zhig 'dir gnas par gyur pa na /
analyzed: yul gzhan du song ba'am babs par gyur pas gcig pu zhig 'dir gnas par gyur pa na /
translated: or if he goes to another country or falls into a serious illness, and only one monk remains in the monastery,

original: dbyar gyi dus sam gzhan gyi tshe der yang yon bdag gis yon bstabs par gyur pa de nyid kyi yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin pas bgo bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi dus sam gzhan gyi tshe der yang yon bdag gis yon bstabs par gyur pa de nyid kyi yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin pas bgo bar mi bya'o //
translated: then the offerings made to him by the benefactors during the rainy season or at other times belong to that monk alone and should not be shared with others.

original: de'i rnyed pa la de nyid bdag po yin pas gal te dbyar gyi rnyed pa byung na de kho na bzhin du bdag gir bya zhing /
analyzed: de'i rnyed pa la de nyid bdag po yin pas gal te dbyar gyi rnyed pa byung na de kho na bzhin du bdag gir bya zhing /
translated: If gain arises during the rainy season, it belongs to that monk alone.

original: gzhan du rnyed pa byung na sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs nas bdag gir bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du rnyed pa byung na sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs nas bdag gir bya'o //
translated: If gain arises at other times, he should consecrate it with a mantra and then make it his own.

original: gal te byin gyis ma brlabs par bdag gir byed na nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te byin gyis ma brlabs par bdag gir byed na nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur te /
translated: If he makes it his own without consecrating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: phyis 'ongs pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang skal ba mnyam por 'gyur bas de dag dang lhan cig bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyis 'ongs pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang skal ba mnyam por 'gyur bas de dag dang lhan cig bgo bar bya'o //
translated: All those who come later will have an equal share, so they should be shared with them.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na dngos po ji lta ba dang bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na dngos po ji lta ba dang bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there will be a fault in accordance with the thing and the intention.

original: de la sngags ni 'di yin te gnas 'di na bdag gcig pu gnas par bgyis pa na dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa byung ba 'di yang dge 'dun gyis bgo bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de la sngags ni 'di yin te gnas 'di na bdag gcig pu gnas par bgyis pa na dge 'dun gyi gos kyi rnyed pa byung ba 'di yang dge 'dun gyis bgo bar bya zhing /
translated: The mantra is as follows: “In this place, while I am staying alone, this acquisition of robe-cloth for the Saṅgha should be shared by the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyis bsten du rung ba bdag gis rnyed la bdag gis gos 'di bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba nas bdag gir bgyi bar byin gyis brlab po zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bsten du rung ba bdag gis rnyed la bdag gis gos 'di bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba nas bdag gir bgyi bar byin gyis brlab po zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: This is suitable for the Saṅgha to use. I have acquired it. I will make this robe-cloth my own.”

original: gal te de ltar byed na byin gyis brlabs pa yin par brjod par bya zhing gzhan dag 'ongs pa rnams la sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar byed na byin gyis brlabs pa yin par brjod par bya zhing gzhan dag 'ongs pa rnams la sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: If one acts in this way, it is said to be consecrated, and it should not be given to others who come later.

original: 'on te de ltar mi byed na byin @204b gyis brlabs pa ma yin pas des bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te de ltar mi byed na byin @204b gyis brlabs pa ma yin pas des bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: But if he does not do so, he does not take possession of it, because it is not consecrated.

original: bdag gir byed na nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gir byed na nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he takes possession of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: shi ba'i yo byad ji ltar bgo bar bya ba yin zhe na //
analyzed: shi ba'i yo byad ji ltar bgo bar bya ba yin zhe na //
translated: How should the property of the deceased be distributed?

original: sdom can shi na bkur sti byas nas ni //
analyzed: sdom can shi na bkur sti byas nas ni //
translated: When a monk dies, having honored him,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te //
translated: The property of the deceased should be distributed.

original: sdom can rab tu byung ba shi na de la bkur sti byas nas te de ltar byas nas shi ba de'i gos la sogs pa bgo bar bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdom can rab tu byung ba shi na de la bkur sti byas nas te de ltar byas nas shi ba de'i gos la sogs pa bgo bar bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When a monk who is a renunciant dies, having honored him, having done that, the property of the deceased, such as his robes, should be distributed. It is not otherwise.

original: bkur sti ni rol mo'i sgra dang lus bsregs te /
analyzed: bkur sti ni rol mo'i sgra dang lus bsregs te /
translated: Honoring him means making music, cremating his body,

original: chos mnyan pa sbyin pa dang / rgyun chags gsum pa 'don pa dang / gnas kyi mchod rten la phyag bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos mnyan pa sbyin pa dang / rgyun chags gsum pa 'don pa dang / gnas kyi mchod rten la phyag bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: giving a Dharma talk, reciting the three collections, and bowing to the shrine of the dwelling place.

original: shi ba'i yo byad lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po gang dbang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: shi ba'i yo byad lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po gang dbang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: To whom does the deceased’s property, such as the six articles beginning with the alms bowl, belong?

original: nad pa de'i nad g-yog gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: nad pa de'i nad g-yog gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The one who is the attendant of that sick person, etc.

original: sdom can nad pa'i bsnyen bkur bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni nad g-yog yin no //
analyzed: sdom can nad pa'i bsnyen bkur bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni nad g-yog yin no //
translated: The one who is the attendant of a sick person who has taken vows is the attendant.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sdom can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdom can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The one who has taken vows is mentioned.

original: de lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po dbang ba ni bdag po yin te /
analyzed: de lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po dbang ba ni bdag po yin te /
translated: The six, the begging-bowl, etc., are the property of the one who has taken vows.

original: de'i thob skal yin zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don yin no //
analyzed: de'i thob skal yin zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that they are his share.

original: lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed dang / chos gos gsum dang gding ba dang chu tshags dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed dang / chos gos gsum dang gding ba dang chu tshags dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The six, the begging-bowl, etc., are the begging-bowl, the three robes, the mat, and the water-strainer.

original: gal te nad g-yog mang po dag yod par gyur pa de'i tshe ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nad g-yog mang po dag yod par gyur pa de'i tshe ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: If there are many attendants, how should they be understood?

original: gang tshe nad g-yog mang du yod na yang //
analyzed: gang tshe nad g-yog mang du yod na yang //
translated: When there are many attendants,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: gang gi tshe bsnyen bkur byed pa mang ba nyid yod par gyur pa de'i tshe yang bshad ma thag pa'i drug po de nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsnyen bkur byed pa mang ba nyid yod par gyur pa de'i tshe yang bshad ma thag pa'i drug po de nyid de /
translated: When there are many who wish to serve, then the six things just mentioned,

original: lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po dag nad g-yog de dag spyir dbang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po dag nad g-yog de dag spyir dbang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the almsbowl and so on, are to be given to those who are nursing the sick, in general.

original: nyid ni gzhan ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid ni gzhan ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word “only” is for the purpose of exclusion.

original: dang ni rim pa gzhan te /
analyzed: dang ni rim pa gzhan te /
translated: The word “also” has the meaning of another sequence.

original: yang gi sgra'i don yin pas na drug po de yang rab dang 'bring dang tha ma dag las sbyin par bya'i gcig gi rang bzhin kho na las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra'i don yin pas na drug po de yang rab dang 'bring dang tha ma dag las sbyin par bya'i gcig gi rang bzhin kho na las ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the six things are to be given to the best, the middling, and the least, but not from only one kind.

original: gang gi tshe nad pa'i nad g-yog gzhan du song bar gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nad pa'i nad g-yog gzhan du song bar gyur la /
translated: When the nurse of the sick has gone elsewhere,

original: nad pa yang dus las 'das par 'gyur ba na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: nad pa yang dus las 'das par 'gyur ba na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: and the sick person has passed away, what should be done then?

original: nad pa'i don du gzhan du song ba'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nad pa'i don du gzhan du song ba'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “When the nurse has gone elsewhere for the sake of the sick person, etc.”

original: nad pa dag gi ched ni nad pa'i don te nad pa'i dgos pa de nyid kyi phyir gzhan du song na yang lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po dag dbang ngo //🔽ni'i sgra ni nad g-yog bdag nyid kyi @205a * //
analyzed: nad pa dag gi ched ni nad pa'i don te nad pa'i dgos pa de nyid kyi phyir gzhan du song na yang lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po dag dbang ngo // ni'i sgra ni nad g-yog bdag nyid kyi @205a * //
translated: The suffix -ana has the sense of purpose.

original: don dud na ma yin no zhes rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dud na ma yin no zhes rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ni is for the purpose of exclusion, meaning that it is not for the sake of the nurse himself.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: sdom can nad pa shi na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdom can nad pa shi na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: when a sick vow-holder dies.

original: nad pa yang de yin la sdom can yang yin pas na sdom can nad pa ste sdom can nad pa de shi na'o //
analyzed: nad pa yang de yin la sdom can yang yin pas na sdom can nad pa ste sdom can nad pa de shi na'o //
translated: Since he is sick and a vow-holder, he is a sick vow-holder. When that sick vow-holder dies,

original: gal te dge 'dun gyis lhung bzed la sogs pa de bgos bar gyur na de'i tshe yang sbyin par bya ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyis lhung bzed la sogs pa de bgos bar gyur na de'i tshe yang sbyin par bya ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: if the Saṅgha distributes his alms-bowl and so on, should it be given then?🔽It is said:

original: ji ste bgos par gyur kyang sdom can gyis //
analyzed: ji ste bgos par gyur kyang sdom can gyis //
translated: Even if distributed, the vow-holder

original: myur du bsdus te nad g-yog sbyin par bya //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: myur du bsdus te nad g-yog sbyin par bya //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: should quickly gather and give to the nurse.

original: gal te gang gi tshe sdom can rab tu byung bas lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po dgos par gyur pa ste char bshig par gyur pa de'i tshe yang sdom can rab tu byung bas myur du bsdus nas nad g-yog la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gang gi tshe sdom can rab tu byung bas lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po dgos par gyur pa ste char bshig par gyur pa de'i tshe yang sdom can rab tu byung bas myur du bsdus nas nad g-yog la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If a renunciate with vows should need the six articles such as the begging bowl, and they are destroyed by rain, then the renunciate with vows should quickly gather them and give them to the nurse.

original: ji ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gal te de'i don yin te /
analyzed: ji ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gal te de'i don yin te /
translated: The word “if” has the meaning of “when.”

original: bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gal te nad g-yog mtshan tha dad par gyur pa'am khyim pa dag byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to // gal te nad g-yog mtshan tha dad par gyur pa'am khyim pa dag byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: The meaning is that they should not be made one’s own.

original: ji ste bud med mtshan ldan nad g-yog byed pa 'am //🔽khyim pa zhig na zhes bya ba smos te /🔽bud med kyi mtshan ni bud med mtshan te //
analyzed: ji ste bud med mtshan ldan nad g-yog byed pa 'am // khyim pa zhig na zhes bya ba smos te / bud med kyi mtshan ni bud med mtshan te //
translated: If the nurse is a woman with a different gender, or a layperson, what should be done then?🔽If a woman with a female gender is the nurse,

original: de'i mtshan ni mtshan dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de'i mtshan ldan te /
analyzed: de'i mtshan ni mtshan dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de'i mtshan ldan te /
translated: or if a layperson is the nurse,🔽then the renunciate with vows should not give the six articles to the nurse.

original: mtshan gyi sgra gcig phyi ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshan gyi sgra gcig phyi ba yin no //
translated: The word “gender” is a single word.

original: ji ste de lta bur gyur pa de nad g-yog byed pa'am yang na khyim pa nad g-yog byed par gyur na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ste de lta bur gyur pa de nad g-yog byed pa'am yang na khyim pa nad g-yog byed par gyur na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If such a person is a nurse, or if a layperson is a nurse,

original: drug bo zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po dag go //
analyzed: drug bo zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed la sogs pa drug po dag go //
translated: the six things, the six things such as the begging bowl,

original: de mi dbang zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i yo byad dag go //
analyzed: de mi dbang zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i yo byad dag go //
translated: are not to be given to him.

original: ji ste zhes bya ba ni gal te'i don yin no //
analyzed: ji ste zhes bya ba ni gal te'i don yin no //
translated: If means if it is so.

original: 'am zhes bya ba ni yang na zhes bya ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba ni yang na zhes bya ba'i don yin te /
translated: Or means or.

original: mtshan mthun pa kho na la rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mtshan mthun pa kho na la rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is proper only for those of the same gender.

original: gang du yang mtshan mi mthun pa'i nad g-yog dag kho na med pa ma yin pa de'i tshe 'di des pa ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //🔽gang gi tshe bu lon blangs bzhin du rab tu byung ba shi bar gyur pa de'i tshe gang las sbyin par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang du yang mtshan mi mthun pa'i nad g-yog dag kho na med pa ma yin pa de'i tshe 'di des pa ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o // gang gi tshe bu lon blangs bzhin du rab tu byung ba shi bar gyur pa de'i tshe gang las sbyin par bya zhe na /
translated: If there are no nurses at all of the opposite gender, then it should be understood that this is not a transgression.🔽If one who has gone forth dies while still in debt, to whom should the debt be paid?

original: ji ste sdom can bu lon chags bzhin shi //
analyzed: ji ste sdom can bu lon chags bzhin shi //
translated: If one who has taken vows dies while still in debt,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The above is stated.🔽

original: gal te sdom can rab tu byung ba bu lon chags bzhin du shi bar gyur pa de'i tshe shi ba de'i yo byad de de'i snod spyad shi ba'i yo byad dag las bu lon bsab par bya zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te sdom can rab tu byung ba bu lon chags bzhin du shi bar gyur pa de'i tshe shi ba de'i yo byad de de'i snod spyad shi ba'i yo byad dag las bu lon bsab par bya zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If a renunciate with vows dies like one in debt, then the saṃgha should repay the debt from the deceased’s possessions, his utensils and so on.

original: gal te yod na bsabs pa'i lhag ma bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te yod na bsabs pa'i lhag ma bgo bar bya'o //
translated: If there is something left over after repaying the debt, it should be distributed.🔽This verse shows that the saṃgha is not responsible for the debt of the deceased, because the deceased is not the owner of his possessions.

original: de'i yo byad rnams kyis zhes ba @205b ba 'dis ni 'di skad du nor gyi bdag po gang yin pa de ni nor med kyang bdag po yin pa'i phyir de'i bu lon dge 'dun gyi ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ba de bas na yod na de'i
analyzed: de'i yo byad rnams kyis zhes ba @205b ba 'dis ni 'di skad du nor gyi bdag po gang yin pa de ni nor med kyang bdag po yin pa'i phyir de'i bu lon dge 'dun gyi ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ba de bas na yod na de'i
translated: If there is something left over after repaying the debt, it should be distributed.

original: kho na las bsab par bya zhing de'i rdzas med na nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: kho na las bsab par bya zhing de'i rdzas med na nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: If there is nothing left, there is no fault.

original: de la las sar byed pas las sar gyi don du bu lon blangs par gyur pa de'i tshe yang dge 'dun don du las sar byed pas blangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la las sar byed pas las sar gyi don du bu lon blangs par gyur pa de'i tshe yang dge 'dun don du las sar byed pas blangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “For the sake of the saṃgha” means that he takes the loan for the sake of the saṃgha’s business.

original: las sar byed pas zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis las sar byed pas so //🔽dge 'dun don du zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi las sar rgyu mtshan gyis bu lon blangs pas so //
analyzed: las sar byed pas zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis las sar byed pas so // dge 'dun don du zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi las sar rgyu mtshan gyis bu lon blangs pas so //
translated: “From the saṃgha” means that he takes it from the saṃgha’s business.

original: dge 'dun las kyang gzhal zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis rab tu sbyin par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge 'dun las kyang gzhal zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis rab tu sbyin par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “The saṃgha should repay it” means that the saṃgha should give it.

original: dge 'dun las zhes spyir bstan pas ji ltar sbyin bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: dge 'dun las zhes spyir bstan pas ji ltar sbyin bar bya zhe na /
translated: Since it is taught in general that “from the saṃgha,” how should it be given?

original: dpang rgya bltas te zhes bya ba la sogs pas smos te /
analyzed: dpang rgya bltas te zhes bya ba la sogs pas smos te /
translated: It is said, “after examining the promissory note,” and so on.

original: dbang rgya bltas shing dpyad nas tshad de kho na tsam de sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang rgya bltas shing dpyad nas tshad de kho na tsam de sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: After examining the promissory note, the saṃgha should give just that amount.

original: shi ba'i rdzas kyi bdag po nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: shi ba'i rdzas kyi bdag po nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the ownership of the deceased’s property?

original: gsol byas dang po tha ma gang yod pa //
analyzed: gsol byas dang po tha ma gang yod pa //
translated: The first and last are the one who supplicates.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽gsol ba byas par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gsol ba byas par gyur pa'am /
translated: What is the meaning of the expression: “the first and the last”?🔽The first and the last are the oldest and the youngest of the community.

original: yang na dang po dang tha ma byas par gyur pa na gtsug lag khang de'i mtshams su chud pa'i rab tu byung ba gang yod ba ste /🔽srid par gyur pa de dag nyid shi ba de'i gos la sogs pa'i dbang po yin gyi /🔽dus phyis 'ongs par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na dang po dang tha ma byas par gyur pa na gtsug lag khang de'i mtshams su chud pa'i rab tu byung ba gang yod ba ste / srid par gyur pa de dag nyid shi ba de'i gos la sogs pa'i dbang po yin gyi / dus phyis 'ongs par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The first is the oldest of the community.🔽The last is the youngest of the community.

original: dang ni nges par gzung ba'o //🔽gsol ba ni sngags kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: dang ni nges par gzung ba'o // gsol ba ni sngags kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: The first and the last are the oldest and the youngest of the community.

original: dang po tha ma zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: dang po tha ma zhes bya ba la //
translated: The first is the oldest of the community.🔽The last is the youngest of the community.🔽The first and the last are the oldest and the youngest of the community.

original: dang po dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan no //
analyzed: dang po dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan no //
translated: The first is the oldest of the community.

original: tha ma ste gang 'og na med cing tha mar gyur pa de ni dge 'dun gyi gzhon rabs so //
analyzed: tha ma ste gang 'og na med cing tha mar gyur pa de ni dge 'dun gyi gzhon rabs so //
translated: The last is the youngest of the community.

original: 'di ltar shi ba'i yo byad dag las aa ru ra la sogs pa cung zhig blangs nas kyang dge 'dun gyi rgan po dang gzhon nu la sbyin par bya ba'am gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar shi ba'i yo byad dag las aa ru ra la sogs pa cung zhig blangs nas kyang dge 'dun gyi rgan po dang gzhon nu la sbyin par bya ba'am gsol bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, having taken a small amount of the deceased’s property, such as myrobalan plums, he should give it to the senior or junior monks or request them to do so.

original: de ni 'di ltar ma bgos kyang bgos pa bzhin du blta bar bya ba yin pas na /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar ma bgos kyang bgos pa bzhin du blta bar bya ba yin pas na /
translated: Since it is to be viewed as if it were distributed even though it is not distributed in this way,

original: gang dag gis phyis 'ongs pa de dag la sbyin par mi bya'i de'i tshe de dag kho nas bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis phyis 'ongs pa de dag la sbyin par mi bya'i de'i tshe de dag kho nas bgo bar bya'o //
translated: it should not be given to those who come later. At that time, only those who are present should distribute it.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i sgo nas bgo bar mi nus pa 'on te 'god par byed na thams cad dbang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas dngos po ji lta ba dang bsam pa bzhin du nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i sgo nas bgo bar mi nus pa 'on te 'god par byed na thams cad dbang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas dngos po ji lta ba dang bsam pa bzhin du nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not possible to distribute it in the way that has just been explained, but it is possible to sell it, then all of it is to be sold.

original: @206a * // 'dis ni gsol ba la sogs pa byas pa'i dus phyis 'ongs pa rnam par gcod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: @206a * // 'dis ni gsol ba la sogs pa byas pa'i dus phyis 'ongs pa rnam par gcod pa yin gyi /
translated: This excludes those who come later after the time of requesting and so on has passed.

original: dus snga mar 'ongs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus snga mar 'ongs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not exclude those who come earlier.

original: gang gi tshe sdom can nad pa'am gzhan dag bdag ji srid 'tsho ba de srid bdag nyid kyi yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sdom can nad pa'am gzhan dag bdag ji srid 'tsho ba de srid bdag nyid kyi yin la /
translated: When a monk is sick, or when others say, “This is mine as long as I live,

original: bdag shi bar gyur na 'di che ge mo zhig la byin cig ces zer ba ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: bdag shi bar gyur na 'di che ge mo zhig la byin cig ces zer ba ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: but when I die, give it to so-and-so,” how can it be understood?

original: bdag shi ba'i 'og tu byin zhes bsngos pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
analyzed: bdag shi ba'i 'og tu byin zhes bsngos pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
translated: The verse says, “The dedication of a gift after one’s death is not a gift.”

original: bdag shi ste bdag zhig par gyur pa'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: bdag shi ste bdag zhig par gyur pa'i 'og tu'o //
translated: “After one’s death” means after the monk’s death, after his destruction.

original: 'di byin zhes bya ba ni sbyin par bsdos nas ji ste de shi bar gyur pa de'i tshe sdom can dag gis byin pa'i rdzas de ni bgo bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di byin zhes bya ba ni sbyin par bsdos nas ji ste de shi bar gyur pa de'i tshe sdom can dag gis byin pa'i rdzas de ni bgo bar bya ste /
translated: “This is given” means that if one promises to give a gift, but then dies, the monk’s gift should be distributed.

original: bgo bsha' dag bya'i de de la sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bgo bsha' dag bya'i de de la sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not to be given to that person.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sdom can bu la sogs pa'i bsam dang bral //
analyzed: sdom can bu la sogs pa'i bsam dang bral //
translated: The verse says, “The monk is free from the intention of a son, etc.

original: re bcas sbyin pa sbyin par mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: re bcas sbyin pa sbyin par mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He does not give a gift with expectation.”

original: bu la sogs pa'i bsam pa ni sred pa de lta bu la sogs pa'i bsam pas bdag shi bar gyur na 'di bu la sogs pa dag gir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sred pa gang yin pa de dang bral ba ste med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu la sogs pa'i bsam pa ni sred pa de lta bu la sogs pa'i bsam pas bdag shi bar gyur na 'di bu la sogs pa dag gir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sred pa gang yin pa de dang bral ba ste med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The thought of children and so on is the thought of craving, the craving that thinks, “If I die, this will belong to my children and so on.”

original: sdom can gang dag ltos pa dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa dag ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ni bdag nyid kyi yin la /
analyzed: sdom can gang dag ltos pa dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa dag ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ni bdag nyid kyi yin la /
translated: Those who are bound by vows give gifts as long as they live, thinking, “This belongs to me.”🔽But when they die, they think, “This belongs to so and so.”

original: shi bar gyur na che ge mo dag gi'o zhes bya ba de ni sbyin pa kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: shi bar gyur na che ge mo dag gi'o zhes bya ba de ni sbyin pa kho na ma yin te /
translated: This is not giving,

original: gang gi phyir khyim pa kho na'i sbyin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyim pa kho na'i sbyin pa yin gyi /
translated: because it is only the giving of householders,

original: rab tu byung ba dag gi ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dag gi ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: not that of those gone forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang khyim pa ni ltos pa dang bcas pas dus 'das par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang khyim pa ni ltos pa dang bcas pas dus 'das par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The Blessed One has said, “Householders are bound by many ties, so they give gifts at the proper time.

original: rab tu byung ba dag ni ltos pa med pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dag ni ltos pa med pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: But those gone forth are free from ties.”

original: nad pas che ge mo 'di la byin cig ces zer ba na gal te bya ba gzhan gyis brel ba byung ba dang / brjed cing g-yengs par gyur nas ma byin na de la ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na /🔽nad pas sbyin par bya bar bskul ba las //
analyzed: nad pas che ge mo 'di la byin cig ces zer ba na gal te bya ba gzhan gyis brel ba byung ba dang / brjed cing g-yengs par gyur nas ma byin na de la ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na / nad pas sbyin par bya bar bskul ba las //
translated: If a patient says, “Give this to so-and-so,” and if the nurse is busy with other duties, or is absentminded and distracted, and does not give it, what should be done?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text reads: “If the patient urges the nurse to give it,

original: 'di la 'di byin par bskul bar gyur pa las /
analyzed: 'di la 'di byin par bskul bar gyur pa las /
translated: “In this case, if the patient urges the nurse to give the medicine,

original: gal te brel ba byung ba ste bya ba gzhan nye bar lhags pa de'i phyir nad g-yog gam gzhan gang gis kyang ma byin na'o //
analyzed: gal te brel ba byung ba ste bya ba gzhan nye bar lhags pa de'i phyir nad g-yog gam gzhan gang gis kyang ma byin na'o //
translated: but the nurse is busy with other duties and does not give it, either by him or herself or through someone else,

original: nad pa de yang shi bar gyur pa de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /🔽shi yang de yi tshig dang mthun par ni //
analyzed: nad pa de yang shi bar gyur pa de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na / shi yang de yi tshig dang mthun par ni //
translated: and the patient dies, what should be done?”

original: sdom can gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sdom can gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text reads: “Even if the patient dies, the monk should act in accordance with his words.

original: shi yang de yi tshig dang mthun @206b par ni //
analyzed: shi yang de yi tshig dang mthun @206b par ni //
translated: “Even if the patient dies” means that even if the patient dies,

original: zhes bya ba ni nad pa'i tshig dang rjes su mthun par ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nad pa'i tshig dang rjes su mthun par ro //
translated: “in accordance with his words” means in accordance with the words of the patient.

original: de'i nor gyi phung po ni de'i rdzas kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: de'i nor gyi phung po ni de'i rdzas kyi phung po ste /
translated: His wealth is his collection of substances.

original: bgo bar mi bya ba dang ltos pa dang bcas pa sbyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas rdzas kyi phung po'i thad de las sdom can rab tu byung ba dag gis sbyin par bya ba yin no //🔽'ga' zhig gis dge 'dun gyi don du sbyin pa byin pa na sdom can rab tu mang ba nyid kyi phyir so sor sbyin par mi nus pas bcu la sogs pa'i sde tshan gyis 'god par byed pa na de las 'ga' zhig shi bar gyur na de'i skal
analyzed: bgo bar mi bya ba dang ltos pa dang bcas pa sbyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas rdzas kyi phung po'i thad de las sdom can rab tu byung ba dag gis sbyin par bya ba yin no // 'ga' zhig gis dge 'dun gyi don du sbyin pa byin pa na sdom can rab tu mang ba nyid kyi phyir so sor sbyin par mi nus pas bcu la sogs pa'i sde tshan gyis 'god par byed pa na de las 'ga' zhig shi bar gyur na de'i skal
translated: With regard to the statement, “One should not distribute it and it is not to be given,” the collection of substances is to be given by those who are renunciate vow holders.

original: ba su dbang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ba su dbang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If someone gives a gift for the sake of the Saṅgha and it is not possible to distribute it individually because there are many renunciate vow holders, and he distributes it to groups of ten or more, if some of them die, to whom does the share of those who have died belong?

original: rang gi sde tshan rdzas ni 'ged pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi sde tshan rdzas ni 'ged pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse text says, “When distributing the substances of one’s group.”

original: sde tshan gang du shi ba de nyid ni rang gi sde tshan te de'i rdzas 'ged cing bgo bsha 'byed pa na rang gi sde tshan gyi sdom can rab tu byung ba shi bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: sde tshan gang du shi ba de nyid ni rang gi sde tshan te de'i rdzas 'ged cing bgo bsha 'byed pa na rang gi sde tshan gyi sdom can rab tu byung ba shi bar gyur na'o //
translated: The group of those who have the same preceptor is called the group of the same class.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: 'dis skal ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis skal ba ste /
translated: The share is the portion of the deceased monk.

original: cha shas ma blangs shing ma mnos pa'i phyir skal ba ma blangs so //
analyzed: cha shas ma blangs shing ma mnos pa'i phyir skal ba ma blangs so //
translated: The share is not taken because it is not accepted or appropriated.

original: shi zhes bya ba ni shi bar gyur pa kho na shi ba zhes bstan pa yin gyi phyis shi bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shi zhes bya ba ni shi bar gyur pa kho na shi ba zhes bstan pa yin gyi phyis shi bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The term “death” indicates that the deceased monk is dead, not that he will die.

original: gzhan du na sdom can shi bar gyur pa de'i la ji ltar gzhan dag bdag po nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na sdom can shi bar gyur pa de'i la ji ltar gzhan dag bdag po nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could others become owners of the share of the deceased monk?

original: de'i tshe 'di sde tshan gang du shi bar gyur pa'i sde tshan de nyid de'i skal ba de dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i skal ba ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di sde tshan gang du shi bar gyur pa'i sde tshan de nyid de'i skal ba de dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i skal ba ste /
translated: The share of the deceased monk belongs to the group of monks in whose group the deceased monk died.

original: thob skal gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyi sde tshan de dbang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thob skal gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyi sde tshan de dbang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the portion that is obtained belongs to the class of that person.

original: nyid ni gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyid ni gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i don to //
translated: The word “only” means “nothing else.”

original: gang gi tshe skal ba thob nas kyang shi bar gyur pa de'i tshe su dbang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skal ba thob nas kyang shi bar gyur pa de'i tshe su dbang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When one obtains a portion and then dies, who then owns it?

original: skal ba thob na shi ba'i skal ba nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skal ba thob na shi ba'i skal ba nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “If one dies after obtaining a portion.”

original: gal te skal ba ste cha shas thob nas shi ba de'i tshe shi bar gyur pas shi ba'i skal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te skal ba ste cha shas thob nas shi ba de'i tshe shi bar gyur pas shi ba'i skal ba nyid yin no //
translated: If one dies after obtaining a portion, then it belongs to the one who died.

original: nyid ni shi ba'i yo byad kho na yin gyi sde tshan gyi ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid ni shi ba'i yo byad kho na yin gyi sde tshan gyi ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word “only” indicates that it belongs to the one who died, not to the class.

original: ni'i sgra ni gong ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gong ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don yin te /
translated: The word “only” distinguishes it from what precedes it.

original: gang gi phyir shi ba'i yo byad yin pa de'i phyir dge 'dun ma lus pa dbang ba yin no zhes bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shi ba'i yo byad yin pa de'i phyir dge 'dun ma lus pa dbang ba yin no zhes bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning is that because it belongs to the one who died, it belongs to the entire saṃgha.

original: de la skal ba phyis 'byung ba len pa las snga ma kho nar shi bar gyur na ni sde tshan de nyid kyir 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la skal ba phyis 'byung ba len pa las snga ma kho nar shi bar gyur na ni sde tshan de nyid kyir 'gyur la /
translated: If one dies before taking one's share, it belongs to that class.

original: skal ba thob nas shi na ni shi ba'i yo byad nyid yin pa'i phyir dge 'dun ma lus pa dbang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: skal ba thob nas shi na ni shi ba'i yo byad nyid yin pa'i phyir dge 'dun ma lus pa dbang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: If one dies after obtaining one's share, it belongs to the Sangha because it is the property of the deceased. This is the summarized meaning.

original: @207a * // gang gi rtsa ba'i bgo bsha' las kyang snga ma kho nar sde tshan gyi nang du shi bar gyur na de dang lhan cig skal ba len pa'i sde tshan du ma byas pa yin la /
analyzed: @207a * // gang gi rtsa ba'i bgo bsha' las kyang snga ma kho nar sde tshan gyi nang du shi bar gyur na de dang lhan cig skal ba len pa'i sde tshan du ma byas pa yin la /
translated: If one dies in the class of monks who are first in line for the distribution of the deceased's robes, then one is not included in the class that takes the share of the deceased.

original: 'on kyang skal ba blangs par gyur pa de lta na yang de nyid du bsdu bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de yang 'di nyid kyis bstan par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: 'on kyang skal ba blangs par gyur pa de lta na yang de nyid du bsdu bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de yang 'di nyid kyis bstan par rig par bya'o /
translated: However, it should be understood that this is also taught by this passage because it is included in the class that takes the share of the deceased.

original: gzhan gyis gzhan la gos la sogs pa bskur ba na gang bdag bo nyid yi na zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan la gos la sogs pa bskur ba na gang bdag bo nyid yi na zhe na /
translated: If one gives robes and so on to another, who then dies, to whom does it belong?

original: gos la sogs pa gzhan du bskur ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
analyzed: gos la sogs pa gzhan du bskur ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
translated: “One should not send one’s robes and so on to another place” and so on.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni sdom can gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan du'o //🔽gos la sogs pa'i rdzas gang yin pa de ni gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni sdom can gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan du'o // gos la sogs pa'i rdzas gang yin pa de ni gos la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Another place” means to another place that is the sign of another monastic.🔽“Robes and so on” means the substances of robes and so on.

original: gos la sogs pa yang da yin la bskur ba yang yin pas na gos la sogs pa ba skur ba na'o //
analyzed: gos la sogs pa yang da yin la bskur ba yang yin pas na gos la sogs pa ba skur ba na'o //
translated: “Sending robes and so on” means sending robes and so on.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gzhan dang grong gzhan dag tu zhes shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gzhan dang grong gzhan dag tu zhes shes par bya ste /
translated: “In the same way” should be understood as “in another monastery and another town.”

original: gang rab tu byung ba de la bskur ba ni zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang rab tu byung ba de la bskur ba ni zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “One should not send to that renunciate” should be applied.

original: gos la sogs ba gang la bskur ba de nyid kyis yin te /
analyzed: gos la sogs ba gang la bskur ba de nyid kyis yin te /
translated: “That very one” is the one to whom the robes and so on are sent.

original: de'i 'di yin bas na de nyid kyi'o zhes bya bas ni nges par gzung ba dang rim pa gzhan du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'di yin bas na de nyid kyi'o zhes bya bas ni nges par gzung ba dang rim pa gzhan du bstan pa'o //
translated: “That very one’s” indicates ascertainment and teaches in a different order.

original: ni'i sgra ni dngos po bskur ba'i rim pa ni 'di yin no zhes snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni dngos po bskur ba'i rim pa ni 'di yin no zhes snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
translated: The word “also” means that the procedure for transferring the object is as follows: it is for the purpose of distinguishing it from the previous case.

original: 'on te mi 'dod na gang bdag po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mi 'dod na gang bdag po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: But if he does not want it, who is the owner?

original: gal te bskur ba na gang la bskur ba de ma 'dod na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te bskur ba na gang la bskur ba de ma 'dod na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If he does not want the object that is being transferred, then it is as stated.

original: gos la sogs pa bskur ba gang yin pa de ni bskur ba po de nyid dbang ba ste bdag po yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gos la sogs pa bskur ba gang yin pa de ni bskur ba po de nyid dbang ba ste bdag po yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The object that is being transferred, such as clothing, is owned by the one who is transferring it.

original: 'on te de yang ji ste mi 'dod pa ste bdag gis de la btang ba yin no zhes de ltar gos la sogs pa dag mi 'dod kyang gos la sogs pa 'di nyid bskur ba po nyid dbang ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o
analyzed: 'on te de yang ji ste mi 'dod pa ste bdag gis de la btang ba yin no zhes de ltar gos la sogs pa dag mi 'dod kyang gos la sogs pa 'di nyid bskur ba po nyid dbang ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o
translated: But if he does not want it, if he thinks, “I have given it to him,” then even though he does not want the clothing, etc., the clothing, etc. is owned by the one who is transferring it.

original: // nyid ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: // nyid ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The word “also” is as before.

original: de la 'di ni bskur ba yang dag par sbyin pa ma spangs par shi bar gyur pa de'i tshe de'i yin no zhes shi ba'i yo byad du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ni bskur ba yang dag par sbyin pa ma spangs par shi bar gyur pa de'i tshe de'i yin no zhes shi ba'i yo byad du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If the one who is to be given the gift dies without relinquishing it, then it belongs to the one who is to receive it.

original: 'on te bskur ba po shi bar gyur na de'i yin no zhes byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te bskur ba po shi bar gyur na de'i yin no zhes byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o //
translated: But if the one who is to receive the gift dies, then it belongs to the one who has relinquished it.

original: byin gyis rlob par byed na byin gyis ma brlabs par 'gyur la yang dag par byin pa spangs na ni phyin ci log ma yin te don dam par de nyid kho na'i yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob par byed na byin gyis ma brlabs par 'gyur la yang dag par byin pa spangs na ni phyin ci log ma yin te don dam par de nyid kho na'i yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: If one consecrates it, it is not consecrated. If one relinquishes the gift, it is not erroneous, because it belongs to the one who has relinquished it in the ultimate sense. This is the condensed meaning.

original: yid gcugs pas longs spyod pa la yang tshul 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: yid gcugs pas longs spyod pa la yang tshul 'di nyid yin no //
translated: This rule also applies to the enjoyment of property by a trusted person.

original: @207b shi ba'i yo byad gang dbang ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: @207b shi ba'i yo byad gang dbang ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the property of the dead?

original: 'dra ba yod na shi ba'i gos rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dra ba yod na shi ba'i gos rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If there is a relative, the dead person’s clothes and so on.

original: shi ba'i gos rnams ni shi ba'i gos dag ste de dag dbang ba min /
analyzed: shi ba'i gos rnams ni shi ba'i gos dag ste de dag dbang ba min /
translated: The dead person’s clothes are the clothes of the dead. They do not belong to the relative.

original: dbang ba ni bdag por gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang ba ni bdag por gyur pa yin la /
translated: The dominant condition is the master.

original: dbang ba ma yin pa ni dbang ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ba ma yin pa ni dbang ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The non-dominant is the non-master.

original: de'i dngos ni dbang ba ma yin pa nyid do ;
analyzed: de'i dngos ni dbang ba ma yin pa nyid do ;
translated: The nature of that is non-dominance.

original: / gang zhe na tha dad gyur pa'i mtshan ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: / gang zhe na tha dad gyur pa'i mtshan ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is that? He says: the sign of differentiation.

original: 'dis mtshon par byed pas na mtshan te skyes pa dang bud med dag gi dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'dis mtshon par byed pas na mtshan te skyes pa dang bud med dag gi dbang po'o //
