analyzed: med na yang dag par blangs nas so //🔽da yang med na de bzhin gshegs pa'i gser la sogs pa'i dbyig las so //
translated: The sick person who is without wealth means the sick person who is without wealth.🔽The sick person who is without wealth

original: de yang med na de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyan gyis bsdud par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang med na de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyan gyis bsdud par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: If that is not available, then one should make a collection with the ornaments of the Tathagata.

original: sman zong 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi de'i ched du bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba la yang bstud par bya'o zhes bya bar yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sman zong 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi de'i ched du bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba la yang bstud par bya'o zhes bya bar yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: And it should be understood that this is not just for the sake of medicine, but also for the sake of worship and service to the Lord.

original: rang bzhin du gnas par gyur pas bya ba ni sos par gyur nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas par gyur pas bya ba ni sos par gyur nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The action for one who is in his normal state is stated by “having recovered, etc.”

original: sos pa'i dngos po ni sos pa nyid de der gyur pa na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkor blangs pa de slar yang bsab par bya'o //
analyzed: sos pa'i dngos po ni sos pa nyid de der gyur pa na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkor blangs pa de slar yang bsab par bya'o //
translated: The state of recovery is recovery itself. Having become that, having taken the wealth of the Tathagata, one should repay it.

original: ni'i sgra ni snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don yin no //
translated: The word “even” has the sense of distinguishing from the previous.

original: nor dang bral ba'i nad pas blangs pa sos par gyur nas bsab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nor yod pa la 'di nges pa yin no //
analyzed: nor dang bral ba'i nad pas blangs pa sos par gyur nas bsab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nor yod pa la 'di nges pa yin no //
translated: “Having recovered, one who has taken it when poor should repay it” is definite for one who has wealth.

original: nor med gyur na de la nyes pa med //
analyzed: nor med gyur na de la nyes pa med //
translated: “If one does not have wealth, there is no fault.”

original: ces bya ba ni sdom can la'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sdom can la'o //
translated: This is for one who is in the vow.

original: yod pa ma yin pa ni med pa ste tha na bslang ba'i sgo nas kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa ni med pa ste tha na bslang ba'i sgo nas kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Nonexistent means nonexistent, even in the sense of being taken as a share.

original: pha'i nor la rigs pas bu dbang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: pha'i nor la rigs pas bu dbang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: This is stated from the perspective of a son having a right to his father's wealth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge 'dun gyi don du yul dang zhing yongs su blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas de la dge 'dun gyi yul du nyes pa las byung ba'i rgyal po'i skal bslang du rung ngam 'on te ma yin snyam du dogs pa la /🔽nyes bcu la sogs chos kun smra ba ni //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽nyes pa yang de nyid yin la bcu yang yin pas na nyes bcu'o //🔽de la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni nyes bcu la sogs te /🔽gang dag byung ba de dag yod na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge 'dun gyi don du yul dang zhing yongs su blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas de la dge 'dun gyi yul du nyes pa las byung ba'i rgyal po'i skal bslang du rung ngam 'on te ma yin snyam du dogs pa la / nyes bcu la sogs chos kun smra ba ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / nyes pa yang de nyid yin la bcu yang yin pas na nyes bcu'o // de la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni nyes bcu la sogs te / gang dag byung ba de dag yod na /
translated: Since the Bhagavān stated that one should take a country and field for the sake of the Saṅgha, one may wonder whether it is suitable to take a share of the king's property in a country that has been taken over by the Saṅgha or not.

original: rgyal pos gnang na rgyal po'i skal ba ni /
analyzed: rgyal pos gnang na rgyal po'i skal ba ni /
translated: One should not take a share of the king's property🔽in a country that has been taken over by the Saṅgha.🔽One should not take a share of the king's property in a country that has been taken over by the Saṅgha.🔽One should not take a share of the king's property in a country that has been taken over by the Saṅgha.🔽One should not take a share of the king's property in a country that has been taken over by the Saṅgha.🔽One should not take a share of the king's property in a country that has been taken over by the Saṅgha.🔽One should not take a share of the king's property in a country that has been taken over by the Saṅgha.

original: blang bar bya ba ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “that which is to be accepted” is to be supplied here.

original: rgyal po'i skal ba ni rgyal po'i skal ba ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i skal ba ni rgyal po'i skal ba ste /
translated: The king’s share is the portion of the king.

original: rgyal pos nyes pa las thob cing byin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal pos nyes pa las thob cing byin pa'o //
translated: The king’s share is that which is obtained and given by the king as a punishment.

original: rgyal pos rjes su gnang ba ni rgyal pos gnang ba ste /
analyzed: rgyal pos rjes su gnang ba ni rgyal pos gnang ba ste /
translated: The king’s permission is the permission of the king.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya bas 'gro ba dang bral ba'i yo byad du zhes bya pa'i don to //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya bas 'gro ba dang bral ba'i yo byad du zhes bya pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase “of the Saṅgha” means “that which is not used by individuals.”

original: rgyal pos gnang ba dang rgyal po'i skal ba dag ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyal pos gnang ba dang rgyal po'i skal ba dag ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “the king’s permission and the king’s share” is a special inclusion.🔽The phrase “that which is to be accepted” is a special inclusion.

original: de blang ba dag kyang khyad par du byed de chos dang ldan pas smras pa de bas na de zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de blang ba dag kyang khyad par du byed de chos dang ldan pas smras pa de bas na de zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase “that which is spoken by one who is righteous” is a remainder of the words.

original: 'dir chos dang ldan pa ni chos bstan bcos smra ba po ste drang song yid la sogs @210b bdag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir chos dang ldan pa ni chos bstan bcos smra ba po ste drang song yid la sogs @210b bdag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this context, one who is righteous is one who teaches the Dharma, and one who is not righteous is one who teaches what is contrary to the Dharma.

original: chos kyi gzhir gnas pa ma yin pa de dag ni snga nas chos ma yin pa smra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi gzhir gnas pa ma yin pa de dag ni snga nas chos ma yin pa smra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are not righteous are not established in the basis of the Dharma because they are not teachers of the Dharma.

original: blang bar ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi skabs ma yin pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi bya ba la 'jug pa'i dge tshul gyis zhes bya bar shugs kyis 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: blang bar ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi skabs ma yin pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi bya ba la 'jug pa'i dge tshul gyis zhes bya bar shugs kyis 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase to take up is understood to mean to take up the duties of the Saṅgha, because it is not the proper time for the other.

original: de la nyes bcu ni rna ba gcod pa dang / gzhan gyi chung ma nyed pa la sogs pa yin par gzung ste /
analyzed: de la nyes bcu ni rna ba gcod pa dang / gzhan gyi chung ma nyed pa la sogs pa yin par gzung ste /
translated: The ten faults are to cut off ears, to take another's wife, and so on.

original: 'jig rten gyi grags pa dag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi grags pa dag las shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood from the statements of worldly renown.

original: de la rtsod pa'i dus su dge bsnyen dag rab tu sbyar bar bya ba yin pas na //
analyzed: de la rtsod pa'i dus su dge bsnyen dag rab tu sbyar bar bya ba yin pas na //
translated: In this regard, the lay practitioner is to be employed in the time of dispute.

original: brtsad 'grub par ni brtsad pa nyid //
analyzed: brtsad 'grub par ni brtsad pa nyid //
translated: The dispute itself is established by the dispute.

original: brtsad pas grub pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtsad pas grub pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established by the dispute.

original: rdzas de ci'i phyir blta bar mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas de ci'i phyir blta bar mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why is that substance not to be seen?

original: sdom can te rab tu byung ba lta bar ston pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' ma gnang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sdom can te rab tu byung ba lta bar ston pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' ma gnang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the Blessed Teacher did not permit the ordained, the one with vows, to see it.

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba yin te kho na'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba yin te kho na'i don to //
translated: The word eva has the meaning of niyama, or only.

original: gang gi phyir sdom can rtsod pa lta bur byed pa tshul ma yin pa de'i phyir dge bsnyen nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sdom can rtsod pa lta bur byed pa tshul ma yin pa de'i phyir dge bsnyen nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Since it is improper to act like a monk who is a litigant, therefore the layperson should be definitely appointed.

original: de la yang dag par 'byung ba chos dang ldan pa'i rgyal po'i skal ba rgyal pos gnang ba sa gzhi dang 'dra bar bsam pa dag pas ma byin par len pa'i nyes pa spangs pas len par byed pa la nyes pa med do zhes de lta bu'i rnam🔽pa'i tshig tu 'di rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dag par 'byung ba chos dang ldan pa'i rgyal po'i skal ba rgyal pos gnang ba sa gzhi dang 'dra bar bsam pa dag pas ma byin par len pa'i nyes pa spangs pas len par byed pa la nyes pa med do zhes de lta bu'i rnam pa'i tshig tu 'di rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: In that case, for a king who is a righteous lord, the portion of the king's land is like the earth. With a pure intention, by abandoning the fault of taking what is not given, there is no fault in taking it. Thus, this is the way it is established.

original: khab ral la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas dge 'dun gyi sa gzhi la dngos po ltung ba mthong ba ji ltar bya ba de ston par byed de khab dang por byas pa'i rab tu byung ba'i yo byad gzhan gang yin pa de ni khab ral la
analyzed: khab ral la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas dge 'dun gyi sa gzhi la dngos po ltung ba mthong ba ji ltar bya ba de ston par byed de khab dang por byas pa'i rab tu byung ba'i yo byad gzhan gang yin pa de ni khab ral la
translated: With needle, awl, etc., it shows what to do when seeing a fallen thing on the Saṅgha's land. Needle is the first of the requisites of a renunciant. Whatever other things there are, they are needle, awl, etc.

original: sogs pa'o // khab la sogs pa yang de yin la rdzas spyad kyang de yin pas khab ral la sogs te /
analyzed: sogs pa'o // khab la sogs pa yang de yin la rdzas spyad kyang de yin pas khab ral la sogs te /
translated: Needle, etc. are also that, and also used as substances. Therefore, needle, awl, etc.

original: dge 'dun gyi 'am mchod rten gyis gzhir ltung ba mthong bar gyur na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi 'am mchod rten gyis gzhir ltung ba mthong bar gyur na /
translated: If a monk sees that a robe or a bowl has fallen in the dwelling place of the community or in the stūpa,

original: dge tshul gyis khang skyong dag la bshad ma thag pa de gtad par bya'o //
analyzed: dge tshul gyis khang skyong dag la bshad ma thag pa de gtad par bya'o //
translated: the novice should give it to the caretaker of the dwelling place.

original: ni'i sgra ni khyad par du byed pa'i don te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni khyad par du byed pa'i don te /
translated: The word “or” has the sense of “in particular.”

original: lhung ba de bdag po las yongs su lhung bar gyur ba mthong bar gyur pas so //
analyzed: lhung ba de bdag po las yongs su lhung bar gyur ba mthong bar gyur pas so //
translated: The fallen object should be given to the owner, because it was seen to have fallen from his possession.

original: khang skyong gis kyang khab ral la sogs pa de blangs nas 'di gang gi yin zhes bsgrags nas tshogs te dge 'dun la kha ba ral la sogs pa de dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: khang skyong gis kyang khab ral la sogs pa de blangs nas 'di gang gi yin zhes bsgrags nas tshogs te dge 'dun la kha ba ral la sogs pa de dbul bar bya'o //
translated: The caretaker of the dwelling place should take the needle case and so on, announce “This belongs to so-and-so,” and give it to the community.

original: gang la bsgrags nas she na /
analyzed: gang la bsgrags nas she na /
translated: To whom should it be announced?

original: tshogs kyi nang du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshogs kyi nang du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “in the midst of the community.”

original: tshogs kyi nang dang re re la zhes bya ba 'dir yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi nang dang re re la zhes bya ba 'dir yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “in the midst of the community or to each individual” should be supplied here.

original: ci de lta de lta nyid du dbul bar bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci de lta de lta nyid du dbul bar bya'am zhe na /
translated: Should it be given to the owner in any case?

original: ji ste bdag po med na zhes bya ba smos @211a * //
analyzed: ji ste bdag po med na zhes bya ba smos @211a * //
translated: The text says, “If there is no owner.”

original: te ; gal te bdag po 'ba' zhig gis shes pa med par gyur pa de'i tshe dbul bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: te ; gal te bdag po 'ba' zhig gis shes pa med par gyur pa de'i tshe dbul bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If the owner comes alone, without any knowledge of the loss, then he should be told: “You are poor.”

original: ci zhig byas nas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas she na /
translated: What is done?

original: de'i 'ong ba bsdad nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i 'ong ba bsdad nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says: “Having waited for his return.”

original: khab ral la sogs pa de'i bdag po 'ong ba ni de'i 'ong ba ste de la bsdad nas so //
analyzed: khab ral la sogs pa de'i bdag po 'ong ba ni de'i 'ong ba ste de la bsdad nas so //
translated: The return of the owner of the needle case, etc. is his return. Having waited for that,

original: dus ji srid cig tu zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig tu zhe na /
translated: for how long?

original: nyi ma gsum du zhes bya ba smos te nyi ma gsum du ni nyi ma gsum dag tu'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gsum du zhes bya ba smos te nyi ma gsum du ni nyi ma gsum dag tu'o //
translated: The text says: “for three days.”

original: yang gi sgra ni gang gis mthong ba des dge skos la gtad par bya zhing des kyang 'di gang gi yin zhes bsgrag par bya'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni gang gis mthong ba des dge skos la gtad par bya zhing des kyang 'di gang gi yin zhes bsgrag par bya'o //
translated: The word “also” indicates that the one who sees it should turn it over to the saṅgha’s chief of stewards, and that he should also proclaim: “This belongs to someone.”

original: dang gong ma ni sdud par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: dang gong ma ni sdud par byed pa yin la /
translated: The first “also” is a summary,

original: gnyis pa ni tshig gi kha bskang ba ste bsgrag pa dang nyi ma gsum du bsdad par bya zhes sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni tshig gi kha bskang ba ste bsgrag pa dang nyi ma gsum du bsdad par bya zhes sdud pa yin no //
translated: and the second “also” is a supplement to the words. The summary is: “He should proclaim it and wait for three days.”

original: dngul la sogs pa mthong bar gyur pa gang yin ba de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dngul la sogs pa mthong bar gyur pa gang yin ba de brjod par bya ste /
translated: One should state what is seen, such as silver.

original: dngul dang por byas pa'i gser la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni dngul la sogs so //
analyzed: dngul dang por byas pa'i gser la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni dngul la sogs so //
translated: That which is made of silver first, such as gold, is silver, etc.

original: de ltung ba mthong na yang ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltung ba mthong na yang ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If one sees a downfall, what should one do?

original: mdzod du bcug ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mdzod du bcug ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “put it in the treasury.”

original: mdzod du bcug pa ni dge 'dun gyi bang mdzod du gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mdzod du bcug pa ni dge 'dun gyi bang mdzod du gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Put it in the treasury means one should place it in the saṃgha’s storehouse.

original: dus ji srid cig tu zhen /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig tu zhen /
translated: For how long a time?

original: zla ba drug tu zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zla ba drug tu zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “for six months.”

original: zla bdag gi drug ni zla ba drug tu'o //
analyzed: zla bdag gi drug ni zla ba drug tu'o //
translated: Six of one’s own months is for six months.

original: ni'i sgra ni khab ral sogs pa la khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni khab ral sogs pa la khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
translated: The word ni is for the purpose of making a distinction with respect to needles, knives, etc.

original: ci zhig byas nas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas she na /
translated: What should one do?

original: zhag brgyad bar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhag brgyad bar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, “for eight days, etc.”

original: nor gyi bdag po'i 'ong ba zhag brgyad kyi bar du bsdad nas te zhag brgyad kyi 'og tu mdzod du gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nor gyi bdag po'i 'ong ba zhag brgyad kyi bar du bsdad nas te zhag brgyad kyi 'og tu mdzod du gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The owner of the wealth should come within eight days, and after eight days, the treasure should be placed in a treasury.

original: dang ni mthong nas zhes bya ba sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dang ni mthong nas zhes bya ba sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: The word “and” is a conjunction.

original: dus der ma 'ongs na zla ba drug po 'di'i 'og tu rdzas de snod du bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o ;
analyzed: dus der ma 'ongs na zla ba drug po 'di'i 'og tu rdzas de snod du bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o ;
translated: If it does not come at that time, then after these six months, the substance should be collected in a vessel. This is the remainder of the sentence.

original: / ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba dang / rim pa gzhan gyi don yin te snod smos pa ni yun ring por gnas pa'i rdzas spyad nye bar mtshon pa yin pa de bas na yun ring por gnas pa gang yin pa de'i yo byad snod tsam ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to
analyzed: / ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba dang / rim pa gzhan gyi don yin te snod smos pa ni yun ring por gnas pa'i rdzas spyad nye bar mtshon pa yin pa de bas na yun ring por gnas pa gang yin pa de'i yo byad snod tsam ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to
translated: The word “only” has the meaning of restriction and another order. The mention of the vessel indicates that the substance that remains for a long time is a means of subsistence. Therefore, the meaning of the restriction is that whatever remains for a long time, its means is not just a vessel.

original: // dge 'dun gyis gzhi la 'di nges pa yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi ni rgyan du byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod par bya'o zhes shugs kyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: // dge 'dun gyis gzhi la 'di nges pa yin gyi sangs rgyas kyi ni rgyan du byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod par bya'o zhes shugs kyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: The Sangha is certain with regard to the basis, but the Buddha is to be worshipped by making offerings to him, as if he were an ornament.

original: de nas ji ste 'ongs nas slong na yang /
analyzed: de nas ji ste 'ongs nas slong na yang /
translated: If he comes and asks for it,🔽then it should be given, for there is no interest.

original: 'on kyang sbyin par bya ste skyed ni med ces bya ba la de nas te zla ba drug gi 'og tu snod du byas pa'i dus phyis de gal te 'ga' zhig nas 'ongs nas kyang slong bar byed @211b pa de lta na nga sbyin par bya'o zhes bya🔽ba ni ji ltar yang rdzas de snod du byas par gyur pa de lta na yang sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on kyang sbyin par bya ste skyed ni med ces bya ba la de nas te zla ba drug gi 'og tu snod du byas pa'i dus phyis de gal te 'ga' zhig nas 'ongs nas kyang slong bar byed @211b pa de lta na nga sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yang rdzas de snod du byas par gyur pa de lta na yang sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If he comes and asks for it after the six months, then it should be given.🔽If he asks for interest, saying, “You have used it for this long,”

original: gal te khyod kyis dus 'di srid du longs spyad pa yin no zhes skyed slong bar byed na ci sbyin par bya 'am zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis dus 'di srid du longs spyad pa yin no zhes skyed slong bar byed na ci sbyin par bya 'am zhe na /
translated: then what should be done?

original: skyed ni med ces bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: skyed ni med ces bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: He should say, “There is no interest.”

original: ni ni skyed sbyin par mi bya ba kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: ni ni skyed sbyin par mi bya ba kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word “only” in the verse means that one should not use the wood for one’s own purposes.

original: las sar byed pas spyad du mi rung zhing //🔽rnyed de de yis gnang na blang bar bya //
analyzed: las sar byed pas spyad du mi rung zhing // rnyed de de yis gnang na blang bar bya //
translated: The wood is not to be used if it is needed for the community’s work.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the worker gives permission, it may be taken.

original: dge 'dun gyi las sar ba la mkho ba'i shing bdag gir byas pa ma yin pa /🔽gal te las sar pa la mkho ba ma yin pa dag las sar byed pa las rnyed par gyur pa de'i tshe las sar byed pa des gnang na spyad du mi rung ba'i shing de blang bar bya'i /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi las sar ba la mkho ba'i shing bdag gir byas pa ma yin pa / gal te las sar pa la mkho ba ma yin pa dag las sar byed pa las rnyed par gyur pa de'i tshe las sar byed pa des gnang na spyad du mi rung ba'i shing de blang bar bya'i /
translated: The wood is not to be used if it is needed for the community’s work.🔽If the wood is not needed for the community’s work, but the worker finds it and gives permission to use it, then the wood may be taken.

original: de lta de ltar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta de ltar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But if the worker does not give permission, it is not to be used.

original: de ltar bdag po tha dad ces bya ba 'dis ni sngar bshad pa'i mdor bsdu ba ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar bdag po tha dad ces bya ba 'dis ni sngar bshad pa'i mdor bsdu ba ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: This verse shows the summary of the previous discussion.

original: mi 'am ri dags zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pas bdag po'i dbye ba ste nor gyi bdag po'i dbye ba brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: mi 'am ri dags zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pas bdag po'i dbye ba ste nor gyi bdag po'i dbye ba brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase the classification of the master means the classification of the owner of the wealth. The phrase the classification of the master is a remainder of the statement that was just explained.

original: de nas nyes byas kyi zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba ni dbang du byed pa'i don te /
analyzed: de nas nyes byas kyi zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba ni dbang du byed pa'i don te /
translated: Then, the phrase the classification of the offense means in relation to that. The phrase in relation to that has the sense of being under the control of that.

original: 'di man chad nas yid brtan gzhan la zhes bya ba de'i gong ma'i bar ni nyes byas kyis rab tu dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di man chad nas yid brtan gzhan la zhes bya ba de'i gong ma'i bar ni nyes byas kyis rab tu dbye ba yin te /
translated: From here on, the text up to the phrase, “one should rely on another,” is the classification of the offense.

original: 'di nas ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nas ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod pa yin no //
translated: The text from here on explains that.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar ston pa'i don te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar ston pa'i don te /
translated: The word “how” has the sense of teaching.

original: nyes byas de gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes byas de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that offense?

original: ma bos par ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma bos par ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says, “if one eats food without being invited.”

original: ma bos pa ni mgron du ma bos pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: ma bos pa ni mgron du ma bos pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: “Not being invited” means not being invited as a guest.

original: de la 'am des zan zos pa ni ma bor bar ni zan zos pa ste ;
analyzed: de la 'am des zan zos pa ni ma bor bar ni zan zos pa ste ;
translated: “Eating food” means eating food there or by that.

original: nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase “one commits an offense of wrong conduct” is supplied from the previous verse.

original: zan ni rnam pa gnyis te mgron du bos pa dang ma bos pa'o //
analyzed: zan ni rnam pa gnyis te mgron du bos pa dang ma bos pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of meals: those to which one is invited and those to which one is not invited.

original: de la mgron du bos pa la ni nyes par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes shes par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la mgron du bos pa la ni nyes par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes shes par 'gyur na /
translated: If one understands that there is no offense for eating at an invitation,

original: ma bos pa la ji ltar nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ma bos pa la ji ltar nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how is there an offense for eating at a meal to which one has not been invited?

original: bza' ba de'i dbye ba yang rnam pa gnyis te de nyid la ngan ngon tsam dang / khyad par du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bza' ba de'i dbye ba yang rnam pa gnyis te de nyid la ngan ngon tsam dang / khyad par du byed pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of meals to which one is invited: those that are ordinary and those that are special.

original: de la khyad par du byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la khyad par du byed pa ni /
translated: A special meal is one🔽that is offered by a king,

original: mi dbang bsod snyoms yongs blangs gyur //
analyzed: mi dbang bsod snyoms yongs blangs gyur //
translated: a king’s minister, or a wealthy merchant.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas ches lci bar gyur to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas ches lci bar gyur to //
translated: In this case, the offense is serious.

original: gang de nyid du zan zos pa de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽yon bdag gis ngas spyan ma drangs @212a * //
analyzed: gang de nyid du zan zos pa de la yang rnam pa gnyis te / yon bdag gis ngas spyan ma drangs @212a * //
translated: There are two kinds of meals that one eats in one’s own home:🔽those that are known to be for a specific person and those that are not.

original: pa yin no zhes shes par 'gyur ba der bza' ba'i don du 'gro bar byed pa la sogs pa la ni nyes byas su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa yin no zhes shes par 'gyur ba der bza' ba'i don du 'gro bar byed pa la sogs pa la ni nyes byas su mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one goes to eat at a meal that is known to be for a specific person, but one thinks, “The donor has not invited me,” there is no offense.

original: bza' ba la nyes pa med par rjes su gnang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bza' ba la nyes pa med par rjes su gnang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is permitted that there is no offense in eating them.

original: mi shes pa la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas de skad du smras pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas de skad du smras pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is said with reference to the offense of wrong-doing for one who is ignorant.

original: rgya sogs zin pas gzir ba de dag las //
analyzed: rgya sogs zin pas gzir ba de dag las //
translated: Those who are oppressed by being caught in traps and so on,

original: rgya dang por byas pa'i 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa gzhan gang yin pa de ni rgya sogs te /
analyzed: rgya dang por byas pa'i 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa gzhan gang yin pa de ni rgya sogs te /
translated: those who are caught in traps and so on, and those who are caught in other devices such as nets, etc.,

original: des zin pa ni rgya la sogs pas zin cing rnam par bcings par gyur pa de nyid sdug bsngal yin pa des gzir bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des zin pa ni rgya la sogs pas zin cing rnam par bcings par gyur pa de nyid sdug bsngal yin pa des gzir bar gyur pa'o //
translated: are oppressed by that very suffering of being caught in traps and so on, and being bound.

original: gang zhe na /🔽bsod nams sems kyis srog chags thar byas na //
analyzed: gang zhe na / bsod nams sems kyis srog chags thar byas na //
translated: What is that?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The Sūtra says, “Having liberated a living being with a compassionate mind,🔽one should establish it in the fruit of a stream-enterer.”

original: srog 'dzin par byed pa gang yin pa de ni srog chags te /
analyzed: srog 'dzin par byed pa gang yin pa de ni srog chags te /
translated: A living being is one who holds life.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i srog chags de dag bsod nams kyi bsam pas rgya la sogs pa las thar par byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma ste /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i srog chags de dag bsod nams kyi bsam pas rgya la sogs pa las thar par byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma ste /
translated: This is the remainder of the sentence.

original: bsod nams kyi sems kyis zhes bya ba'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi sems kyis zhes bya ba'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood to mean with a meritorious mind.

original: dad pas rgyal ba'i ring bsrel brkus te min //
analyzed: dad pas rgyal ba'i ring bsrel brkus te min //
translated: One does not steal the relics of the Victor out of faith.

original: zhes bya ba sngar bstan pas de la dad pas brkus na nyes byas su 'gyur bar ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba sngar bstan pas de la dad pas brkus na nyes byas su 'gyur bar ston te /
translated: This is taught by the previous verse.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das la mos pa ni de la mos pa ste /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das la mos pa ni de la mos pa ste /
translated: There, faith in the Bhagavat is devotion to him.

original: des de nyid la mchod pa'i phyir te /🔽dgos pas rku bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni de la mos pas mchod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de nyid la mchod pa'i phyir te / dgos pas rku bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni de la mos pas mchod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the purpose of worshiping him.🔽One who steals for a purpose does so out of devotion to him.🔽The state of that is the very devotion to him for the purpose of worship.

original: de'i dngos po ni de la mos pas mchod pa'i phyir nyid yin pa de'i phyir des brkus na nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de la mos pas mchod pa'i phyir nyid yin pa de'i phyir des brkus na nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one steals for that purpose, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dang ni snga ma 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi 'di la yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ni snga ma 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi 'di la yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “and” is used to include the previous statement, “it is also a misdeed.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi ring bsril de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ring bsril de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between the relics of the Buddha and the relics of the Dharma?

original: rin thang med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rin thang med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says, “the priceless relics of the Buddha and the priceless Dharma.”

original: gang la rin thang gi tshad med pa de ni rin thang med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la rin thang gi tshad med pa de ni rin thang med pa ste /
translated: That which has no price is priceless.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel gang yin pa de ni rin thang med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel gang yin pa de ni rin thang med pa'o //
translated: The relics of the Buddha are priceless.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgras 'di skad du de la sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel la 'di ni 'di ri'o zhes bya bas rin thang med pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgras 'di skad du de la sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel la 'di ni 'di ri'o zhes bya bas rin thang med pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The word “and” in the phrase “the relics of the Buddha and the relics of the Dharma” indicates that the relics of the Dharma are also priceless.

original: de ltar yang mdo mdzad pas /
analyzed: de ltar yang mdo mdzad pas /
translated: The author of the sutra says:

original: dkon mchog ni mtshungs pa mad pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog ni mtshungs pa mad pa'o //
translated: The jewels are incomparable.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel yang zhes bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel yang zhes bstan te /
translated: Here, the relics of the Buddha are also called jewels.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas la yang mchod pa'i bsam pas rku bar byed na nyes byas kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas la yang mchod pa'i bsam pas rku bar byed na nyes byas kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, if one steals with the intention of making offerings to the Buddha, it is only a wrong action.

original: @212b dngos gzhir ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @212b dngos gzhir ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not a root downfall.

original: de ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar sngar nyes byas su 'gyur ba dag yin pa de ltar 'di dag kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de ltar gyi sgra yin la /
analyzed: de ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar sngar nyes byas su 'gyur ba dag yin pa de ltar 'di dag kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de ltar gyi sgra yin la /
translated: The word “thus” and so on indicates that just as the previous actions are wrong actions, so too are these.

original: yang ni sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang ni sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “also” includes the following.

original: ni ni 'khrul 'khor gyi khyad par te ri dgas la sogs pa gsad pa'i phyir byas pa yin no //
analyzed: ni ni 'khrul 'khor gyi khyad par te ri dgas la sogs pa gsad pa'i phyir byas pa yin no //
translated: The word “even” refers to a special trap, which is made for the purpose of killing deer and so on.

original: 'dis rnam par bshig pas na rnam par bshig pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis rnam par bshig pas na rnam par bshig pa ste /
translated: Since it destroys, it is a destruction.

original: rgya la sogs pa dag yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya la sogs pa dag yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is a snare and so on.

original: rnyi dang rnam par bshig pa dag ni rnyi dang rnam par bshig pa ste /
analyzed: rnyi dang rnam par bshig pa dag ni rnyi dang rnam par bshig pa ste /
translated: Snares and destruction are snares and destruction.

original: de dang por byas pa'i sems can gsod par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan gang yin pa de ma rung bar byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang por byas pa'i sems can gsod par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan gang yin pa de ma rung bar byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one renders that other cause of killing sentient beings that was done first unworkable, then there is an offense.

original: gang gi dbang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis she na /
translated: By whose power?

original: snying rje'i dbang gis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: snying rje'i dbang gis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “by the power of compassion.”

original: snying rje de sems can rnams la brtse ba de'i dbang ni de la rag las pa de'i phyir snying rje'i dbang des rnyi la sogs pa ma rung bar byas pa de lta bu de dag gis nyes byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: snying rje de sems can rnams la brtse ba de'i dbang ni de la rag las pa de'i phyir snying rje'i dbang des rnyi la sogs pa ma rung bar byas pa de lta bu de dag gis nyes byas su 'gyur te /
translated: That compassion is the affection for sentient beings. The power of that is dependent on that. Therefore, by the power of that compassion, if one renders a trap, etc. unworkable in that way, there is an offense.

original: snying rje'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying rje'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: by the power of compassion.

original: phug ron dang por byas pa'i bye'u la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni phug ron la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phug ron dang por byas pa'i bye'u la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni phug ron la sogs pa'o //
translated: The first pigeon, etc. that was done is the pigeon, etc.

original: de'i khyim gang yin pa de 'joms pa gang yin pa de dang por byas pa'i mes bsregs pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni tshang 'jig par byed pa la sogs pas nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de'i khyim gang yin pa de 'joms pa gang yin pa de dang por byas pa'i mes bsregs pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni tshang 'jig par byed pa la sogs pas nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The first of these is the destruction of the house, and the rest are the destruction of the nest and so on.

original: de dag las kyang nyes med brjod par bya //
analyzed: de dag las kyang nyes med brjod par bya //
translated: And from among those, the non-offenses should be stated.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyes byas su brjod pa de dag las 'og tu nyes pa med pa yang brjod par bya zhing bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyes byas su brjod pa de dag las 'og tu nyes pa med pa yang brjod par bya zhing bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that from among those offenses that have been stated, the non-offenses should be stated and taught.

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi nyes par mi 'gyur ba yang zhes bya ba ni kyang gi don yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi nyes par mi 'gyur ba yang zhes bya ba ni kyang gi don yin no //
translated: It is not only an offense, but also not an offense. This is the meaning of also.

original: yid brtan tshig gzhan shes par byas nas ni //
analyzed: yid brtan tshig gzhan shes par byas nas ni //
translated: Having trusted the words and understood the other,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes par mi 'gyur ba ston par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes par mi 'gyur ba ston par byed de /
translated: and so on, show that there is no offense.

original: dge tshul gang la ma byin par len pa'i nyes pa med pa de ni nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge tshul gang la ma byin par len pa'i nyes pa med pa de ni nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no fault for a novice monk who takes what has not been given.

original: ci zhig byas nas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas she na /
translated: What is done?

original: khyer na zhes smos te /
analyzed: khyer na zhes smos te /
translated: The text says, “if he takes it.”

original: gzhan dag gis ma byin par khyer na zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ma byin par khyer na zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder of the sentence is “if he takes what has not been given by others.”

original: bsam pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the special intention?

original: yid dge bas ni zhes bya ba smos te yid ge ba nyid kyis te rku sems dang bral ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yid dge bas ni zhes bya ba smos te yid ge ba nyid kyis te rku sems dang bral ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The text says, “if he has a virtuous mind.” He has a virtuous mind because he is free of the intention to steal.

original: ci zhig byas nas she na /🔽yid gtan tshigs gzhan shes par byas nas ni zhes bya ba smos te yid brtan byas pa yin gyi de tsam zhig ni ma @213a * //
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas she na / yid gtan tshigs gzhan shes par byas nas ni zhes bya ba smos te yid brtan byas pa yin gyi de tsam zhig ni ma @213a * //
translated: What is done?🔽The text says, “if he has made the mind certain.” He has made the mind certain, but not just that.

original: yin te / 'on kyang gzhan brtul zhugs can la bdag gis che go mo 'di'i bkyer ra zhes yid brtan la shes par byas nas khyer na nyes pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: yin te / 'on kyang gzhan brtul zhugs can la bdag gis che go mo 'di'i bkyer ra zhes yid brtan la shes par byas nas khyer na nyes pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: However, if he takes it after making the mind certain and informing another person who is disciplined, “I will take this belonging to so-and-so,” then there is no fault. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan la shes par byas pa ni rtsod pa ngan pa'i skabs med par bya ba dang yid brtan pa dbang du bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la shes par byas pa ni rtsod pa ngan pa'i skabs med par bya ba dang yid brtan pa dbang du bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The other person is made to understand in order to prevent the occasion for a dispute and to bring about the control of a trustworthy mind.

original: yid brtan pa'i yul rab la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ba de bzhin du yid brtan pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir grogs po ra ba dang 'bring dang tha ma rnams zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yid brtan pa'i yul rab la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ba de bzhin du yid brtan pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir grogs po ra ba dang 'bring dang tha ma rnams zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since the three types of trustworthy person are distinguished as best, etc., three types of trust are taught.

original: rab ni grogs po mchog tu gyur pa de rdzas mang po khyer kyang sems rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: rab ni grogs po mchog tu gyur pa de rdzas mang po khyer kyang sems rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: The best is the best friend who, even when carrying a great deal of wealth, does not change his mind.

original: 'bring ni gang ras dang ras phran tsam khyer ba dang / tha ma ni gang so dag par byed pa'i so shing la sogs pa khyer na sems gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni gang ras dang ras phran tsam khyer ba dang / tha ma ni gang so dag par byed pa'i so shing la sogs pa khyer na sems gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The middling is one who, when carrying just a piece of cloth or a small amount of cloth, does not change his mind. The lesser is one who, when carrying just a tooth stick or something to clean the teeth, does not change his mind.

original: rab dang 'bring dang tha ma ni rab dang 'bring dang tha ma rnams te /
analyzed: rab dang 'bring dang tha ma ni rab dang 'bring dang tha ma rnams te /
translated: Best, middling, and lesser are the best, middling, and lesser ones.

original: de dag kho na grogs po yin no //
analyzed: de dag kho na grogs po yin no //
translated: They are friends.

original: de'i dngos po ni grogs po rab dang 'bring dang tha ma nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni grogs po rab dang 'bring dang tha ma nyid do //
translated: The nature of a friend is threefold: best, middling, and least.

original: de la yid brtan go rims dag kyang bya //
analyzed: de la yid brtan go rims dag kyang bya //
translated: One should also know their order and reliability.

original: zhes bya ba ni yid brtan pa'i dngos po ni yid brtan pa nyid de de'i go rims dag kyang rim pa bzhin du bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yid brtan pa'i dngos po ni yid brtan pa nyid de de'i go rims dag kyang rim pa bzhin du bya ba ste /
translated: The nature of a friend is reliability. One should know their order and reliability.

original: bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should know their order and reliability.

original: kyang gi sgra ni yul gyi dbye ba 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi yid brtan pa'i dbye ba yang yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽chung ngu la ni chung ngu dang 'bring la ni 'bring dang / chung ngu yang ste rab la thams cad nyid ces bya bas rim pa gang gis yid brtan par bya ba de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni yul gyi dbye ba 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi yid brtan pa'i dbye ba yang yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro // chung ngu la ni chung ngu dang 'bring la ni 'bring dang / chung ngu yang ste rab la thams cad nyid ces bya bas rim pa gang gis yid brtan par bya ba de brjod par bya ste /
translated: The word “also” indicates that there is a division of reliability, not just a division of the field.🔽One should know the order in which one should rely on a friend, i.e., the least, the middling, and the best.

original: chung ngu ni grogs po tha ma ste yid brtan pa chung ngu bya'i cig shos dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chung ngu ni grogs po tha ma ste yid brtan pa chung ngu bya'i cig shos dag ni ma yin no //
translated: The least friend is the least reliable; the middling friend is middlingly reliable; the best friend is most reliable.

original: 'bring ni grogs po 'bring yin te yid brtan pa 'bring dang chung ngu dag kyang bya ba yin la ni'i sgra ni snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'bring ni grogs po 'bring yin te yid brtan pa 'bring dang chung ngu dag kyang bya ba yin la ni'i sgra ni snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
translated: The middling is the middling friend, and the lesser is the lesser friend. The word “also” means that the former is distinguished from the latter.

original: dang ni sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dang ni sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: The word “and” is a conjunction.

original: rab tu byed pa las sngar bstan pa ni rab ste grogs po mchog de las ji skad du bshad pa'i yul gyi nyes pa thams cad nyid yid brtan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las sngar bstan pa ni rab ste grogs po mchog de las ji skad du bshad pa'i yul gyi nyes pa thams cad nyid yid brtan par bya ba yin no //
translated: The one who is taught first in the treatise is the best, the supreme friend. From him, as explained, all the faults of the object should be trusted.

original: nyid kyis ni 'di skad du rab bzod pa gang yin pa des cig shos kyang bzod par 'gyur ba de'i phyir thams cad byas pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //🔽slob ma la sogs ra lug nor gyi rgyud //
analyzed: nyid kyis ni 'di skad du rab bzod pa gang yin pa des cig shos kyang bzod par 'gyur ba de'i phyir thams cad byas pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro // slob ma la sogs ra lug nor gyi rgyud //
translated: The word “itself” indicates that the one who is able to bear the best is also able to bear the rest. Therefore, there is no fault in doing everything.🔽The disciple, etc., are the cause of wealth for sheep and goats.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la slob ma dang por byas pa'i lung phog pa la sogs gzhan @213b gang yin pa de ni slob ma la sogs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la slob ma dang por byas pa'i lung phog pa la sogs gzhan @213b gang yin pa de ni slob ma la sogs so //
translated: The disciple, etc., are those other than the disciple who is first made to receive the scriptures, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras gzhan rag las pa dag kyang gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras gzhan rag las pa dag kyang gzung ba yin te /
translated: The words “and so on” include those who are dependent on others.

original: slob ma la sogs rkun pos khyer btang na dge tshul la nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob ma la sogs rkun pos khyer btang na dge tshul la nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If a novice monk sends a disciple to steal, he does not commit an offense.

original: rnam par bshad pa nyan pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas lhan cig gnas pa la slob ma'i sgrar bstan gyi rnam pa gzhan du dge tshul slob ma yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa nyan pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas lhan cig gnas pa la slob ma'i sgrar bstan gyi rnam pa gzhan du dge tshul slob ma yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The term “disciple” is used in the sense of a companion who listens to explanations and so on. But a novice monk does not have a disciple in the sense of a student.

original: yang gi sgra ni de 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi ra lug kho na nor gyi rgyud yin pa de yang rkun mas khyer ba thad par byas pa la nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes sdud pa dang rim pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni de 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi ra lug kho na nor gyi rgyud yin pa de yang rkun mas khyer ba thad par byas pa la nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes sdud pa dang rim pa gzhan yin no //
translated: The word “also” indicates that it is not only the novice monk who does not commit an offense, but also the thief who steals the sheep and the cow.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?🔽The text says:

original: snying rje'i dbang gis rdzu 'phrul bstan nas ni //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: snying rje'i dbang gis rdzu 'phrul bstan nas ni // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Through the power of compassion, he displays miracles.

original: dgra bcom pa srung dbang gi bu la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni srung dbang bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa srung dbang gi bu la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni srung dbang bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: The son of the arhat Rāhula and so on is called the son of Rāhula and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras 'phags pa mood gal gyi bu gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras 'phags pa mood gal gyi bu gzung ngo //
translated: and so on refers to the noble Maudgalyayana.🔽The object of compassion is the power, because it is in accord with compassion.🔽Therefore, it is the power of compassion.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i dngos po ni dbang yin te snying rje'i rjes su mthun pa yin pa de'i phyir snying rje'i dbang yin te snying rje'i dbang de'i phyir de srung dbang bu la sogs pas ji ltar rdzu 'phrul bstan nas thar par byas pa la nyes pa med
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i dngos po ni dbang yin te snying rje'i rjes su mthun pa yin pa de'i phyir snying rje'i dbang yin te snying rje'i dbang de'i phyir de srung dbang bu la sogs pas ji ltar rdzu 'phrul bstan nas thar par byas pa la nyes pa med
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in protecting them, just as there is no fault in the son of a god displaying miracles and liberating them.

original: pa de bas na de bzhin du dge tshul gyis rdzu 'phrul bstan nas btang ba la nyes pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa de bas na de bzhin du dge tshul gyis rdzu 'phrul bstan nas btang ba la nyes pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is said that there is no fault in a novice monk displaying miracles and liberating them.

original: de ltar ni 'dul ba las /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dul ba las /
translated: This is stated in the Vinaya:

original: 'phags pa srung dbang gi bus tsha bo gnyis rkun pos khyer ba btang ba dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa mod gal gyi bus mgon med zas sbyin gyi bu thar par byas pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa srung dbang gi bu sa lha 'bangs kyi nor rkun pos khyer ba thar par byas so zhes gtam rgyud thos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa srung dbang gi bus tsha bo gnyis rkun pos khyer ba btang ba dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa mod gal gyi bus mgon med zas sbyin gyi bu thar par byas pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa srung dbang gi bu sa lha 'bangs kyi nor rkun pos khyer ba thar par byas so zhes gtam rgyud thos pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the noble one, Guhyapati, liberated the wealth of King Prasenajit that was carried off by thieves.🔽This is what is heard in the stories.

original: gong du phug ron la sogs pa'i tshang ba shig pa la sogs pa las nyes byas su 'gyur bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gong du phug ron la sogs pa'i tshang ba shig pa la sogs pa las nyes byas su 'gyur bar bstan pa ste /
translated: Above, it was taught that destroying a nest of pigeons and so on becomes a minor offense.

original: gtsug lag khang gi khyams na gang tshe tshang //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi khyams na gang tshe tshang //
translated: In the courtyard of a monastery, when a nest🔽is destroyed, there is no offense.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dmigs kyis bsal ba byas pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dmigs kyis bsal ba byas pa yin te /
translated: This is an exception,

original: gtsug lag khang gi khyams gang yin pa de ni tshang ste phug ron la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i gnas bcas par gyur pa de sdom can dge tshul gyis dbang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi khyams gang yin pa de ni tshang ste phug ron la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i gnas bcas par gyur pa de sdom can dge tshul gyis dbang bar bya'o //
translated: because the courtyard of a monastery is a place where pigeons and so on make their nests. A monk who is bound by vows should not destroy it.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na de dag gang gi tshe sgo nga yod pa ma yin pa'i sgo nga med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na de dag gang gi tshe sgo nga yod pa ma yin pa'i sgo nga med pa ste /
translated: When? When there is no egg, that is, when the egg does not exist.

original: de'i tshe dbyung bar bya'i sgo nga dang bcas par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe dbyung bar bya'i sgo nga dang bcas par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: At that time, the egg that is to be removed does not exist.

original: tshig de las gang du phug ron la sogs zhes bya ba der ni gtsug lag khang las gzhan du sgo nga dang bcas pa dang sgo nga med par byung na nyes par 'gyur bar rtogs par @214a * //
analyzed: tshig de las gang du phug ron la sogs zhes bya ba der ni gtsug lag khang las gzhan du sgo nga dang bcas pa dang sgo nga med par byung na nyes par 'gyur bar rtogs par @214a * //
translated: In the statement, “where there are pigeons, etc.,” it should be understood that a fault occurs if one breaks an egg with or without an embryo in a place other than a monastery.

original: bya'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis ba'i rgya dbyung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bya'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis ba'i rgya dbyung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But didn’t the Bhagavān say, “Break the egg”?

original: de ji ltar spyir tshang zhes bya bar brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar spyir tshang zhes bya bar brjod ce na /
translated: How can it be said in general that it is an egg?

original: de'i phyir ba'i rgya yang rung ste dper bzhag tsam zhes bya ba smos te bdag gi rgya ni ba'i rgya ste gnas de dag ni dpe tsam yin te dpe ni dper bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ba'i rgya yang rung ste dper bzhag tsam zhes bya ba smos te bdag gi rgya ni ba'i rgya ste gnas de dag ni dpe tsam yin te dpe ni dper bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore it says, “It is also an egg, but it is merely an example.” The egg of a bird is an egg. Those places are merely examples. An example is something that illustrates.

original: de tsam nyid ni dpe tsam yin gyi dngos su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam nyid ni dpe tsam yin gyi dngos su ni ma yin no //
translated: That much is merely an example, but it is not actual.

original: 'di skad du de dag ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du de dag ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is taught by the words: “These are merely illustrations.”

original: ba'i sgras ba mo brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ba'i sgras ba mo brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word “etc.” refers to a straw mat.

original: da ni ma byin phyogs gtogs brjod par bya //
analyzed: da ni ma byin phyogs gtogs brjod par bya //
translated: Now, the category of not giving should be stated.

original: zhes bya ba la phyogs su gyur pa ni phyogs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la phyogs su gyur pa ni phyogs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: The category of a side is a side.

original: ma byin pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa ni ma byin phyogs te /
analyzed: ma byin pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa ni ma byin phyogs te /
translated: The category of not giving is the category of not giving.

original: ma byin par len pa dang cha 'dra ba bsten pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang cha 'dra ba bsten pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is similar to taking what is not given is called that.

original: da ni da ltar ston pa'o //
analyzed: da ni da ltar ston pa'o //
translated: Now, it is taught.

original: ni'i sgra ni gong du nyes par 'gyur ba bstan nas /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gong du nyes par 'gyur ba bstan nas /
translated: The word “etc.” indicates that after teaching the faults above,

original: da ni ma byin par len pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa brjod par bya ba yin no zhes khyad par du bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: da ni ma byin par len pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa brjod par bya ba yin no zhes khyad par du bstan pa'i don to //
translated: now the category of taking what is not given should be stated. This is the meaning of the distinction.🔽From giving benefits, beds, seats, and so on,

original: phan dang mal sten la sogs byin pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: phan dang mal sten la sogs byin pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: he teaches that.

original: gal te gang gis 'ga' zhig la phan dang mal stan la sogs pa byin nas /
analyzed: gal te gang gis 'ga' zhig la phan dang mal stan la sogs pa byin nas /
translated: If someone gives benefits, beds, seats, and so on to someone,

original: 'gyod pa kho na me yin pas na 'gyod pa'i me ste /🔽phyi nas 'gyod pas gdungs par gyur pa de 'bar zhing rab tu mched par gyur pa de'i tshe des /
analyzed: 'gyod pa kho na me yin pas na 'gyod pa'i me ste / phyi nas 'gyod pas gdungs par gyur pa de 'bar zhing rab tu mched par gyur pa de'i tshe des /
translated: Since remorse alone is fire, it is the fire of remorse.🔽Afterward, when one is tormented by remorse, at that time

original: de la 'gyod pa'i me ni rab tu 'bar 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de la 'gyod pa'i me ni rab tu 'bar 'gyur ba //
translated: the fire of remorse blazes and spreads.

original: ma lus par ni zhi bar bya zhing bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma lus par ni zhi bar bya zhing bsal bar bya'o //
translated: One should completely extinguish and remove it.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.

original: gang dag gis she na de la slar dngul skyogs chus zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang dag gis she na de la slar dngul skyogs chus zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: By what means? It is said: “With a ladle of water.”

original: chus yongs su bkang ba'i skyogs ni skyogs chu ste slar gtad pa'i skyog chu des zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽rgyu mtshan ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: chus yongs su bkang ba'i skyogs ni skyogs chu ste slar gtad pa'i skyog chu des zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rgyu mtshan ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: A ladle filled with water is a ladle of water. The meaning is: with that ladle of water which is offered back.

original: bsdam bya dgrol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsdam bya dgrol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For what reason? It is said: “in order to release the bound.”

original: bsdam par bya ba ste bsdam par bya ba'i nyes pa dgrol ba'i rgyu mtshan de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don yin no //
analyzed: bsdam par bya ba ste bsdam par bya ba'i nyes pa dgrol ba'i rgyu mtshan de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don yin no //
translated: The reason is: in order to release the bound, in order to release the faults that are to be bound. This is the meaning of the words.

original: phan gyi sgras gos brjod pa yin la mal stan zhes bya ba ni mal dang stan de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: phan gyi sgras gos brjod pa yin la mal stan zhes bya ba ni mal dang stan de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The word “bed” refers to a bed and a seat, and that is what is called a “bed and seat.”

original: de dang por byas pa'i snod la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni de la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang por byas pa'i snod la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni de la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Whatever is the first of those, such as a vessel, etc., that is what is called “that, etc.”

original: gnang ba med par gzhan gos spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnang ba med par gzhan gos spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Using the robes of another without permission” means:

original: gzhan gang yin pa de'i gos des ma gnang bar de'i gos yongs su longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gang yin pa de'i gos des ma gnang bar de'i gos yongs su longs spyod pa ste /
translated: the robes of another, without permission from that other person, using the robes of that other person.

original: gzhan gyi gos yongs su longs spyod na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gos yongs su longs spyod na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one uses the robes of another, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: yid brtan pa med pa dang rku sems med pa ji lta ji @214b ltar yang rung bar gtsor longs spyod par byed pa de kho na la gong du nyes pa med par bstan la /
analyzed: yid brtan pa med pa dang rku sems med pa ji lta ji @214b ltar yang rung bar gtsor longs spyod par byed pa de kho na la gong du nyes pa med par bstan la /
translated: It is taught that there is no offense if one uses the robes of another, whether or not one has confidence in the other person, and whether or not one has the intention to steal, as long as one is using the robes as the primary thing.

original: 'og tu ni ches lci ba nyid yin pa'i phyir nyes par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og tu ni ches lci ba nyid yin pa'i phyir nyes par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that below, there is an offense because it is a heavier offense.

original: khyim la ma bstabs stan la 'dug pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyim la ma bstabs stan la 'dug pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Sitting on a seat not offered in a house” means:

original: khyim ste khang khyim gyi nang du sdom can zhugs nas bdag po 'am gzhan gyi khyim gyi khongs su 'dus pa dag gis ma bstabs ma gnang bar stan la 'dug pa ni ma bstabs stan la 'dug pa ste nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim ste khang khyim gyi nang du sdom can zhugs nas bdag po 'am gzhan gyi khyim gyi khongs su 'dus pa dag gis ma bstabs ma gnang bar stan la 'dug pa ni ma bstabs stan la 'dug pa ste nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one who is restrained, who has entered a house, a home, sits down on a seat in the house, in the home, without being invited, without being given permission, without being allowed, by the owner or by another, it is a wrong action.

original: rab tu zhugs pa dang stan ni 'dir mal gyi nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu zhugs pa dang stan ni 'dir mal gyi nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: Here, “entering” and “seat” are examples of a bed.

original: de ltar ni khyim du zhugs nas ji srid de'i khongs su gtogs pa'am 'ga' zhig gis stan nam khri'u gnang ba ma bstabs pa de srid du 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar ni khyim du zhugs nas ji srid de'i khongs su gtogs pa'am 'ga' zhig gis stan nam khri'u gnang ba ma bstabs pa de srid du 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that, having entered a house, one should not sit down as long as one is not invited, not given permission, not allowed, by someone who belongs to that house, on a seat or a bench.

original: de nas sdom can gos sogs byin nas ni //
analyzed: de nas sdom can gos sogs byin nas ni //
translated: Then, if a novice steals the robes and so on that were given to the one who is restrained,

original: khros dang ldan pa'i sems kyis phrogs pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khros dang ldan pa'i sems kyis phrogs pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is a wrong action if he does it with an angry mind.

original: de nas brtul zhugs can la gos la sogs pa byin pa'i dus phyis te dus gzhan gyi dge tshul gyis phrogs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas brtul zhugs can la gos la sogs pa byin pa'i dus phyis te dus gzhan gyi dge tshul gyis phrogs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: “Then” means after the time when the robes and so on were given to the one who is restrained. If a novice steals them at another time, it is a wrong action.

original: de la de nas kyi sgra ni tshig nye bar bkod pa yin la sogs pa smos pa ni snod la sogs pa gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de la de nas kyi sgra ni tshig nye bar bkod pa yin la sogs pa smos pa ni snod la sogs pa gzung ba yin no //
translated: The word “then” indicates the proximity of the words. The word “etc.” includes the bowl, and so on.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By whom?

original: khros dang ldan pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khros dang ldan pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “with a mind full of anger.”

original: khro ba gang la yod pa de ni khros dang ldan pa'i sems te /
analyzed: khro ba gang la yod pa de ni khros dang ldan pa'i sems te /
translated: One who has anger is a person with a mind full of anger.

original: des phrogs par gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des phrogs par gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he is overcome by anger.

original: khros pa smos pa ni phan par 'dod pas yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i bar chad bya ba'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khros pa smos pa ni phan par 'dod pas yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i bar chad bya ba'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “anger” means that there is no fault in going to another place with the intention of benefiting.

original: de bzhin du snod la sogs pa la chags pa ni snod sogs chags pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du snod la sogs pa la chags pa ni snod sogs chags pa ste /
translated: Similarly, attachment to a bowl, and so on, is attachment to a bowl, and so on.

original: snod la sogs pa la sred par gyur pa'i dge tshul gang yin pa de ni de'i nan ni nan te /
analyzed: snod la sogs pa la sred par gyur pa'i dge tshul gang yin pa de ni de'i nan ni nan te /
translated: A novice monk who has craving for a bowl, and so on, is one who is attached to that.

original: des slong ba ni shin tu ltos ba dang bcas par snod la sogs pa blangs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: des slong ba ni shin tu ltos ba dang bcas par snod la sogs pa blangs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The meaning of the passage is that he is one who begs with great dependence, having taken up a bowl, and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gos la sogs pa gzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gos la sogs pa gzung ste /
translated: The words “and so on” include clothing and so on.

original: 'di skad du yo byad med pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba dgos pa tsam gyi ched du nan ma yin par slong ba la sogs pa 'jug par bya'i bzang po la chags pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //

translated: because he enters it by the power of another.

original: gal te phyis reg pa'i bde ba bdag gir byed pa yin pa de lta na yang rtsa bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te phyis reg pa'i bde ba bdag gir byed pa yin pa de lta na yang rtsa bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If he appropriates the pleasure of contact later, then also it is the basis, that is the meaning.

original: yang gi sgra ni rang bzhin du gnas pa 'ba' zhig ma yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni rang bzhin du gnas pa 'ba' zhig ma yin no //
translated: The word “also” means that it is not only the natural state.

original: rnam pa kun du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du rang gi sgor ram gzhan gyi sgor ram /
analyzed: rnam pa kun du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du rang gi sgor ram gzhan gyi sgor ram /
translated: “In every way” means in all ways. If he enters it by force, either through his own door or through another’s door,

original: rang dang gzhan gyi sbubs su nan gyi rnam pas bcug pa bdag gir byed na yang dngos gzhir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi sbubs su nan gyi rnam pas bcug pa bdag gir byed na yang dngos gzhir 'gyur gyi /
translated: or through his own and another’s womb, and appropriates it, then it is the basis.

original: 'di la khyad par ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di la khyad par ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is not the slightest difference in this case, that is the meaning.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don yin te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don yin te /
translated: The word “ni” has the meaning of “hi” .

original: gang gi phyir bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pas kun du reg pa'i bde ba bdag gir byed pa rgyu de'i phyir rdo rjes gnod 'dra'i rtsa ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pas kun du reg pa'i bde ba bdag gir byed pa rgyu de'i phyir rdo rjes gnod 'dra'i rtsa ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the cause, i.e., the pleasure of contact in the manner just explained, one appropriates to oneself, therefore, the root of the offense of a Vajra-like transgression.

original: rdo rje'i sgras rdo rje bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: rdo rje'i sgras rdo rje bstan pa yin la /
translated: The term “Vajra” indicates a Vajra-like offense.🔽The root itself is a Vajra, and the offense is like a root-Vajra.

original: rtsa ba kho na rdo rje yin pa des gnod pa ni rtsa ba'i rdo rjes gnod pa ste /🔽dge tshul gyis thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba kho na rdo rje yin pa des gnod pa ni rtsa ba'i rdo rjes gnod pa ste / dge tshul gyis thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One commits a root downfall, i.e., a root offense, by means of that.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dir gnyid log pa dang smyos pa dang / tshor bas gzir ba yongs su bzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dir gnyid log pa dang smyos pa dang / tshor bas gzir ba yongs su bzung ba'i phyir /
translated: The term “etc.” in the root text includes sleep, intoxication, and being overwhelmed by pain.

original: gnas skabs der bcug la sad pa'i gnas su bdag gir byed na rtsa bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas skabs der bcug la sad pa'i gnas su bdag gir byed na rtsa bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one appropriates to oneself the root downfall when one awakens from sleep, etc.

original: dang ni bud med la sogs pa'i sgo dang / 'gro ba dang / rgyud tha dad pas tha dad pa dag la khyad par yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dang ni bud med la sogs pa'i sgo dang / 'gro ba dang / rgyud tha dad pas tha dad pa dag la khyad par yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The term “and” in the root text indicates that there is no distinction between a woman, etc., and a man, etc., in terms of the door of the offense, the action, or the motivation.

original: bud med la sogs rgyud rigs tha dad sgo //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽bud med dang por byas pa'i skyes pa dang / ma ning gang yin pa de ni bud med la sogs te bud med la sogs de'i sgo gsum po dag dang rgyud dang rigs las rtsa ba'i nyes pa la brten pa'i khyad par nyid ni med pa yin te /
analyzed: bud med la sogs rgyud rigs tha dad sgo // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / bud med dang por byas pa'i skyes pa dang / ma ning gang yin pa de ni bud med la sogs te bud med la sogs de'i sgo gsum po dag dang rgyud dang rigs las rtsa ba'i nyes pa la brten pa'i khyad par nyid ni med pa yin te /
translated: The distinctions of the three doors, continuum, and type do not exist for women and so on.

original: bye brag nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bye brag nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The distinctions of the three doors, continuum, and type do not exist for women and so on, that is, for men who were previously women, and for neuters.

original: tha dad pa'i sgra ni so sor sbyar bar bya ba yin no //🔽rgyud ces bya ba ni rgyud lnga la bya ste de la ji ltar srid par sbyar bar bya ba yin pas na dge slong dag dmyal ba dang lhan cig ni 'gal ba yod pa yin la /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i sgra ni so sor sbyar bar bya ba yin no // rgyud ces bya ba ni rgyud lnga la bya ste de la ji ltar srid par sbyar bar bya ba yin pas na dge slong dag dmyal ba dang lhan cig ni 'gal ba yod pa yin la /
translated: The term different is to be applied to each of these.🔽The term continuum refers to the five continuums.

original: lha dang ni srid pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: lha dang ni srid pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since they are applied as appropriate, bhikṣus have conflict with hell beings and so on, but they have existence with gods and so on.

original: srin po dag dang lhan @218b cig ni 'gal ba yin la yi dags dang yang srid pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: srin po dag dang lhan @218b cig ni 'gal ba yin la yi dags dang yang srid pa kho na yin te /
translated: They have conflict with rākṣasas, but they have existence with pretas and so on.

original: de dag ni mthong ba'i spyod yul du gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni mthong ba'i spyod yul du gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the domain of direct perception.

original: dud 'gro dag dang yang srid pa yin te 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dud 'gro dag dang yang srid pa yin te 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are also animals, because they are included in the realm of animals.🔽They are of different types, because they are divided into Brahmins, etc.🔽They are of different lineages, because they are of different families.🔽They are of different castes, because they are of different social classes.

original: rigs tha dad pa na bram ze la sogs pa'i dbye ba dag gis so //
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa na bram ze la sogs pa'i dbye ba dag gis so //
translated: They are of different moral disciplines, because they are of different moral disciplines.🔽They are of different philosophical schools, because they are of different philosophical schools.🔽They are of different inclinations, because they are of different dispositions.🔽They are of different paths, because they are of different paths.🔽They are of different fruits, because they are of different fruits.🔽They are of different degrees of spiritual attainment, because they are of different degrees of spiritual attainment.🔽They are of different degrees of wisdom, because they are of different degrees of wisdom.

analyzed: rigs cig shos las ni ma yin no zhes bya bar khyad par yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i don yin pa de'i phyir thams cad du rtsa ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The meaning of the passage is to be taken as certain, therefore, it is said that “in every case, there is the fault of the root .”

analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: shi dang ma shi nyid la'ang khyad par med //
analyzed: shi dang ma shi nyid la'ang khyad par med //
translated: there is no difference between the living and the dead.

original: ces bya ba la 'di ltar shi ba dang ma shi ba ni shi dang ma shi ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la 'di ltar shi ba dang ma shi ba ni shi dang ma shi ba'o //
translated: Thus, the living and the dead are the living and the dead.

analyzed: de'i dngos po ni shi dang ma shi ba nyid de skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning shi ba dang ma shi ba nyid de yang nyes pa bsten pa la khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The state of that is the state of the living and the dead. The state of the living and the dead of a man, a woman, or a eunuch is not different in the case of one who is addicted to vice.

original: phyed du bcad kyang slar ni sbyar ba'i rma //
analyzed: phyed du bcad kyang slar ni sbyar ba'i rma //
translated: The dream is joined again even though it is divided.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lus phyed du bcad pa'i rma gsum po dag tu yang nor bu bcug pa'i reg pa bdag gir byas na rtsa bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //

translated: The root is established by appropriating the contact of inserting the gem into the three wounds of a body cut in half.

original: bud med kyi lus phyed du bkas pa'i mtshams mi mngon pa'i lam dang mtshan du bdag nyid kyi zag byed bcug pa bdag gir byed na rtsa bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
