translated: Similarly, the root is established by appropriating the contact of inserting the gem into the three wounds of a body cut in half.🔽Similarly

original: yang gi sgra ni 'dir snga ma dang shi ba nyid dang / ma shi ba nyid dang / ma bkas pa nyid dang / bkas pa nyid slar sbyar ba zhes bya ba sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni 'dir snga ma dang shi ba nyid dang / ma shi ba nyid dang / ma bkas pa nyid dang / bkas pa nyid slar sbyar ba zhes bya ba sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “also” is a conjunction that includes the previous and death, non-death, non-ordination, and ordination.

original: mngon par gyur na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par gyur na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done when it is manifest?

original: mtshams slar sbyar kyang mngon par gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mtshams slar sbyar kyang mngon par gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Even if the boundary is restored, it is manifest.

original: bkas par gyur ba'i mtshams slar sbyar ba yang mngon par gyur pa'i zag byed kyi lam du zag byed bcug pa'i reg pa'i bde ba dge tshul gyis bdag gir byas na nyes byas chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bkas par gyur ba'i mtshams slar sbyar ba yang mngon par gyur pa'i zag byed kyi lam du zag byed bcug pa'i reg pa'i bde ba dge tshul gyis bdag gir byas na nyes byas chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the boundary of the ordination is restored, if the novice monk appropriates the pleasure of contact that enters the boundary of the defiling path, it becomes a minor offense.

original: de'i phyir de nyid dge tshul gyis bshags par bya @219a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid dge tshul gyis bshags par bya @219a * //
translated: Therefore, that is what the novice monk should confess.

original: ba yin no zhes bya ba ni thams cad du tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: ba yin no zhes bya ba ni thams cad du tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
translated: This is the remainder of the sentence throughout.

original: de bzhin du /🔽spu med phag la sogs pa'i rma //
analyzed: de bzhin du / spu med phag la sogs pa'i rma //
translated: Similarly,🔽the wound of a pig without hair, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la phag la sogs pa'i gang yin pa de ni phag la mos pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la phag la sogs pa'i gang yin pa de ni phag la mos pa ste /
translated: That which is of a pig, etc., is a pig wound.

original: rigs rjod par byed pa yin gyi gsal ba brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs rjod par byed pa yin gyi gsal ba brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It expresses the universal, not the particular.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni spre'u la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni spre'u la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the monkey and so on.

original: de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: spu med par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni spu med pa'o //
analyzed: spu med par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni spu med pa'o //
translated: That which has become hairless is hairless.

original: spu med pa yang yin la bcos pa yang yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: spu med pa yang yin la bcos pa yang yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: It is hairless and it is cooked, is the inclusion of the difference.

original: bcos pa zhes bya ba ni bsregs pa ste /🔽de lta bur gyur pa spu med pa bcos pa'i phag la sogs pa de'i rmar skyes pa'i dbang po bcug na zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du thams cad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bcos pa zhes bya ba ni bsregs pa ste / de lta bur gyur pa spu med pa bcos pa'i phag la sogs pa de'i rmar skyes pa'i dbang po bcug na zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du thams cad brjod par bya'o //
translated: “Cooked” means burned.🔽If one inserts the organ into the anus of a pig, etc., which is hairless and cooked in that way, the rest is as above.

original: de ltar mgo ni bcad par gyur pa'i kha //
analyzed: de ltar mgo ni bcad par gyur pa'i kha //
translated: Thus, if one inserts the organ into the mouth of a corpse🔽that has been decapitated,

original: zhes bya ba bcad pa yang yin la mgo yang yin pas mgo ni bcad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bcad pa yang yin la mgo yang yin pas mgo ni bcad pa ste /
translated: it is a head and it has been cut off, so it is a decapitated head.

original: de'i kha la bcug na zhes thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i kha la bcug na zhes thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If one inserts the organ into its mouth, the rest is as above.

original: dang ni kun la nyes par mtshungs par ston pa'i sgo nas sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ni kun la nyes par mtshungs par ston pa'i sgo nas sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “and” is used to include all the other cases.

original: dang gnyis pa ni bshad pa sdud par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dang gnyis pa ni bshad pa sdud par byed pa yin te /
translated: The second “and” is used to include the explanation.

original: dper na rma bcos ma de la yang ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rma bcos ma de la yang ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying, “It will be just as it was before the operation.”

original: ni ni gang gi phyir bstan ma thag pa ni chung ba nyid de bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ni ni gang gi phyir bstan ma thag pa ni chung ba nyid de bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: The word “for” indicates that the immediately preceding is a minor fault that should be confessed.

original: bcos pa ni nyams pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nyes pa chung ba nyid du grub pa la yang brjod pa ni mi'i 'jam pa'i bya ba tsam yod pas rtsa ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhes 'dir dogs pa zlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcos pa ni nyams pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nyes pa chung ba nyid du grub pa la yang brjod pa ni mi'i 'jam pa'i bya ba tsam yod pas rtsa ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhes 'dir dogs pa zlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is established that the correction is a minor fault because it is a downfall, the statement is made to remove doubt here that a root downfall occurs because there is merely the action of a human being’s speech.

original: de bzhin du gos kyis dkris pa dang bltab par gyur pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gos kyis dkris pa dang bltab par gyur pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Similarly, “wrapped in cloth” and “folded up” means:

original: gos kyis dkris pa ni gos kyis dkris pa ste /
analyzed: gos kyis dkris pa ni gos kyis dkris pa ste /
translated: “Wrapped in cloth” means wrapped in cloth.

original: skyes pa'i dbang po'am bud med kyi dbang po'am de gnyi ga gos kyis dkris pa dang / de bzhin du mtshan nyis bltab tu byas pa dang / sgo lam reg pa ste /
analyzed: skyes pa'i dbang po'am bud med kyi dbang po'am de gnyi ga gos kyis dkris pa dang / de bzhin du mtshan nyis bltab tu byas pa dang / sgo lam reg pa ste /
translated: and the door is touched.

original: bud med kyi dbang po'i mtshan nyid la skyes pa'i dbang po gang gi sgo la ma reg pa de ni de la bcug pa na nyes pa chung bar 'dod de /
analyzed: bud med kyi dbang po'i mtshan nyid la skyes pa'i dbang po gang gi sgo la ma reg pa de ni de la bcug pa na nyes pa chung bar 'dod de /
translated: If the male organ does not touch the door of the female organ, it is considered a minor offense to insert it into the female organ.

original: bcom ldan 'das bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bzhed pa yin no //
translated: This is the belief of the Bhagavan.

original: de bzhin du bud med la sogs pa'i sgor skyes pa'i dbang po ma bcug par bsten par bya ba'i phyi rol la kun nas reg pa tsam la chung bar bzhed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du bud med la sogs pa'i sgor skyes pa'i dbang po ma bcug par bsten par bya ba'i phyi rol la kun nas reg pa tsam la chung bar bzhed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Likewise, it is said that merely touching the external object of reliance, such as a woman, without inserting the male organ into the door of the female organ is considered a minor offense.

original: gang gi phyir gos kyis dkris pa'i skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po gang yin pa phan tshun reg pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du mtshan nyis bltab tu byas pa'i nor bu la bud med kyi dbang pos reg pa med ba dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gos kyis dkris pa'i skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbang po gang yin pa phan tshun reg pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du mtshan nyis bltab tu byas pa'i nor bu la bud med kyi dbang pos reg pa med ba dang /
translated: Because the male and female organs wrapped in cloth do not mutually touch each other, and similarly, the female organ does not touch the jewel of one whose genitals are retracted.

original: sgo la ma reg pa @219b ni skyes pa'i dbang po la reg pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir de la nyes byas chung bar 'gyur ro //

original: chags pa tha mal pas bslad par gyur pa des lus ngag g-yo bar byed ces bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: chags pa tha mal pas bslad par gyur pa des lus ngag g-yo bar byed ces bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The term “in the house” is a locative indicating the place where the act is performed.🔽The term “in the house” is

original: bshad ma thag pa'i de dag thams cad ni yid kyir 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i de dag thams cad ni yid kyir 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: All of these just explained should be understood as mental downfalls.

original: gong du nyes pa gsal po byas pa nyid dang / dgag pa nye bar bstan pa dang / cig car bstan pa'i sgo nas nyes par 'gyur ba bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: gong du nyes pa gsal po byas pa nyid dang / dgag pa nye bar bstan pa dang / cig car bstan pa'i sgo nas nyes par 'gyur ba bshad pa yin la /
translated: The faults have been explained by way of the previously stated clear faults, the teaching of prohibitions, and the teaching of simultaneous faults.🔽Now, the faults are taught by way of the prohibition of actions, such as:

original: da ni / yang dang yang du bud med ngor mi lta //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas bya ba 'gog pa'i sgo nas nyes par 'gyur ba ston te /🔽yang dang yang ste phyi phyir bud med kyi ngo gdong la dge tshul gyis mi brtag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: da ni / yang dang yang du bud med ngor mi lta // zhes bya ba la sogs pas bya ba 'gog pa'i sgo nas nyes par 'gyur ba ston te / yang dang yang ste phyi phyir bud med kyi ngo gdong la dge tshul gyis mi brtag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Do not look again and again at the face of a woman.🔽The meaning of “do not look again and again at the face of a woman” is that a novice monk should not examine the face of a woman.

original: yang dang yang du zhes smos pa ni dgos pa'i dbang gis bud med kyi yul la lhag par lta bar byed pa na lan cig lta ba la nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang dang yang du zhes smos pa ni dgos pa'i dbang gis bud med kyi yul la lhag par lta bar byed pa na lan cig lta ba la nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase “again and again” is stated because there is no fault in looking once, if it is done for a purpose and with a mind free of attachment.

original: de la yang 'dod chags med pa'i sems kyis zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang 'dod chags med pa'i sems kyis zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as “with a mind free of attachment.”

original: de ltar yang btsun pa bcom ldan 'das nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas bdag gis bud med kyi yul la ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: de ltar yang btsun pa bcom ldan 'das nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas bdag gis bud med kyi yul la ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: In the same way, the Buddha said to Ananda: Ananda, after I have passed into nirvāṇa, how can women practice the holy life?🔽Ananda replied: Because of looking, Lord.

original: kun dga' bo mi lta bas so zhes 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo mi lta bas so zhes 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: yang dang yang bltas pa las rgyu mtshan 'dzin par 'gyur la de las chags pa yongs su bsten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dang yang bltas pa las rgyu mtshan 'dzin par 'gyur la de las chags pa yongs su bsten par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of looking again and again, the cause of grasping the signs arises, and from that, the cause of attachment is fully developed.

original: de las log par bsgrub pa'i phyir bud med kyi yul la lta ba ni rab tu 'byung ba'i bar du gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: de las log par bsgrub pa'i phyir bud med kyi yul la lta ba ni rab tu 'byung ba'i bar du gcod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, looking at women is an obstacle to going forth, because it is the cause of wrong practice.

original: ngor zhes smos pa ni shas cher gdong ni chags pa gsal por byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ngor zhes smos pa ni shas cher gdong ni chags pa gsal por byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The word “face” is used because the face is the principal cause of arousing attachment.

original: de mthong ba na chags pa 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir yan lag gzhan mthong ba la ni nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de mthong ba na chags pa 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir yan lag gzhan mthong ba la ni nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not taught that there is no fault in looking at other parts of the body, because attachment arises when the face is seen.

original: de la yang nyes dmigs mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang nyes dmigs mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the same danger is present in looking at other parts of the body.

original: reg pa'i dug la nam yang reg mi bya //
analyzed: reg pa'i dug la nam yang reg mi bya //
translated: Never touch the poison of contact.

original: zhes bya ba ni reg pa gang kho na dug yin pa de ni reg pa'i dug yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni reg pa gang kho na dug yin pa de ni reg pa'i dug yin te /
translated: The poison of contact is that which is poison as contact.

original: bud med de la dge tshul sems dag pa'am ma dag pas kyang reg par mi bya ste /
analyzed: bud med de la dge tshul sems dag pa'am ma dag pas kyang reg par mi bya ste /
translated: A novice should not touch a woman, whether her mind is pure or impure.

original: gang gi phyir bud med kyi yul la reg pa'am bud med kyi yul gyis reg pa @221b na chags pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin la de las kyang yongs su bsten par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bud med kyi yul la reg pa'am bud med kyi yul gyis reg pa @221b na chags pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin la de las kyang yongs su bsten par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Because contact with a woman or being touched by a woman is conducive to passion, and from that, the rest follows, as before.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bud med kyi yul ni reg pa'i dug yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bud med kyi yul ni reg pa'i dug yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: For this very reason, the Blessed One said, “The object of a woman is the poison of contact.”

original: ji ltar reg pa'i dug la reg na srog dang bral bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du bud med kyi yul la sngar bshad pa'i rim pa'i tshul gyis reg par byed na sdom pa'i bar du gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar reg pa'i dug la reg na srog dang bral bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du bud med kyi yul la sngar bshad pa'i rim pa'i tshul gyis reg par byed na sdom pa'i bar du gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as when one touches the poison of contact, one loses one’s life, so too, when one touches the object of a woman in the manner explained earlier, one’s vow is broken.

original: dang ni bud med kyi ngor blta bar mi bya reg par yang mi bya'o zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ni bud med kyi ngor blta bar mi bya reg par yang mi bya'o zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “and” is to be understood as meaning that one should not look at a woman, nor touch her.

original: chud zos pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir reg pa la nyes pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽ji ste chu dang mes 'chi de yi tshe //
analyzed: chud zos pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir reg pa la nyes pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro // ji ste chu dang mes 'chi de yi tshe //
translated: In order to show that there is no fault in touching in order to save someone from drowning,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “If she is drowning or being burned, etc.”

original: chu dang me ni chu dang me yin /
analyzed: chu dang me ni chu dang me yin /
translated: Water and fire are water and fire.

original: de bas na me dang chu des ji ste bud med 'chi ba de'i tshe ni dge tshul gyis reg par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na me dang chu des ji ste bud med 'chi ba de'i tshe ni dge tshul gyis reg par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if a woman is drowning or being burned by fire, then a novice should touch her.

original: ci zhig byas nas she na sa'i 'du shes gzhag ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas she na sa'i 'du shes gzhag ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What should he do? He should establish the perception of earth.

original: chu 'am mes 'chi bar gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: chu 'am mes 'chi bar gyur pa de ni /
translated: If she is drowning or being burned by fire,

original: 'di ni sa yin te sa dang mtshungs pa 'di la chags pa skyed pa mi rigs so snyam pa'i 'du shes bzhag la snying rje'i dbang gis lag pa'am skra la bzung nas chu dang ma las drang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni sa yin te sa dang mtshungs pa 'di la chags pa skyed pa mi rigs so snyam pa'i 'du shes bzhag la snying rje'i dbang gis lag pa'am skra la bzung nas chu dang ma las drang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: he should establish the perception that “this is earth, this is like earth, it is not proper to generate passion toward it.” Through the power of compassion, he should hold her by the hair or by the hand and pull her out of the water or out of the fire. This is the meaning.

original: ni'i sgra ni snga ma las kyang khyad par du bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni snga ma las kyang khyad par du bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “also” indicates that the novice monk is superior to the layperson.

original: ji ste bud med sdom can mthong chags 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ste bud med sdom can mthong chags 'gyur //
translated: If he sees a woman who is a novice nun,

original: de la sdom can de ni ring mi gnas //
analyzed: de la sdom can de ni ring mi gnas //
translated: he should not stay there long.

original: zhes bya ba las phyogs gang du gnas na sdom can mthong nas bud med chags par 'gyur ba der ram /
analyzed: zhes bya ba las phyogs gang du gnas na sdom can mthong nas bud med chags par 'gyur ba der ram /
translated: In whatever place a novice monk sees a novice nun, or a woman who is a novice nun, he should not stay there long.

original: bud med mthong nas dge tshul chags par 'gyur ba der yun ring po dus ring por gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bud med mthong nas dge tshul chags par 'gyur ba der yun ring po dus ring por gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: If he sees a woman who is a probationary nun, or a woman who is a novice monk, he should not stay there long.

original: nyes dmigs yongs su spang ba'i phyir de dag ni 'gro ba nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes dmigs yongs su spang ba'i phyir de dag ni 'gro ba nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin no //
translated: In order to avoid danger, he should quickly leave that place.

original: rdo la sogs pas yan lag brdung mi bya //🔽zhes bya ba la chags pa'i mes gdungs par gyur pa'i dge tshul gyis yan lag sbu bu ste /
analyzed: rdo la sogs pas yan lag brdung mi bya // zhes bya ba la chags pa'i mes gdungs par gyur pa'i dge tshul gyis yan lag sbu bu ste /
translated: He should not strike his limbs with stones, etc.

original: skyes pa'i dbang po rdo la sogs pas brdung bar mi bya zhing brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyes pa'i dbang po rdo la sogs pas brdung bar mi bya zhing brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A novice monk who is tormented by the fire of passion should not strike his penis with stones, etc.,🔽or with his hand, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni tho ba la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni tho ba la sogs pa yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes hammers and so on.

original: 'o na 'dod chags kyi me ji ltar zhi bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dod chags kyi me ji ltar zhi bar bya zhe na /
translated: How is the fire of passion to be extinguished?

original: 'dod chags me ni mi sdug chus zhi byed //🔽ces bya ba smos te /🔽'dod chags kho na me yin pas na 'dod chags me ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags me ni mi sdug chus zhi byed // ces bya ba smos te / 'dod chags kho na me yin pas na 'dod chags me ste /
translated: The fire of passion is extinguished by the water of foulness.

original: yongs su sreg par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su sreg par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Passion itself is fire, because it burns up the mind.

original: mi sdug chus zhi byed ces bya ba de la mi sdug pa kho na chu yin pa de bas na mi sdug chus so //
analyzed: mi sdug chus zhi byed ces bya ba de la mi sdug pa kho na chu yin pa de bas na mi sdug chus so //
translated: The water of foulness is the water that is foulness.

original: mi sdug pa zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba'i @222a * //
analyzed: mi sdug pa zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba'i @222a * //
translated: Foulness is the meditation on impurity.

original: sgom pa ste de lta bur gyur pa'i chus 'dod chags kyi me zhi bar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgom pa ste de lta bur gyur pa'i chus 'dod chags kyi me zhi bar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The fire of passion is extinguished by the water of foulness, not by any other water.

original: nyid ni nges nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: nyid ni nges nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word “itself” is used to emphasize the point.

original: bud med gyen du gdong bltas 'thung ba la //
analyzed: bud med gyen du gdong bltas 'thung ba la //
translated: When a woman drinks with her face upturned,

original: rang gi rgyun mi 'chad par chu mi blud //
analyzed: rang gi rgyun mi 'chad par chu mi blud //
translated: one should not pour the water continuously.

original: ces bya ba la bar mi 'chad pa'i rgyun chu gang la yod pa de ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'i chu ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la bar mi 'chad pa'i rgyun chu gang la yod pa de ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'i chu ste /
translated: The water that has a continuous flow is uninterrupted water.

original: de ni gyen du gdong bltas nas 'thung ba la blud par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gyen du gdong bltas nas 'thung ba la blud par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not give that water to a woman who drinks facing upward.

original: su la zhe na bud med la zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: su la zhe na bud med la zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: To whom? To a woman.

original: rang gi sgra ni gzhan gyis sbyor ba la nyes pa med do zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sgra ni gzhan gyis sbyor ba la nyes pa med do zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “own” is stated to show that there is no offense if another person gives the water.

original: gang gi phyir rgyun mi 'chad par btung bar bya ba byin pa las bud med kyi yul gyen du gdong lta bas 'thung ba na mig dang mig gi gzugs phrad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyun mi 'chad par btung bar bya ba byin pa las bud med kyi yul gyen du gdong lta bas 'thung ba na mig dang mig gi gzugs phrad par 'gyur la /
translated: Because the water that is given to be drunk uninterruptedly is drunk by a woman who faces upward, her eyes and the form of the eyes come into contact.

original: de las rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa la sogs pa snga ma dang 'dra ba de'i phyir rang gi snyim pa bkang bas chu sbyin par bya'i rgyun mi 'chad pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa la sogs pa snga ma dang 'dra ba de'i phyir rang gi snyim pa bkang bas chu sbyin par bya'i rgyun mi 'chad pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: From that, the cause is grasped, and so on, as before. Therefore, one should give water with one’s own filled cupped hands, but not with an uninterrupted flow. This is the meaning.

original: khur ba byin ltar 'gyur bas zas la sogs //
analyzed: khur ba byin ltar 'gyur bas zas la sogs //
translated: One should not give food, etc., as if one were a servant.

original: rang gi lag gis mi sbyin gos med la /🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi lag gis mi sbyin gos med la / zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not give with one's own hand to one who is naked.

original: gos med ni nam mkha'i gos can te /
analyzed: gos med ni nam mkha'i gos can te /
translated: One who is naked is one who wears the sky as clothing.

original: de dag la zas la sogs pa rang gi lag gis te bdag nyid kyi lag pa nas sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag la zas la sogs pa rang gi lag gis te bdag nyid kyi lag pa nas sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not give food, etc. with one's own hand, that is, from one's own hand.

original: gzhan yang bdag nyid kyi mngon sum du sbyin du mi gzhug go //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag nyid kyi mngon sum du sbyin du mi gzhug go //
translated: Moreover, one should not allow them to give in one's own presence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khur ba byin ltar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khur ba byin ltar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, Because it would be like giving a load.

original: khur pa dag sbyin pa ni khur ba byin pa bzhin te /
analyzed: khur pa dag sbyin pa ni khur ba byin pa bzhin te /
translated: Giving a load is like giving a load.

original: khur ba byin pa ltar ma gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: khur ba byin pa ltar ma gyur cig pa'o //
translated: It would not be like giving a load.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa kun dga' bos khur ba byin pa na skur ba btab pa'i nyes pa ltar 'dir ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa kun dga' bos khur ba byin pa na skur ba btab pa'i nyes pa ltar 'dir ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is, It would not be like the fault of the noble Ananda's giving a load.

original: de ltar ni 'dul ba las 'phags pa kun dga' bos khur ba blangs nas dge 'dun zas kyi phyir 'khod pa la 'brim pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dul ba las 'phags pa kun dga' bos khur ba blangs nas dge 'dun zas kyi phyir 'khod pa la 'brim pa'i tshe /
translated: In this way, in the Vinaya, when the noble Ananda took a load and was distributing it to the Saṅgha seated for a meal,

original: gcer bu ma slong mo mdun du gnyer ba dag la khur ba byin pa na de la gcig ni gzhon la gnyis pa ni rgan pas der bya rog dang ta la'i tshul du gzhon nu ma'i lag par khur ba gnyis byin la rgan mo'i lag par gcig byin
analyzed: gcer bu ma slong mo mdun du gnyer ba dag la khur ba byin pa na de la gcig ni gzhon la gnyis pa ni rgan pas der bya rog dang ta la'i tshul du gzhon nu ma'i lag par khur ba gnyis byin la rgan mo'i lag par gcig byin
translated: When a naked ascetic woman asked for alms, he gave her a load. One of the women was young and the other was old. He gave two loads to the young woman and one to the old woman, like a crow and a palm tree.

original: pas rgan mo des gzhon nu mal /
analyzed: pas rgan mo des gzhon nu mal /
translated: The old woman said to the young woman:

original: kun dga' bo khyod don du gnyer bar byed do zhes smras so zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod don du gnyer bar byed do zhes smras so zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: You are the one who is being served.

original: bud med kyi yul la ji ltar chos bshad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: bud med kyi yul la ji ltar chos bshad par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one teach the Dharma to women?

original: gdong du 'bru tshugs su ni lta ba dang // chags med mig gis bud med chos shod cig / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gdong du 'bru tshugs su ni lta ba dang // chags med mig gis bud med chos shod cig / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Look at the face with a straight face, and teach the Dharma to women with unattached eyes.

original: bud med la dge tshul gyis bshad cing bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: bud med la dge tshul gyis bshad cing bstan par bya'o //
translated: A novice monk should explain and teach to women.

original: @222b bshad pa de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: @222b bshad pa de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the special quality of that explanation?

original: smras pa bud med kyi yul la mig chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa'i phyir chags med mig ste /
analyzed: smras pa bud med kyi yul la mig chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa'i phyir chags med mig ste /
translated: It is said that because the eyes of women are unattached and unobstructed, they are unattached eyes.

original: des bshad par bya'i gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: des bshad par bya'i gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be explained otherwise.

original: gdong du 'bru tshugs su ni lta ba dang // zhes bya ba la 'bru tshugs kyang de yin la lta ba yang yin pas na 'bru tshugs su lta ba de bas na des bud med kyi yul gyi gdong la blta bas chos bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gdong du 'bru tshugs su ni lta ba dang // zhes bya ba la 'bru tshugs kyang de yin la lta ba yang yin pas na 'bru tshugs su lta ba de bas na des bud med kyi yul gyi gdong la blta bas chos bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not explain the Dharma while looking at the face of a woman, with sidelong glances.

original: gal te de la yang chos ston par byed na /🔽der rig pa'i skyes pa yod pa 'gyur na sngar bshad pa'i tshul du ji srid 'dod par bshad par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: gal te de la yang chos ston par byed na / der rig pa'i skyes pa yod pa 'gyur na sngar bshad pa'i tshul du ji srid 'dod par bshad par bya ba 'am /
translated: If one does explain the Dharma to her,

original: yang na tshig lnga'am drug dag gi chos bshad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na tshig lnga'am drug dag gi chos bshad par bya ba yin te /
translated: then, as previously explained, one should explain it for as long as one wishes, or else one should explain the Dharma in five or six words.

original: dper na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po nas tshor ba'i phung po'i bar du zhes bya ba yin gyi gzhan du na log par sbyar ba'i zhi ba'i las kyi bdag nyid kyis srog 'joms par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po nas tshor ba'i phung po'i bar du zhes bya ba yin gyi gzhan du na log par sbyar ba'i zhi ba'i las kyi bdag nyid kyis srog 'joms par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one should explain the recollection of the Buddha, the aggregate of form, up to the aggregate of feeling, but not otherwise, because one would be engaged in a perverse application, and one would be destroying life with the nature of a pacifying rite.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: nyal dang 'dug dang 'gro sogs bud med spang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyal dang 'dug dang 'gro sogs bud med spang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Sleeping, sitting, walking, etc. with a woman are to be avoided.

original: dge tshul gyis bud med dang lhan cig gcig du chags pas dben par nyal ba dang 'dug pa dang yul gzhan du 'gro ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge tshul gyis bud med dang lhan cig gcig du chags pas dben par nyal ba dang 'dug pa dang yul gzhan du 'gro ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: The novice is to avoid sleeping, sitting, and going to another place in private with a woman, because of passion.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bsod snyoms la 'jug pa dang / gzhan dben par 'dug pa yang spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bsod snyoms la 'jug pa dang / gzhan dben par 'dug pa yang spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The words “etc.” indicate that he is to avoid going for alms and sitting in private with a woman.

original: de la 'dir chos bstan pa la sogs pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir chos bstan pa la sogs pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: Here, there is no fault in teaching the Dharma, etc.

original: ji ste skyes pa yod na nyes pa med //
analyzed: ji ste skyes pa yod na nyes pa med //
translated: If there is a man, there is no fault.

original: ces bya ba smos te nyal ba las gzhan du ji skad du bshad pa'i rig pa'i skyes pa legs par bshad pa la sogs pa yongs su go ba dang 'dzin nus pa yod na'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te nyal ba las gzhan du ji skad du bshad pa'i rig pa'i skyes pa legs par bshad pa la sogs pa yongs su go ba dang 'dzin nus pa yod na'o //
translated: If there is a man who understands and can grasp the explanation of the rules, etc., there is no fault in sleeping with a woman, except as otherwise stated.

original: nyal ba la ni khyo dang bu dang ming po la sogs pa gang las 'jigs pa dang ngo tsha bar 'gyur ba gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyal ba la ni khyo dang bu dang ming po la sogs pa gang las 'jigs pa dang ngo tsha bar 'gyur ba gzung bar bya'o //
translated: In sleeping, one should hold a man who is a husband, son, brother, etc., from whom one would have fear or shame.

original: dge tshul gyi tshig le'ur byas pa las mi tshangs par spyod pa las slar ldog pa'i gzhi gsum pa'o /
analyzed: dge tshul gyi tshig le'ur byas pa las mi tshangs par spyod pa las slar ldog pa'i gzhi gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third section on turning away from sexual misconduct in the Verses on the Points of the Novice Monk.

original: // / da ni /
analyzed: // / da ni /
translated: Now,🔽the fourth is explained by the following verse and so on:

original: bla ma de brjod blo yis mi chos las /🔽bla ma zhes bya ba la yod do zhes //
analyzed: bla ma de brjod blo yis mi chos las / bla ma zhes bya ba la yod do zhes //
translated: With the thought I have that which is superior to human qualities,

original: nga rgyal ma gtogs mi la brdzun du smras //
analyzed: nga rgyal ma gtogs mi la brdzun du smras //
translated: one lies to a human, except out of pride.

original: gzhan gyis go bar gyur na bskrad par bya //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzhi pa 'chad par byed la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis go bar gyur na bskrad par bya // zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzhi pa 'chad par byed la /
translated: If the other understands, one is expelled.

original: mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa bdag la yod ces gzhan rig pa'i mi la de brjod pa'i sems kyis brdzun du smras nas gzhan gyis go bar gyur na dngos gzhi'i nyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa bdag la yod ces gzhan rig pa'i mi la de brjod pa'i sems kyis brdzun du smras nas gzhan gyis go bar gyur na dngos gzhi'i nyes par 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is as follows: If one lies to another human with the thought I have that which is superior to human qualities, and the other understands, then one commits the actual downfall.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: Except out of pride is the meaning of the verse.

original: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ba la mi'i chos ni mi chos te de yang rnam pa @223a * //
analyzed: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ba la mi'i chos ni mi chos te de yang rnam pa @223a * //
translated: The meaning of the branches will now be explained. Human qualities are qualities of humans. They are also called

original: gnyis te / bla mar gyur pa dang / bla mar gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis te / bla mar gyur pa dang / bla mar gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: that which is not a higher worldly state and that which is a higher worldly state.

original: de la sgrib pa lnga la sogs pa ni mi chos bla ma ma yin pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa lnga la sogs pa ni mi chos bla ma ma yin pa yin te /
translated: The five hindrances, etc., are not higher worldly states

original: dman pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dman pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are inferior.

original: mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa bsam gtan la sogs pa ni bla ma gyur pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa bsam gtan la sogs pa ni bla ma gyur pa nyid yin te /
translated: The meditative absorptions, etc., are higher worldly states because

original: sgrib pa lnga la sogs pa la ltos na khyad par du 'phags pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga la sogs pa la ltos na khyad par du 'phags pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they are superior in relation to the five hindrances, etc.

original: mi chos nyid ni mi dag gis thob par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi chos nyid ni mi dag gis thob par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “worldly” means that which is obtained by worldly beings.

original: bla ma zhes bya ba ni bla ma zhes bya ba'i ming gang la yod pa zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas gang de lta bur gyur pa'i chos de ni bla ma zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bla ma zhes bya ba ni bla ma zhes bya ba'i ming gang la yod pa zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas gang de lta bur gyur pa'i chos de ni bla ma zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: That which is called “higher” is a higher worldly state.

original: dge tshul gyis smras na de bskrad par bya zhing bsnyil bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge tshul gyis smras na de bskrad par bya zhing bsnyil bar bya ste /
translated: If a novice monk says this, he should be expelled and degraded.

original: 'og tu ltung ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'og tu ltung ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The term “falls down” is understood.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni nges par bzung ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni nges par bzung ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word just should be understood as a specification.

original: de'i phyir gzhan brjod pa'i bsam pas gzhan brjod na chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan brjod pa'i bsam pas gzhan brjod na chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one speaks of something else with the intention of expressing something else, it becomes a minor offense.

original: su la smras pas she na /
analyzed: su la smras pas she na /
translated: To whom is it spoken?

original: mi la zhes bya ba smos te mi zhes bya ba ni mi'i rigs gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: mi la zhes bya ba smos te mi zhes bya ba ni mi'i rigs gzung ba yin no //
translated: The text says to a human being. The word human being includes those of the human class.

original: ji skad smras pas she na /
analyzed: ji skad smras pas she na /
translated: How is it spoken?

original: nga la yod ces bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: nga la yod ces bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The text says I have it.

original: de ni rnam pa gzhan mtshon par byed pa yin te dper na ngas thob po ngas shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gzhan mtshon par byed pa yin te dper na ngas thob po ngas shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig lta bu'o //
translated: This indicates another form, like the words I have attained, I have understood, and so on.

original: bsam pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: bsam pa gang gis she na /
translated: By what intention?

original: bla ma de brjod blo yis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bla ma de brjod blo yis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says with the intention of expressing the teacher.

original: bla ma'i brjod pa ni bla ma brjod pa ste //
analyzed: bla ma'i brjod pa ni bla ma brjod pa ste //
translated: The expression of the teacher is the expression of the teacher.

original: de'i blo dang bsam pa ni bla ma brjod blo yin te /
analyzed: de'i blo dang bsam pa ni bla ma brjod blo yin te /
translated: The mind and intention of that are the intention of expressing the teacher.

original: de'i phyir des so //
analyzed: de'i phyir des so //
translated: Therefore, by that.

original: 'di skad du mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa smra ba'i bsam pas zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa smra ba'i bsam pas zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is stated as with the intention of expressing what is superior to human qualities.

original: de la 'ga' zhig tu mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa rtogs pa med par sngar rtogs pa'i bsam pas bdag gis mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa rtogs so zhes bya ba de lta bu gsal bar byas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig tu mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa rtogs pa med par sngar rtogs pa'i bsam pas bdag gis mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa rtogs so zhes bya ba de lta bu gsal bar byas pa'i phyir //
translated: In some cases, the Buddha, without having any realization superior to that of human beings, said, “I have a realization superior to that of human beings,” in order to make it clear that he was not like others who make such claims.

original: nga rgyal ma gtogs zhes bya ba smos pa yin te mngon pa'i nga rgyal dag med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nga rgyal ma gtogs zhes bya ba smos pa yin te mngon pa'i nga rgyal dag med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “except in the case of pride” means except in the case of manifest pride.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni nyes pa med do /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni nyes pa med do /
translated: There is no fault in manifest pride.

original: brdzun zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “in the case of lying” means that there is no fault in lying when there is no perception of the lie.

original: gang gi tshe bskrad par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bskrad par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: When is it permissible to drive out a bodhisattva?

original: gzhan gyis go bar gyur pa ni gzhan gyis rtogs par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis go bar gyur pa ni gzhan gyis rtogs par gyur pa na'o //
translated: The phrase “when it is understood by others” means when it is understood by others.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i mi'i rgyud yul nyid du gang mtshon par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i mi'i rgyud yul nyid du gang mtshon par bya ba 'am /
translated: The phrase “by others” refers to the human realm that was just mentioned.

original: gzhan gyis de rtogs par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de rtogs par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “when it is understood by others” means when it is understood by others.

original: gzhan la brjod pa'i bsam pas mi gzhan la smras pa na chung bar @223b 'gyur zhing bzlog pa dang / de bzhin du yid gnyis kyang chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la brjod pa'i bsam pas mi gzhan la smras pa na chung bar @223b 'gyur zhing bzlog pa dang / de bzhin du yid gnyis kyang chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The same holds for doubt.

original: go bar gyur na zhes smos pa ni gnyid log pa dang / ra ro ba dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / skad mi go ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go bar gyur na zhes smos pa ni gnyid log pa dang / ra ro ba dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / skad mi go ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “if” is used because the offense is not incurred if the other person is asleep, intoxicated, insane, or does not understand the language.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don yin te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don yin te /
translated: The word “if” has the sense of “because.”

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyis go bar gyur na sdom pa 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bskrad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyis go bar gyur na sdom pa 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bskrad par bya ba yin te /
translated: Because the vow is broken if the other person understands, the offense is a serious one.

original: gong du bstan pa las bzlog pa ni thams cad du nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes shugs kyis brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa las bzlog pa ni thams cad du nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes shugs kyis brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The opposite of what has just been explained is always a light offense.

original: mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa de yang gang yin zhe na /🔽bsam gtan sogs dang mngon shes 'bras bur bcas //
analyzed: mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa de yang gang yin zhe na / bsam gtan sogs dang mngon shes 'bras bur bcas //
translated: What is meant by “transcending the human condition”?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse says, “The results of the meditative concentrations and so forth and of the superknowledges.”

original: bsam gtan dang por byas pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang por byas pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The first meditation, etc., are the meditations, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gzung zhing gzhan yang de lta bur gyur pa skye mched kyi mtshan nyid can byams pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gzung zhing gzhan yang de lta bur gyur pa skye mched kyi mtshan nyid can byams pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the formless meditative attainments and also the other such as the meditations on love, etc., which have the characteristics of the bases of mastery.

original: bsam gtan ni gzugs na spyod pa'i sems kyi bye brag yin la /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni gzugs na spyod pa'i sems kyi bye brag yin la /
translated: The meditations are the specific states of mind that occur in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi bye brag yin no //🔽mngon par shes pa ni mngon par shes pa lnga 'am /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi bye brag yin no // mngon par shes pa ni mngon par shes pa lnga 'am /
translated: The formless meditative attainments are the specific states of mind that occur in the formless realm.

original: mngon par shes pa drug dag yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug dag yin no //
translated: The superknowledges are the five or six superknowledges.

original: de la mngon par shes pa lnga ni lha'i mig dang / rna ba dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa lnga ni lha'i mig dang / rna ba dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: The five superknowledges are the divine eye, the divine ear, the recollection of former lives, the knowledge of others’ minds, and the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities.🔽The sixth superknowledge is the superknowledge of miraculous power.

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa'i mngon par shes pas bsres pa dag ni drug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa'i mngon par shes pas bsres pa dag ni drug par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are mixed with the superknowledge that is the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants, they become six.

original: 'bras bu ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni bzhi ste /
translated: The fruits are four:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the fruit of the stream-enterer, the fruit of the once-returner, the fruit of the non-returner, and the fruit of the perfected being.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas par 'jug pas na 'bras bur bcas pa'o //🔽yon tan ni yon tan du byed goms par byed pas na yon tan te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas par 'jug pas na 'bras bur bcas pa'o // yon tan ni yon tan du byed goms par byed pas na yon tan te /
translated: They are called fruits because they are the results of the path.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas brtsams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas brtsams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: The qualities are the four establishments of mindfulness, up to the eightfold noble path.

original: de dag ni 'bras bur bcas pa'i yon tan dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'bras bur bcas pa'i yon tan dag yin no //
translated: They are the qualities that are the fruits.

original: bslab pa'i tshig 'dir mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa'i tshig 'dir mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this verse on the training, the qualities that surpass the human state are taught.

original: da ni bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: da ni bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: Now, not only the first absorption, etc.,

original: 'on kyang de dag kyang yin no zhes sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag kyang yin no zhes sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: but also the qualities that are their fruits are included.

original: bla mar gyur pa bshad pa de ltar de tsam spyir bstan nas da ni /🔽brjod par bya @224a * //
analyzed: bla mar gyur pa bshad pa de ltar de tsam spyir bstan nas da ni / brjod par bya @224a * //
translated: Having thus taught the teacher in general, now,🔽the many topics to be expressed

original: ba rnam pa mang po dag / da ni bshad par bya yis nyan par gyis //
analyzed: ba rnam pa mang po dag / da ni bshad par bya yis nyan par gyis //
translated: will now be explained, so listen!

original: da ni da ltar te mi'i chos bla mar gyur pa 'di brjod bya gzhan la smra bar bya ba de bshad par bya yis mnyan par te rna gtod par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: da ni da ltar te mi'i chos bla mar gyur pa 'di brjod bya gzhan la smra bar bya ba de bshad par bya yis mnyan par te rna gtod par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Now, at present, this teaching that is superior to human Dharma will be explained, so listen, that is, pay attention.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba la /
translated: It says

original: brjod par bya ba rnam pa mang po'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba rnam pa mang po'o //
translated: many topics to be expressed.

original: dang ni yang gi don te bshad par bya ba rab tu bstan par bya ba bla mar gyur pa de mang por gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang 'chad par byed pa yang rnam pa mang po nyid yin no //
analyzed: dang ni yang gi don te bshad par bya ba rab tu bstan par bya ba bla mar gyur pa de mang por gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang 'chad par byed pa yang rnam pa mang po nyid yin no //
translated: And has the meaning of also. Not only is the topic to be explained, the teaching that is superior, manifold, but also the expounder is manifold.

original: rnam pa mang po de yang kha cig tu ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas /
analyzed: rnam pa mang po de yang kha cig tu ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas /
translated: In some cases, the manifold is in terms of the result,

original: kha cig tu ni dngos su /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni dngos su /
translated: in some cases, in terms of the actual thing.

original: kha cig tu ni de'i chos brjod pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni de'i chos brjod pa'i sgo nas /
translated: In some cases, it is through the door of expressing his Dharma.

original: kha cig tu ni nyams pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni nyams pa'i sgo nas /
translated: In some cases, it is through the door of his decline.

original: kha cig tu ni gzhan la snyan 'dogs pa'i sgo nas /🔽kha cig tu ni don 'dra ba brjod pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni gzhan la snyan 'dogs pa'i sgo nas / kha cig tu ni don 'dra ba brjod pa'i sgo nas /
translated: In some cases, it is through the door of praising others.🔽In some cases, it is through the door of expressing a similar meaning.

original: kha cig tu zur gyis glengs pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: kha cig tu zur gyis glengs pa'i sgo nas /
translated: In some cases, it is through the door of indirect suggestion.

original: kha cig tu ni phyi ma yang dag pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni phyi ma yang dag pa'i sgo nas /
translated: In some cases, it is through the door of the future perfect.🔽In some cases, it is through the door of accepting without speaking.🔽These are the many ways of being a friend.

original: kha cig tu ni mi smra bas dang du len pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba rnam pa mang pos bshes par bya yis mnyan par gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de dag kyang /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni mi smra bas dang du len pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba rnam pa mang pos bshes par bya yis mnyan par gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de dag kyang /
translated: Listen means that you should understand them.🔽They are expressed in order by the following verses, beginning with:

original: lha la sogs mthong lha min la sogs bdag / ces bya ba la sogs pas go rims bzhin du rjod par byed pa la /
analyzed: lha la sogs mthong lha min la sogs bdag / ces bya ba la sogs pas go rims bzhin du rjod par byed pa la /
translated: Gods and so on are seen, and the self and so on.

original: lha la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni lha la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni lha la sogs pa ste /
translated: Gods and so on are those who are gods and so on.

original: mthong ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mthong ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: They are seen.

original: lha'i mig gis zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig gis zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The eye of the gods is the remainder of the sentence.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni klu dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni klu dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The term “and so on” includes nāgas, yakṣas, and so on.

original: 'chi ba med pas na 'chi med de lha dag yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba med pas na 'chi med de lha dag yin no //
translated: They are called “immortals” because they are immortal.

original: de dag la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni lha la sogs te /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni lha la sogs te /
translated: Those who are like them are called “immortals and so on.”

original: de dag bdag la lta zhing zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: de dag bdag la lta zhing zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: They are looking at me.

original: bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du gyur pa'i mthong ba khas blangs nas de skad du smra ba yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du gyur pa'i mthong ba khas blangs nas de skad du smra ba yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that he is saying this after having accepted that he sees them directly with his own eyes.

original: dang ni 'gro ba la sogs pa phan tshun du 'phel ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dang ni 'gro ba la sogs pa phan tshun du 'phel ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The term “and so on” should be understood to indicate the mutual increase of going and so on.

original: de dag ni 'bras bu nye bar ston pa'i sgo nas smra ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'bras bu nye bar ston pa'i sgo nas smra ba yin no //
translated: They are speaking from the perspective of the presentation of results.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The knowledge of suffering and so on.

original: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin te /
translated: Suffering is the truth of suffering.

original: de'i dngos po ni sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: The nature of that is suffering itself.

original: de la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which is like that is called “suffering and so on.”

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bden pa gzhan dag sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bden pa gzhan dag sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the other truths.

original: 'dis ni bla mar gyur pa'i chos dngos su rab tu ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni bla mar gyur pa'i chos dngos su rab tu ston par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the direct teaching of the Dharma by the Master.

original: dang ni bsam gtan la sogs pa yongs su @224b sdud pa yin te /
analyzed: dang ni bsam gtan la sogs pa yongs su @224b sdud pa yin te /
translated: The word “and” includes the concentrations, etc.

original: bdag gi bsam gtan khong du chud do zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bdag gi bsam gtan khong du chud do zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the statement, “I have mastered the concentrations.”

original: de lta na dang ni gnyi gar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na dang ni gnyi gar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, “and” is to be applied in both cases.

original: zag pa zad pa'i nges pa'i khyad par dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i chos nyid brjod pas lung ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i nges pa'i khyad par dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i chos nyid brjod pas lung ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: The prediction is made by stating the nature of that Dharma, as in the statement, “The distinctions of the ascertainment of the destruction of the contaminants,” etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zag pa zad pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni zag pa zad pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zag pa zad pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni zag pa zad pa ste /
translated: The destruction of the contaminants of attachment, etc. is the destruction of the contaminants.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is freedom from attachment.

original: de dag gi nges pa ni so sor nges pa'i khyad par te gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de dag gi nges pa ni so sor nges pa'i khyad par te gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The ascertainment of that is the distinction of the ascertainment.

original: stan bkra la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag dag yin pa de'i phyir de dang bdag nyid kho na yang dag par ldan par smra bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: stan bkra la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag dag yin pa de'i phyir de dang bdag nyid kho na yang dag par ldan par smra bar byed pa'o //
translated: because they are the particular characteristics of a variegated seat, etc.

original: nyid ni bdag nyid kyis gzhan ldan par smras na nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid ni bdag nyid kyis gzhan ldan par smras na nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one were to say that it is the self itself that possesses them, the fault would be slight.

original: da ni de'i dper byed pa /
analyzed: da ni de'i dper byed pa /
translated: Now, he gives an example of that:

original: gang du stan bkra la sogs dgra bcom thob //
analyzed: gang du stan bkra la sogs dgra bcom thob //
translated: “Where the variegated seat, etc. are obtained,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
translated: he says, etc.

original: bkra ba ste sna tshogs pa'i stan la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni stan bkra la sogs pa yin pa de'i phyir de khyim gyi nang du thob pa'o //
analyzed: bkra ba ste sna tshogs pa'i stan la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni stan bkra la sogs pa yin pa de'i phyir de khyim gyi nang du thob pa'o //
translated: Those which are variegated seats, etc. are variegated seats, etc. Therefore, they are obtained in the home.

original: ci thams cad kyis sam 'on te dgra bcom pas she na /
analyzed: ci thams cad kyis sam 'on te dgra bcom pas she na /
translated: By whom? Is it by all, or by the arhat?

original: dgra bcom zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: He says, “by the arhat.”

original: de ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba la nges pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba la nges pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i 'og tu /
translated: Thus, after showing that it is certain that one is free from attachment,

original: de ni bdag gis thob sta gzhan gyis min //
analyzed: de ni bdag gis thob sta gzhan gyis min //
translated: “That is obtained by me, not by another.”

original: zhes bya ba smra ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smra ba'o //
translated: This is what they say.

original: de skad du bstan pa na gzhan gyis 'di yang dgra bcom pa dag yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du bstan pa na gzhan gyis 'di yang dgra bcom pa dag yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When this is taught, others understand that these are also arhats.

original: dang ni bdag nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mtshungs par sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ni bdag nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mtshungs par sdud pa yin no //
translated: The word “and” includes those who are themselves free from attachment.

original: de nyid du ni zhes bya ba ni khyim gang du dgra bcom pas thob pa gzhan gyis min te /
analyzed: de nyid du ni zhes bya ba ni khyim gang du dgra bcom pas thob pa gzhan gyis min te /
translated: “In that very place” means in the house where the arhat attained, not in another.

original: gzhan nyid kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is that it is not in another place.

original: / nyams pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: / nyams pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to falling away,

original: dge sbyong lam las yongs su bdag nyams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dge sbyong lam las yongs su bdag nyams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the text says, “The monk falls away from the path, etc.”

original: yongs su ste kun nas 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa las nyams shing yongs su nyams par gyur cas bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: yongs su ste kun nas 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa las nyams shing yongs su nyams par gyur cas bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: “Completely” means from the path of the āryas, etc. “Falls away” means to retrogress. “Has fallen away” is the remainder.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te 'phags pa'i lam thob pa dang ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te 'phags pa'i lam thob pa dang ma thob pa'o //
translated: That also is of two kinds: falling away from the ārya path and falling away from what has not been attained.

original: gang gi phyir 'phags pa'i lam ma thob pa la yang nyams pa zhes brjod pa de'i phyir khyad par du bya ba'i khyad par thob pa las nyams par gyur to zhes dge tshul smra na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'phags pa'i lam ma thob pa la yang nyams pa zhes brjod pa de'i phyir khyad par du bya ba'i khyad par thob pa las nyams par gyur to zhes dge tshul smra na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because it is said that one degenerates even when one has not obtained the ārya path, therefore, one should add, “if the novice monk says, ‘I have degenerated from the special state obtained.’”

original: gzhan las khyad par du bya ba yin pas na khyad par te /
analyzed: gzhan las khyad par du bya ba yin pas na khyad par te /
translated: The special state is special because it is superior to others.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yin pa de'i phyir @225a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yin pa de'i phyir @225a * //
translated: It is the ārya path.

original: gal te thob pa las nyams so zhes smra bar byed pa de'i tshe bshad ma thag pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te thob pa las nyams so zhes smra bar byed pa de'i tshe bshad ma thag pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If he says, “I have degenerated from the obtainment of that,” then the fault just explained would occur.

original: da ni de nyid dper byed pa /
analyzed: da ni de nyid dper byed pa /
translated: Now, to illustrate that point,

original: dge sbyong lam las yongs su bdag nyams zhes bya bas ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dge sbyong lam las yongs su bdag nyams zhes bya bas ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: he says, “If he says, ‘I have completely degenerated from the state of a śramaṇa,’

original: dge sbyong gi dngos po ni dge sbyong nyid de 'phags pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi dngos po ni dge sbyong nyid de 'phags pa'i lam yin te /
translated: the state of a śramaṇa is the ārya path.

original: gang gi phyir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan bcos las /
translated: Because it is well known in the treatises:

original: dge sbyong nyid ni dri ma med pa'i lam yin no zhes rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong nyid ni dri ma med pa'i lam yin no zhes rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: The state of a śramaṇa is the stainless path.

original: dge sbyong yang de yin la 'phags pa'i lam yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong yang de yin la 'phags pa'i lam yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: It is a spiritual practitioner and it is the noble path, thus it is called the noble path of spiritual practitioners.

original: de las bdag nyams so zhes dge tshul bdag nyid smra ba yin no //
analyzed: de las bdag nyams so zhes dge tshul bdag nyid smra ba yin no //
translated: The novice monk himself speaks of his own downfall.

original: ma thob pa las nyams pa'i bsam pas ni nyes pa chung bar bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma thob pa las nyams pa'i bsam pas ni nyes pa chung bar bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is explained that the fault is slight if it is done with the intention of relinquishing what has not yet been obtained.

original: dge sbyong gi lam ni mi'i chos gzhan gyis nye bar mtshon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi lam ni mi'i chos gzhan gyis nye bar mtshon par byed pa'o //
translated: The path of spiritual practitioners is indicated by other human qualities.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: bla ma'i tshig rnams de dang ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bla ma'i tshig rnams de dang ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is endowed with the words of the guru.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de lta bu'i bla ma'i tshig brjod pa dang ldan zhing 'brel par brjod pa'i ngag 'di la zhes bya ba'i don yin pa de bas na tshig dang rab tu ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bla ma'i tshig brjod pa dang ldan zhing 'brel par brjod pa'i ngag 'di la zhes bya ba'i don yin pa de bas na tshig dang rab tu ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is endowed with and connected to the words of the guru. This is the meaning of this statement. Therefore, it is endowed with words.

original: bcom nas dmyal bar 'gro zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i nyes byas kyis rnam par bcom zhing bshig nas dmyal bar 'gro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcom nas dmyal bar 'gro zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i nyes byas kyis rnam par bcom zhing bshig nas dmyal bar 'gro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase having been destroyed, one goes to hell means that having been destroyed and ruined by a root infraction, one goes to hell.

original: mi ma yin pa thams cad la rim pa 'di yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa thams cad la rim pa 'di yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is this the procedure for all non-humans?

original: phyag dar khrod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te phyag dar khrod kyi 'dre ni 'dre kha 'bar ma yin la /
analyzed: phyag dar khrod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te phyag dar khrod kyi 'dre ni 'dre kha 'bar ma yin la /
translated: The text says, The ghost of a charnel ground, etc. The ghost of a charnel ground is a ghost with a gaping mouth.

original: de dag dang so sor 'brel ba dag la nyes pa chung ba ste /
analyzed: de dag dang so sor 'brel ba dag la nyes pa chung ba ste /
translated: The fault for those who are related to them is slight.

original: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it becomes a fault that should be confessed.

original: lha la sogs pa'i dngos gzhi'i yan lag gi skabs su phyag dar khrod kyi 'dre'i tshig yod pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa'i dngos gzhi'i yan lag gi skabs su phyag dar khrod kyi 'dre'i tshig yod pa de'i phyir /
translated: In the context of the main part of the rite for gods, etc., the words ghost of a charnel ground are present.

original: phyag dar khrod kyi 'dre mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras na chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod kyi 'dre mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras na chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: Therefore, the phrase if one says 'I see the ghost of a charnel ground,' etc., it is slight is a remainder of the words.

original: dang ni de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan yang chung bar 'gyur ro zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ni de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan yang chung bar 'gyur ro zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: And similarly, the reason for apprehending its own character would be small.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par byed pas na rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ste shes pa'i khyad par bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi 'dzin par byed pa dang / chags pa kun nas 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par byed pas na rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ste shes pa'i khyad par bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi 'dzin par byed pa dang / chags pa kun nas 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: The reason for apprehending its own character is apprehending the specific knowledge of the actual basis of absorption and apprehending attachment.

original: gang gi phyir shes pa'i dngos po de nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid so sor snang ba de'i rgyu mtshan dang byed rgyu bgrod par bya ba yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid yin la de yang de la @225b cung zhig mi gsal bar snang
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa'i dngos po de nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid so sor snang ba de'i rgyu mtshan dang byed rgyu bgrod par bya ba yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid yin la de yang de la @225b cung zhig mi gsal bar snang
translated: Because it apprehends its own character, it is the reason and cause for the appearance of each individual character in that very thing that is known. It is the characteristic of the state of not completing the path to be traversed and it appears slightly unclear to that.

original: ba smra bar byed na de la yang nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don yin pa'am yang na rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa yang yin la rgyu mtshan yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: ba smra bar byed na de la yang nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don yin pa'am yang na rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa yang yin la rgyu mtshan yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Or else, it is a particular inclusion, since it is both a characteristic and a reason.

original: gang gi phyir de la yang rang gi mtshan nyid so sor snang ba mi gsal ba'i rgyu mtshan bgrod par bya ba yongs su ma rdzogs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pa dang zhes smos pa'i dngos gzhi'i yan lag gi gnas
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la yang rang gi mtshan nyid so sor snang ba mi gsal ba'i rgyu mtshan bgrod par bya ba yongs su ma rdzogs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pa dang zhes smos pa'i dngos gzhi'i yan lag gi gnas
translated: Because of that, the basis of the branch of the main part, which is called the knowledge of suffering and so forth, is the indistinct appearance of the individual characteristics, the reason for the incomplete path and so forth.

original: su 'di blta bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: su 'di blta bar bya ba yin no //
translated: This should be seen as the basis.

original: de bas na 'di bdag la yod do zhes lung ston par byed na nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di bdag la yod do zhes lung ston par byed na nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if he were to declare, “This exists for me,” it should be understood that there would be an offense of wrong conduct.🔽In terms of accusing others,

original: gzhan la snyad 'dogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gzhan la snyad 'dogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: it is said:

original: sdom can gang dag lha sgra thos yod ces //
analyzed: sdom can gang dag lha sgra thos yod ces //
translated: Those who are vow holders, who hear the sound of gods,

original: ji bzhin gzhan la snyad 'dogs smra byed pa //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji bzhin gzhan la snyad 'dogs smra byed pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: One who speaks by ascribing to others what is not the case.

original: pha rol po gzhan la snyad 'dogs pa ni gzhan la snyad 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol po gzhan la snyad 'dogs pa ni gzhan la snyad 'dogs pa ste /
translated: Ascribing to others means ascribing to others.

original: gzhan gyi ming gis zhes bya ba'i don yin pa de'i phyir gzhan la snyad 'dogs pas smra bar byed na yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ming gis zhes bya ba'i don yin pa de'i phyir gzhan la snyad 'dogs pas smra bar byed na yang ngo //
translated: The meaning of “by the name of others” is that, therefore, one speaks by ascribing to others.

original: yang gi sgra ni snga ma la ji lta ba de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur ro zhes sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni snga ma la ji lta ba de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur ro zhes sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: The word “also” is a conjunction that includes what is stated previously.

original: de'i dper byed pa /
analyzed: de'i dper byed pa /
translated: The example of that is stated:

original: sdom can gang dag lha sgra thos yod ces //
analyzed: sdom can gang dag lha sgra thos yod ces //
translated: “Are there any who hear the sound of the gods?”

original: zhes bya bas ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: This is taught.

original: gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu bdag nyid la bsams nas ;
analyzed: gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu bdag nyid la bsams nas ;
translated: In some situation, having thought about oneself,🔽“Are there any who hear the sound of the gods?”

original: sdom can gang dag lha dag gi sgra thos pa yod do zhes bya ba'i tshig de las de ni nges par 'di nyid yin no zhes gzhan sems par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdom can gang dag lha dag gi sgra thos pa yod do zhes bya ba'i tshig de las de ni nges par 'di nyid yin no zhes gzhan sems par 'gyur te /
translated: From that statement, others will think, “That is definitely this.”

original: 'dir de nyid chung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir de nyid chung ba'o //
translated: Here, that is small.

original: ci'i phyir chung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir chung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it small?

original: smras pa / bdag ces bya ba de dang bral ba de ni chung bar 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / bdag ces bya ba de dang bral ba de ni chung bar 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: He replied: “That which is free from the notion of ‘I’ is a minor offense.”

original: de ni chur zhes bya ba la de yang de yin la chung ba yang yin pas na zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: de ni chur zhes bya ba la de yang de yin la chung ba yang yin pas na zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: “That” refers to the offense that is a minor offense.

original: de yang bshad ma thag pa'i nyes byas chung bar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bshad ma thag pa'i nyes byas chung bar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as a minor offense, as explained above.🔽The same is true of speaking by way of ascribing to another.

original: gzhan la snyad 'dogs pas smra ba yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar spyi'i tshig tu bstan pas 'dis de dag gi dper byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la snyad 'dogs pas smra ba yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar spyi'i tshig tu bstan pas 'dis de dag gi dper byed pa yin te /
translated: Since this is taught in general terms, it is an example of those.

original: 'di skad du bdag la bsams nas gzhan gyi ming gis spyi mi'i chos bla ma smra bar byed na nyes pa chung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bdag la bsams nas gzhan gyi ming gis spyi mi'i chos bla ma smra bar byed na nyes pa chung bar 'gyur te /
translated: It is like saying, “If one speaks of a superior quality of a human by way of the name of another, thinking of oneself, it is a minor offense.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i bdag gi sgra ma brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i bdag gi sgra ma brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: This is because the term ‘I’ that was just explained is not used.”

original: gang gi tshe bdag ces bya ba yang brjod par gyur ba de'i tshe ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag ces bya ba yang brjod par gyur ba de'i tshe ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When the term “I” is used, what then?

original: @226a * // bdag gi sgra dang ldan na rtsa bar 'gyur //
analyzed: @226a * // bdag gi sgra dang ldan na rtsa bar 'gyur //
translated: If it is endowed with the word “I,” it is a root.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: gzhan la snyad 'dogs pas go bar byas pa'i phyir de ni bdag nyid yin no zhes bdag nyid sgrub par byed pa dang ldan zhing 'byor ba'i tshig gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la snyad 'dogs pas go bar byas pa'i phyir de ni bdag nyid yin no zhes bdag nyid sgrub par byed pa dang ldan zhing 'byor ba'i tshig gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That word is called “root” if it is endowed with and possesses the establishment of “I” in the sense that “I” is understood through ascription to another.

original: de bas na tshig des smras na rtsa bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na tshig des smras na rtsa bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if that word is spoken, it is a root.

original: ni ni snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: ni ni snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
translated: The word “only” means “in particular.”

original: de bzhin du gzhan la snyad 'dogs pa gzhan la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la snyad 'dogs pa gzhan la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the other ascriptions to another.
