original: don 'dra ba brjod pa bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i sgra brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don 'dra ba brjod pa bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i sgra brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the expression of similar meaning, he says, “Just as the expression of similar words,” and so on.

original: mtshungs pa yang de yin la sgra yang yin pas na mtshungs par gyur pa'i sgra dag ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa yang de yin la sgra yang yin pas na mtshungs par gyur pa'i sgra dag ste /
translated: Since it is similar and it is a word, it is a similar word.

original: gang dag sgra mtshungs la don tha dad pa ni dper na 'bras bu'i sgra dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / aa mra'i 'bras bu la gang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag sgra mtshungs la don tha dad pa ni dper na 'bras bu'i sgra dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / aa mra'i 'bras bu la gang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those that have the same sound but different meanings are, for example, the word “fruit” which is used for the fruit of the ascetic and the fruit of the mango tree.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the others.

original: yang na mtshungs pa de 'dra ba'i sgra don gang la yod pa de ni mtshungs par gyur pa'i sgra dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mtshungs pa de 'dra ba'i sgra don gang la yod pa de ni mtshungs par gyur pa'i sgra dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Or else, that which has the same sound and meaning is similar.

original: de'i phyir de dang bdag nyid yang dag par ldan par smra bar byed pa las zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang bdag nyid yang dag par ldan par smra bar byed pa las zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, it is connected with the statement: “because of the assertion of identity with that.”

original: gong du mtshungs pa'i sgras mi'i chos bla ma dang ldan pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong du mtshungs pa'i sgras mi'i chos bla ma dang ldan pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word “similar” above expresses the possession of a quality that is superior to human nature.

original: dang ni ji ltar zhes bya ba gong du ji lta ba de bzhin du 'dir yang zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ni ji ltar zhes bya ba gong du ji lta ba de bzhin du 'dir yang zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “and” in the verse summarizes the question: “just as” in the previous verse, “so also here.”

original: bslab la gnas nas bdag ni bslab ce 'am //
analyzed: bslab la gnas nas bdag ni bslab ce 'am //
translated: “If I am to train in the precepts,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe ston par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe ston par byed de /
translated: ” etc.

original: bslab pa ni spyod pa ste tshul khrims la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bslab pa ni spyod pa ste tshul khrims la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Training is conduct, up to the point of abiding in morality.

original: de la bsam pa ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam pa ni sems pa'o //
translated: Among them, intention is thought.

original: de la bslab pa la bsams nas zhes bya ba ni kun du spyod pa la sems pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'i don te bsams pa des so //
analyzed: de la bslab pa la bsams nas zhes bya ba ni kun du spyod pa la sems pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'i don te bsams pa des so //
translated: Among them, having thought about training means by way of thinking about conduct.

original: bdag ni slob pa zhas bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag ni slob pa zhas bya ba smos te /
translated: I am a trainee.

original: gang gi phyir tha ma'i 'phags pa ma gtogs pa slob pa bdun la bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha ma'i 'phags pa ma gtogs pa slob pa bdun la bya ste /
translated: This is said because, except for the final ārya, the seven trainees are trainees,

original: spang bar bya ba ma lus pa spong ba la slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma lus pa spong ba la slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they train in abandoning all that is to be abandoned.

original: de la 'di ni bka' las rab tu grags pa'i tshul yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di ni bka' las rab tu grags pa'i tshul yin no //
translated: This is the way it is well known in the scriptures.

original: so so'i skye bo 'ga' zhig kyang so sor thar pa'i bslab pa la slob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i ngas pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis de yang slob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'ga' zhig kyang so sor thar pa'i bslab pa la slob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i ngas pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis de yang slob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even some ordinary beings are trainees because they train in the training of the pratimokṣa.

original: de'i phyir bsam pas smras na chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam pas smras na chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, if one speaks with intention, it is small. This is the meaning.

original: yang na // lam la zhugs nas bdag ni lam gnas shes //
analyzed: yang na // lam la zhugs nas bdag ni lam gnas shes //
translated: having entered the path, I know I abide in the path.

original: bya ba la sogs pas kyang don 'dra ba nyid ston par byed de /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pas kyang don 'dra ba nyid ston par byed de /
translated: And by the words “and so on,” the same meaning is indicated.

original: lam du zhugs nas 'phags pa'i lam la @226b gnas pa nyid go bar byed pa'i bsam pas bdag ni lam la gnas pa yin no zhes smras pa de lta na yang nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lam du zhugs nas 'phags pa'i lam la @226b gnas pa nyid go bar byed pa'i bsam pas bdag ni lam la gnas pa yin no zhes smras pa de lta na yang nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If, having entered the path, with the intention of making known that I abide in the ārya path, I say, “I abide in the path,” then the fault is slight.

original: lam zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lam zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The word “path” shows another aspect.

original: sogs pa de dag de bzhin no zhes bya ba la de dag ni de lta bu'i don te de lta bu la sogs pa'i mtshungs pa'i sgra dag gis sgrub par byed pa dag ni sngar ji ltar chung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di la yang zhes bya🔽ba'i don to //
analyzed: sogs pa de dag de bzhin no zhes bya ba la de dag ni de lta bu'i don te de lta bu la sogs pa'i mtshungs pa'i sgra dag gis sgrub par byed pa dag ni sngar ji ltar chung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “And so on” means that those words with similar meanings, such as “just so,” “just as,” and “in the same way,” are used to prove that just as the fault is slight in the previous case, so it is slight in this case.

original: sogs pa'i skras ni mtshungs pa gzhan rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dag kyang yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i skras ni mtshungs pa gzhan rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dag kyang yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The word “and so on” should be understood to include other similar words, such as “stream-enterer.”

original: dper na rgyun la gnas nas bdag ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyun la gnas nas bdag ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “I am a stream-enterer” is based on the stream.

original: rgyun gyi sgra ni 'phags pa'i lam dang / chu bo'i rgyun la yang bya ba de'i phyir don mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun gyi sgra ni 'phags pa'i lam dang / chu bo'i rgyun la yang bya ba de'i phyir don mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The term “stream” is used for the noble path and for the stream of a river. Therefore, the meaning is similar.

original: de bzhin du kun du spyod pa'i 'tshang ba las grol ba la bsams nas bdag ni 'ching ba la sogs pa las grol bar gyur to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun du spyod pa'i 'tshang ba las grol ba la bsams nas bdag ni 'ching ba la sogs pa las grol bar gyur to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Similarly, thinking of liberation from the bondage of conduct, it is said, “I am liberated from bondage, etc.”

original: gang gi phyir 'ching ba'i sgras 'dod chags la sogs pa brjod pa de 'dod chags kyi bcing ba dang / zhe sdang gi bcing ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun du spyod pa la sogs pa dang / 'gog pa zhas bya bar don mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'ching ba'i sgras 'dod chags la sogs pa brjod pa de 'dod chags kyi bcing ba dang / zhe sdang gi bcing ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun du spyod pa la sogs pa dang / 'gog pa zhas bya bar don mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The term “bondage” refers to desire, etc. Therefore, the meaning is similar because the terms “bondage of desire” and “bondage of hatred,” etc., refer to conduct, etc., and cessation.

original: 'ga' zhig snod la sogs pa cung zad med pa las bsams te cung zad spangs pa go bar bya ba'i phyir bdag la cung zhig kyang med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig snod la sogs pa cung zad med pa las bsams te cung zad spangs pa go bar bya ba'i phyir bdag la cung zhig kyang med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Some, thinking that the word something is used to refer to a small amount, say that the word something is used to refer to a small amount that is relinquished.

original: 'di la cung zad med pa'i sgras rdzas dang nyon mongs pa la bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la cung zad med pa'i sgras rdzas dang nyon mongs pa la bya ba yin te /
translated: The word something refers to both substance and affliction,

original: 'di gnyis med par don mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis med par don mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of both is the same.

original: so so'i skye bo dang dgra bcom pa la cung zad kyang med do zhes mtshungs pa'i sgra brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa dag tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang dgra bcom pa la cung zad kyang med do zhes mtshungs pa'i sgra brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa dag tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word something should be applied to the statement, “There is nothing at all for ordinary beings and arhats.”

original: gang gi phyir slob pa la sogs pa'i sgras go bar byed pa bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pas bdag la gzhan gyis zag pa med pa'i chos dang ldan pa dang / slob pa la sogs pa yin par so sor shes par 'gyur ro snyam pa de la rang gi bsam pa'i dbang dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir slob pa la sogs pa'i sgras go bar byed pa bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pas bdag la gzhan gyis zag pa med pa'i chos dang ldan pa dang / slob pa la sogs pa yin par so sor shes par 'gyur ro snyam pa de la rang gi bsam pa'i dbang dang /
translated: The word learner and so on is explained to be an expression that indicates that others understand that the self possesses uncontaminated qualities and is a learner and so on.

original: gzhan gyis de bzhin rtogs pa dag las nyes par 'gyur ba dang / ma yin na ches chung bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de bzhin rtogs pa dag las nyes par 'gyur ba dang / ma yin na ches chung bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the offense is less serious if the other person understands it as it was intended, or if he does not understand it at all.

original: bsam pa dang gzhan yid ches pa thams cad la thams cad du brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa dang gzhan yid ches pa thams cad la thams cad du brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: The offense is less serious if the other person is not worthy of respect, or if the words are spoken in jest.🔽The offense is less serious if the words are spoken indirectly, as in the following verse:

original: ae ma'o ji ltar bdag 'dra khyod gyur cig /'on tang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: ae ma'o ji ltar bdag 'dra khyod gyur cig /'on tang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras ldan 'gyur //
translated: Oh, how I wish that you, who are like me, would attain the fruit of nonreturner!

original: @227a * // da ltar de ltar 'phags pa bdag min zhes //🔽zur gyis rjod par byed na chung ba nyid //
analyzed: @227a * // da ltar de ltar 'phags pa bdag min zhes // zur gyis rjod par byed na chung ba nyid //
translated: But since you are not yet a noble one, you should keep this to yourself!

original: ces bya bas zur gyis smra ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya bas zur gyis smra ba smos pa yin te /
translated: The verse uses the word indirectly to refer to the offense of speaking indirectly.

original: zur gyis smos pa ni cha tsam smras pa yin pa de'i phyir zur gyis brjod cing smra ba las nyes pa chung bar 'gyur gyi dngos gzhir ni mi 'gyur ro zhes nyid ni nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: zur gyis smos pa ni cha tsam smras pa yin pa de'i phyir zur gyis brjod cing smra ba las nyes pa chung bar 'gyur gyi dngos gzhir ni mi 'gyur ro zhes nyid ni nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: The offense is less serious if the words are spoken indirectly, that is, if only part of what is said is meant literally. The word only in the verse indicates that the offense is not a downfall.

original: de'i dper byed pa /
analyzed: de'i dper byed pa /
translated: The following verse is an example of indirect speech:

original: ae ma'o ji ltar bdag 'dra khyod gyur cig / ces bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ae ma'o ji ltar bdag 'dra khyod gyur cig / ces bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: The verse Ah! How could you be like me! and so on, teaches this.

original: ae ma'o ji ltar bdag ci 'dra ba ste bdag ji ltar de bzhin du khyod kyang de dang 'dra bar gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o ji ltar bdag ci 'dra ba ste bdag ji ltar de bzhin du khyod kyang de dang 'dra bar gyur cig pa'o //
translated: Ah! How could you be like me? means How could you be like me? How could you be like me? means How could you be like me?.

original: ae ma ni 'dod pa bsngags pa'i smra sngags yin no //
analyzed: ae ma ni 'dod pa bsngags pa'i smra sngags yin no //
translated: Ah! is an exclamation of praise for the desire.

original: de skad du smras pa'i 'og tu /🔽'on tang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: de skad du smras pa'i 'og tu / 'on tang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras ldan 'gyur //
translated: After saying that,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag ji lta ba de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes skad du smras par gyur na zhes bya ba ni drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag ji lta ba de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes skad du smras par gyur na zhes bya ba ni drang bar bya'o //
translated: then you will have the fruit of nonreturner and so on, teaches You will be like me.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don yin te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don yin te /
translated: The word ni means because.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu nyid du gyur na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu nyid du gyur na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Because of that, what will happen?

original: smras pa ; phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa ; phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is said, You will have the fruit of nonreturner.

original: da ltar teng de skad du smras na gzhan yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar teng de skad du smras na gzhan yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that now, others will believe it.

original: 'on kyang phyir mi 'ong ba yin pas rang nyid kyang bdag dang mnyam pa nyid du kun du bstan pa'i phyir de las gzhan gyis bdag phyir mi 'ong ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan par so sor shes par 'gyur ro zhes rnam pa gzhan 'dis smra🔽bar byed pa dag la chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyir mi 'ong ba yin pas rang nyid kyang bdag dang mnyam pa nyid du kun du bstan pa'i phyir de las gzhan gyis bdag phyir mi 'ong ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan par so sor shes par 'gyur ro zhes rnam pa gzhan 'dis smra bar byed pa dag la chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by this other method, he would be less guilty when he says, “Others should know that I possess the fruit of nonreturner and so on.”

original: gal te yang phyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: gal te yang phyis 'di skad du /
translated: If he later says,

original: da ltar 'phags pa bdag min zhes //
analyzed: da ltar 'phags pa bdag min zhes //
translated: “Now I am not an ārya,”

original: zhes bya ba smras pa de lta na yang zur gyis smras pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras pa de lta na yang zur gyis smras pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: then even though he says this, he would still be guilty of indirect speech.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly, he would say,

original: bsam gtan snyoms zhugs deng ni bdag ma yin //
analyzed: bsam gtan snyoms zhugs deng ni bdag ma yin //
translated: “Now I am not absorbed in meditative concentration,”🔽and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzhan yang 'di skad du bdag ni deng bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa ma yin no zhes zur gyis smras na nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzhan yang 'di skad du bdag ni deng bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa ma yin no zhes zur gyis smras na nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If he says, “Now I am not absorbed in meditative concentration,” he would be less guilty by indirect speech.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni zur gyis smra ba'i rnam pa dag nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni zur gyis smra ba'i rnam pa dag nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in the form of a rhetorical question.

original: ji ltar bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa ma yin no zhes zur gyis ston pa de bzhin du khar rtsang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la khar rtsang zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i nyin zhag la bya ste dbang du byed pa gtso
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa ma yin no zhes zur gyis ston pa de bzhin du khar rtsang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la khar rtsang zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i nyin zhag la bya ste dbang du byed pa gtso
translated: Just as it is said that one does not enter meditative attainment, in the same way, it is said that one does not enter meditative attainment yesterday and so on.🔽Yesterday means the previous day, because the present is primary.

original: bo yin pa'i phyir khar rtsang bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i nyin @227b zhag la snyoms par zhugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bo yin pa'i phyir khar rtsang bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i nyin @227b zhag la snyoms par zhugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The statement one enters meditative attainment yesterday means one enters meditative attainment in the past.🔽In the same way, it is said that one does not enter meditative attainment today.

original: de bzhin du khar nyin phan chad min zhes bya ba la khar nyin zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i nyi ma khar rtsang zhes bya ba la ltos pa phan chad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du khar nyin phan chad min zhes bya ba la khar nyin zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i nyi ma khar rtsang zhes bya ba la ltos pa phan chad de /
translated: Today means the present day, because the present is primary.🔽The statement one enters meditative attainment today means one enters meditative attainment in the present.

original: khar nyin phan chad du snyoms par zhugs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de bu la sogs pa'i zur gyis smra ba ni nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khar nyin phan chad du snyoms par zhugs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de bu la sogs pa'i zur gyis smra ba ni nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is slight.

original: gang gi phyir bdag deng bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa ma yin no zhes smras pa na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag deng bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa ma yin no zhes smras pa na /
translated: When one says, I have not entered meditative equipoise today,

original: gzhan 'di snyam du 'di ni nges par bsam gtan thob pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan 'di snyam du 'di ni nges par bsam gtan thob pa yin te /
translated: another thinks, This one has certainly attained meditative equipoise.

original: de nyid las su bya ba gzhan dag nye bar lhags pas snyoms par ma zhugs pa yin no zhes snga ma bzhin du bsam pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las su bya ba gzhan dag nye bar lhags pas snyoms par ma zhugs pa yin no zhes snga ma bzhin du bsam pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because of the arrival of other duties, he has not entered meditative equipoise.

original: phyi ma yang dag pa ni /
analyzed: phyi ma yang dag pa ni /
translated: The latter is correct.

original: 'dod chags bral ba'i khyim 'di gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral ba'i khyim 'di gang yin pa //
translated: The statement This house is free from desire, and so on,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
translated: teaches this.

original: rab tu byung ba'i khyim de gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yin no zhes bsgrubs nas phyis 'di skad du bdag gi de yin zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i khyim de gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yin no zhes bsgrubs nas phyis 'di skad du bdag gi de yin zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Having established that the house of one who has gone forth is free from desire, later it is said, That is mine.

original: nyid ni gzhan gyi ma yin zhes nges par gzung ba'o //🔽de zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i khyim 'dren par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: nyid ni gzhan gyi ma yin zhes nges par gzung ba'o // de zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i khyim 'dren par byed pa yin te /
translated: “It” refers to the one who is being instructed, and “he” refers to the one who is instructing.

original: gong du 'di zhes mngon sum du byas pa kho na las lkog tu gyur pa'i dbang du byas nas de zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gong du 'di zhes mngon sum du byas pa kho na las lkog tu gyur pa'i dbang du byas nas de zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word “he” refers to the one who was just mentioned, but in a covert way, as opposed to the direct way in which “he” was used above.

original: de skad du zur gyis smras par gyur pa'i 'og tu 'dod chags bdag ma bral zhes smras te /
analyzed: de skad du zur gyis smras par gyur pa'i 'og tu 'dod chags bdag ma bral zhes smras te /
translated: After speaking in this covert way, he then said, “I am not free from desire.”

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral zhing dri ma med pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste de ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral zhing dri ma med pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste de ni /
translated: The one who is free from the characteristics of desire and so on, who is stainless, is the one who is free from desire.

original: bdag yin 'dod chags bdag ma bral ba'o //
analyzed: bdag yin 'dod chags bdag ma bral ba'o //
translated: He is the self, and he is not free from desire.

original: dang ni bdag kho na ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: dang ni bdag kho na ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don yin no //
translated: The word “and” is used to indicate that the self is not the only thing that is not free from desire.

original: de skad ston pa'i phyi ma yang dag pa nyid yin du zin kyang zur gyis ston pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de skad ston pa'i phyi ma yang dag pa nyid yin du zin kyang zur gyis ston pa kho na yin te /
translated: Even though this is the correct explanation, it is still a covert one.

original: 'di ltar phyi ma yang dag pa las zur gyis smra ba ma byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi ma yang dag pa las zur gyis smra ba ma byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that the latter is not indirectly stated.

original: mi smra bar gyur pa ni /🔽btsun pa ci ste dgra bcom bdag bsod snyoms //
analyzed: mi smra bar gyur pa ni / btsun pa ci ste dgra bcom bdag bsod snyoms //
translated: The one who becomes silent

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
translated: The one who becomes silent is shown by the passage beginning with “Venerable, why don’t you accept my alms?”🔽If you are an arhat, then accept my alms.🔽When he said this, he became silent.🔽By his silence he agreed, and if he accepted the alms,

original: gal te khyod dgra bcom par gyur pa yin pa de'i tshe bdag gi bsod snyoms bzhes shig ces smras pa na cang mi sma bar gyur pas de kho na bzhin du khas blangs nas gal te bsod snyoms len par byed pa dang / de bzhin du 'di nyon mongs pa'i zag pa zad pa'i phyir zag pa zad pa ste /🔽zag pa zad par gyur tam @228a * //
analyzed: gal te khyod dgra bcom par gyur pa yin pa de'i tshe bdag gi bsod snyoms bzhes shig ces smras pa na cang mi sma bar gyur pas de kho na bzhin du khas blangs nas gal te bsod snyoms len par byed pa dang / de bzhin du 'di nyon mongs pa'i zag pa zad pa'i phyir zag pa zad pa ste / zag pa zad par gyur tam @228a * //
translated: and similarly, because he has exhausted the defilements of the afflictions, he is one who has exhausted the defilements.🔽When asked by another, “Have you exhausted the defilements?”

original: zhes gzhan gyis dris par gyur pa na de kho na bzhin du cang gi smra ba'i rnam pas te mi smra bar gyur pas gang gi tshe khas blangs par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: zhes gzhan gyis dris par gyur pa na de kho na bzhin du cang gi smra ba'i rnam pas te mi smra bar gyur pas gang gi tshe khas blangs par gyur pa na'o //
translated: he becomes silent, that is, he does not speak, and by his silence he agrees.

original: dang ni 'dir thams cad du nyes byas chung bar 'gyur ro zhes sdud par byed pa yin no 'di la yang snga ma bzhin du bsam pa las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang ni 'dir thams cad du nyes byas chung bar 'gyur ro zhes sdud par byed pa yin no 'di la yang snga ma bzhin du bsam pa las 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, the verse:

original: da ni / de dag bla mar brjod pa'i blos brdzun smras //
analyzed: da ni / de dag bla mar brjod pa'i blos brdzun smras //
translated: They lie with the intention of expressing respect.

original: zhes bya bas sngar bshad pa'i mjug sdud pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas sngar bshad pa'i mjug sdud pa yin te /
translated: This verse summarizes what was explained above.

original: bla mar brjod cing smra ba de'i blo dang sems pa dag ni bla mar brjod pa'i blos so //
analyzed: bla mar brjod cing smra ba de'i blo dang sems pa dag ni bla mar brjod pa'i blos so //
translated: The intention and thought of those who speak with respect are the intention of expressing respect.

original: de dag gi sgra ni de ltar gyi don yin pa de bas na de ltar bla mar brjod pa'i blos brdzun du smra ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sgra ni de ltar gyi don yin pa de bas na de ltar bla mar brjod pa'i blos brdzun du smra ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The word “they” has the meaning of “in that way.” Therefore, it should be understood that they lie with the intention of expressing respect.

original: de dag ni nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin te /
translated: This is an illustration.

original: mi'i chos bla mar gyur par bstan pa rnam pa gzhan thams cad la yang mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du nyes par 'gyur bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'i chos bla mar gyur par bstan pa rnam pa gzhan thams cad la yang mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du nyes par 'gyur bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of this should be understood as follows: “All other forms of teaching that are superior to human teachings are offenses according to their characteristics.”

original: da ni / gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba da nyon cig / ces bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
analyzed: da ni / gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba da nyon cig / ces bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
translated: Now, listen to the other kinds of lying!

original: da ni da ltar te mi'i chos bla mar gyur pa'i brdzun du smra ba las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba brjod par bya yis nyon cig ces bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: da ni da ltar te mi'i chos bla mar gyur pa'i brdzun du smra ba las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba brjod par bya yis nyon cig ces bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: Now means at present. Listen to the other kinds of lying, which are superior to human qualities. Listen means the remainder of the sentence.

original: ni'i sgra ni snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
translated: The word now is for the purpose of distinguishing from the former.

original: 'du shes gzhan pa'i tshig ni gang yin pas //
analyzed: 'du shes gzhan pa'i tshig ni gang yin pas //
translated: The words of another perception are

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas brdzun du smra ba gzhan 'chad par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas brdzun du smra ba gzhan 'chad par byed pa yin te /
translated: The other kinds of lying are explained by the words of another perception.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'du shes gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'du shes gzhan pa ste /
translated: Those who do not have the perception of the meaning as it is have another perception.

original: gzhan pa'i tshig gang dag yin pa de kho na la brdzun du 'gyur gyi cig shos las ni ma yin no zhes nyid ni nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i tshig gang dag yin pa de kho na la brdzun du 'gyur gyi cig shos las ni ma yin no zhes nyid ni nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The words of another are just lying, not the other. This is for the purpose of ascertaining the meaning.

original: de gang la yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang la yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sgra don shes pa zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: sgra don shes pa zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: The expression “knowledge of the meaning of the word” is used.

original: sgra'i don ni sgra don te sgra'i tshig gi don gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa ni sgra don shes pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i don ni sgra don te sgra'i tshig gi don gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa ni sgra don shes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the word is the meaning of the word; the knowledge of that is the knowledge of the meaning of the word.

original: 'dis gnyid log pa dang smyos pa dang / skad mi shes pa dag bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis gnyid log pa dang smyos pa dang / skad mi shes pa dag bsal ba yin no //
translated: This excludes the case of one who is asleep or insane or who does not know the language.

original: de la sgra'i don rnam par shes pa yul du gyur pa la tshig de brdzun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sgra'i don rnam par shes pa yul du gyur pa la tshig de brdzun du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the knowledge of the meaning of the word is the object, then the statement is false.

original: ci thams cad la 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci thams cad la 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Does this apply to all cases?

original: mi zhes smos te mi'i ni mi'i rigs dag la bya'i mi ma yin pa'i rigs dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi zhes smos te mi'i ni mi'i rigs dag la bya'i mi ma yin pa'i rigs dag ni ma yin te /
translated: The word “human” is used. It applies to humans, to those of the human species, not to those of other species,

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi khongs su ma 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi khongs su ma 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not included in the conventions of the world.

original: de ltar yang ming rtogs pa'i tha snyad nyid la zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ming rtogs pa'i tha snyad nyid la zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that “the convention of the understanding of the name is itself the basis.”

original: tshig 'di'i don gsal te /
analyzed: tshig 'di'i don gsal te /
translated: The meaning of this statement is clear.

original: bla mar brjod pa'i blos zhes bya ba 'di nyid @228b kyis dngos gzhi'i yan lag dang bral ba ni nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang / gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba dag rab tu grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bla mar brjod pa'i blos zhes bya ba 'di nyid @228b kyis dngos gzhi'i yan lag dang bral ba ni nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang / gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba dag rab tu grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “with the thought that expresses homage” indicates that the root transgression is not committed if the homage is not done in the presence of the guru, or if the homage is done with a thought other than the thought of homage.

original: ci'i tshig kho na brdzun yin nam 'on te gzhan gyis kyang yin zhe na /🔽smras pa / de la 'jig rten pa'i tshul ni 'di yin te tshig brdzun pa yin pa de lta na yang gal te yang 'di ltar tshig gis brjod par bya ba'i don ji lta bu lus kyis kyang go bar byed na lus kyis kyang yin te ngag 'ba' zhig gis ni
analyzed: ci'i tshig kho na brdzun yin nam 'on te gzhan gyis kyang yin zhe na / smras pa / de la 'jig rten pa'i tshul ni 'di yin te tshig brdzun pa yin pa de lta na yang gal te yang 'di ltar tshig gis brjod par bya ba'i don ji lta bu lus kyis kyang go bar byed na lus kyis kyang yin te ngag 'ba' zhig gis ni
translated: Is lying the only offense, or are there other offenses?

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The worldly way is this: even though the words are lies, if the meaning of the words is understood by the body, then the offense is not just verbal, but also physical.

original: de'i tshe nyes byas kho na nyes pa chung ba ma yin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyes byas kho na nyes pa chung ba ma yin pa ma yin la /
translated: At that time, the offense is not just a minor offense,

original: 'on kyang nyes byas kyi nyes pa chung ba yin te yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyes byas kyi nyes pa chung ba yin te yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but it is a minor offense of wrongdoing.

original: ci'i phyir yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin /
translated: Why is it incomplete?

original: gang las te gang gi phyir tshig tu brjod pa'i shugs las bya ba'i tha snyad 'di la med pa de'i phyir chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang las te gang gi phyir tshig tu brjod pa'i shugs las bya ba'i tha snyad 'di la med pa de'i phyir chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the expression of action is not present in the expression of words, it is small.

original: 'dul ba las tha snyad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba las tha snyad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa ni gsum ste /
translated: In the Vinaya, the basis of the expression is said to be threefold:

original: 'di mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “seen, heard, suspected.”

original: rang gis rtogs pa de ni mthong ba yin //
analyzed: rang gis rtogs pa de ni mthong ba yin //
translated: That which is understood by oneself is seen.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas de dag gi rang bzhin 'chad par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas de dag gi rang bzhin 'chad par byed pa yin te /
translated: This explains the nature of those terms.

original: gang kho na rang gi mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pas rtogs shing yang dag par yid ches par gyur pa de kho na la mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang kho na rang gi mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pas rtogs shing yang dag par yid ches par gyur pa de kho na la mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is understood by one’s own direct perception or inference and is fully trusted is called seen.

original: rab tu byung ba 'am khyim pa yid ches pa mi slu bar byed pa gang kho na las thos pa thos pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba 'am khyim pa yid ches pa mi slu bar byed pa gang kho na las thos pa thos pa yin no //
translated: That which is heard from a trustworthy person, whether a renunciate or a householder, is called heard.

original: kho na ni ngas par gzung ba dang rim pa gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: kho na ni ngas par gzung ba dang rim pa gzhan gyi don to //
translated: The word “only” excludes what is understood by oneself.

original: gcig tu nges pa'i rtags go bar byed pa gzung ba ni mtshan ma nges par gzung ba yin la /
analyzed: gcig tu nges pa'i rtags go bar byed pa gzung ba ni mtshan ma nges par gzung ba yin la /
translated: The apprehension of a sign that is ascertained is the apprehension of a sign that is ascertained.

original: de las gzhan pa ni mtshan ma nges par ma bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni mtshan ma nges par ma bzung ba yin no //
translated: The apprehension of a sign that is not ascertained is the apprehension of a sign that is not ascertained.

original: de la dogs pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: de la dogs pa zhes bya'o//
translated: This is called doubt.

original: gang du mtshan ma nges par ma bzung ba ni dper na thibs po la sogs pa las bud med kyi yul byung ba dang / de nyid de kho na las rab tu byung ba yang byung ba de dag mthong ba las ci 'dir 'di gnyis kyis byas par gyur to zhes dogs par 'gyur gyi nges pa ni med de tha snyad du bya ba ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir mtshan ma nges🔽par ma bzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du mtshan ma nges par ma bzung ba ni dper na thibs po la sogs pa las bud med kyi yul byung ba dang / de nyid de kho na las rab tu byung ba yang byung ba de dag mthong ba las ci 'dir 'di gnyis kyis byas par gyur to zhes dogs par 'gyur gyi nges pa ni med de tha snyad du bya ba ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir mtshan ma nges🔽par ma bzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: When a sign is not ascertained, for example, when a woman appears from a thicket, and when she appears again right there, one doubts, “Were these two created by someone?” There is no ascertainment, because one does not see the conventional activity, because the sign is not ascertained.

original: de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i tha snyad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa gsum po 'di dag gis smras nas gzhan gyis go bar gyur pa la nyes pa med de 'di la nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de la yang mthong ba la mthong ba dang / thos pa la thos pa dang / dogs @229a * //
analyzed: de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i tha snyad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa gsum po 'di dag gis smras nas gzhan gyis go bar gyur pa la nyes pa med de 'di la nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de la yang mthong ba la mthong ba dang / thos pa la thos pa dang / dogs @229a * //
translated: There is no fault in speaking with these three roots of conventionality just explained, for the purpose of being understood by others. This is the meaning of “there is no fault in this.”

original: pa la dogs so zhes smra bar bya'i gzhan du na nyes par 'gyur ro zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: pa la dogs so zhes smra bar bya'i gzhan du na nyes par 'gyur ro zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: And in that case, one should say “seen” for what is seen, “heard” for what is heard, and “suspected” for what is suspected. Otherwise, there would be a fault. This should be understood.

original: pha rol pos dris pa la lan ji ltar sbyin par bya zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol pos dris pa la lan ji ltar sbyin par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one answer questions from others?

original: gzhan gyis gang dris de nyid brjod par bya //🔽zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gang dris de nyid brjod par bya // zhes pa smos te /
translated: One should say just what was asked.

original: gzhan gyis gang kho na dris par gyur pa de kho na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gang kho na dris par gyur pa de kho na brjod par bya ste /
translated: One should say just what was asked by another.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should say what is consistent with that. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan la gnod bya'i phyir ni gzhan du min //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod bya'i phyir ni gzhan du min //
translated: Not for the purpose of harming others, but for the purpose of benefiting others.

original: zhes bya ba la gzhan gyis dris pa yang gzhan du lung ston par byed na thams cad du nyes byas gyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gzhan gyis dris pa yang gzhan du lung ston par byed na thams cad du nyes byas gyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one answers a question asked by another in a different way, then one incurs the offense of wrong speech in all cases.

original: nyid ni nges par gzung ba dang rim pa gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: nyid ni nges par gzung ba dang rim pa gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: The word “only” is for the purpose of restriction and for the purpose of another arrangement.

original: 'di'i dmigs kyis bsal ba ni //🔽gsad bya bros na ji ltar gshed ma yis //
analyzed: 'di'i dmigs kyis bsal ba ni // gsad bya bros na ji ltar gshed ma yis //
translated: The exception to this is stated:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “If the one to be killed escapes, how is there a killer?”

original: gsad par bya ba ni rkun po'am gzhan 'ga' zhig rgyal pos gzung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gsad par bya ba ni rkun po'am gzhan 'ga' zhig rgyal pos gzung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The one to be killed is a thief or someone else who has been seized by the king.

original: de bros par gyur pa la gal te gshed ma des 'phags pas 'ga' zhig bros par gyur pa ma gzigs sam zhes dris pa na /
analyzed: de bros par gyur pa la gal te gshed ma des 'phags pas 'ga' zhig bros par gyur pa ma gzigs sam zhes dris pa na /
translated: If the one to be killed escapes and the killer is asked, “Noble one, did you not see that someone escaped?”

original: 'dri ba de la ci 'di rjes su gzung ba'i blos tshol bar byed dam /
analyzed: 'dri ba de la ci 'di rjes su gzung ba'i blos tshol bar byed dam /
translated: In answering that question, is the killer seeking to deceive?

original: 'on te gsad pa'i blos zhes brtags nas gang gi tshe rjes su gzung ba'i blos zhes shes par gyur pa de'i tshe smras pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gsad pa'i blos zhes brtags nas gang gi tshe rjes su gzung ba'i blos zhes shes par gyur pa de'i tshe smras pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if, having examined, you know that it is with the intention of killing, then there is no fault in what you have said.

original: 'on te gsad pa'i bsam pas yin no de'i lan de'i tshe de la ji skad brjod ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gsad pa'i bsam pas yin no de'i lan de'i tshe de la ji skad brjod ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa yin te /
translated: But if it is with the intention of killing, then at that time what would you say to him?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus su 'di skad brjod ces bya ba ni 'di nyid brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'di skad ces bya ba ni bshad par bya ba'i rnam pa la ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus su 'di skad brjod ces bya ba ni 'di nyid brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to // 'di skad ces bya ba ni bshad par bya ba'i rnam pa la ltos pa yin la /
translated: At that time, at that occasion, this is what you should say.🔽This is what you should say is the meaning.🔽This is what is to be explained is the meaning.

original: nyid ni don ji lta ba bzhin du lan brjod pa rnam par dpyod pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyid ni don ji lta ba bzhin du lan brjod pa rnam par dpyod pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the word eva.

original: tu s'a ma ni gong ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: tu s'a ma ni gong ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
translated: The word eva is used to distinguish the meaning from the previous one.

original: tshur shog nam mkha' 'am ni sen mo mthong //
analyzed: tshur shog nam mkha' 'am ni sen mo mthong //
translated: Come here, look at the sky or at your fingernail.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsad par bya ba mthong ba'i dris pa'i lan brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsad par bya ba mthong ba'i dris pa'i lan brjod par bya'o //
translated: The answer to the question Do you see the one to be killed? is to be given by saying I see him.

original: tshur shog 'dug la ngal so shig ces byas pa dang / des brgya la kho mi 'dug gi dris pa mthong ngam zhes smra na de'i tshe nam mkha' la bltas nas nam mkha' mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshur shog 'dug la ngal so shig ces byas pa dang / des brgya la kho mi 'dug gi dris pa mthong ngam zhes smra na de'i tshe nam mkha' la bltas nas nam mkha' mthong ngo //
translated: When the other says, Come here and rest, if the one to be killed says, I will not come. Do you see the question? then, looking up into the sky, he should say, I see the sky.

original: sen mo la bltas nas sen mo mthong ngo zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: sen mo la bltas nas sen mo mthong ngo zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Looking at his fingernail, he should say, I see my fingernail.

original: gzhan 'di snyam du bdag gir ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'dis brjod pa yin no zhes sems par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan 'di snyam du bdag gir ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'dis brjod pa yin no zhes sems par 'gyur ro //
translated: The other will think, He does not see me.

original: gal te de tshig kun go ba yin na kho bos khyod @229b la nam mkha' mthong ba dang / sen mo mthong ba dris pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang gsad par bya ba mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de tshig kun go ba yin na kho bos khyod @229b la nam mkha' mthong ba dang / sen mo mthong ba dris pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang gsad par bya ba mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If the other understands all this, then he should be told, I did not ask you whether you see the sky or your fingernail, but whether you see the one to be killed.

original: de'i tshe brjod par bya ba /
analyzed: de'i tshe brjod par bya ba /
translated: Then the answer is to be given:

original: lus can rnams gyis de nyid ma mthong ngo //🔽zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: lus can rnams gyis de nyid ma mthong ngo //🔽zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The one to be killed is not seen by embodied beings.

original: lus yod pa'i phyir na lus can te lus can rnams kyis de nyid bdag la bsams nas khyod kyi mi mthong ngo zhes byas pa na gzhan 'di la yang gsad par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas 'dis de skad du brjod pa yin no snyam du sems par
analyzed: lus yod pa'i phyir na lus can te lus can rnams kyis de nyid bdag la bsams nas khyod kyi mi mthong ngo zhes byas pa na gzhan 'di la yang gsad par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas 'dis de skad du brjod pa yin no snyam du sems par
translated: Since the body exists, it is embodied.  When embodied beings think of the self, they say, “I do not see it.”  When they are told, “It is not seen by anyone else,” they think, “He is speaking in terms of the object of killing.”

original: 'gyur ro // de la sogs pa'i thabs ni de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pas gzhan dang gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas smras na nyes pa yod pa ma yin par sngar bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de la sogs pa'i thabs ni de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pas gzhan dang gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas smras na nyes pa yod pa ma yin par sngar bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no fault in speaking in this way by following the views of others.

original: don ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: don ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gtses pa rnams ni yongs su bsrung phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gtses pa rnams ni yongs su bsrung phyir ro // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is for the sake of protecting those who are being harmed.

original: gtses pa'i sems can rnams yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir yin gyi gzhan la gnod pa'i bsam pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: zhes bya bas mjug sdud par byed pa yin te / brdzun du smra ba'i rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba ste rnam pa du ma gang yin pa de ni smras pa yin no // 'dis ni 'di skad du /
translated: This concludes the analysis of the types of lying.🔽The many types of lying have been explained.

original: dngos gzhi'i nyes pa dang / nyes byas kyi nyes pa'i dbye ba rnam pa du mar rab tu bstan to zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i nyes pa dang / nyes byas kyi nyes pa'i dbye ba rnam pa du mar rab tu bstan to zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This passage explains that the many types of lying are distinguished in terms of the basis, the attitude, and the act itself.

original: de ma thag tu da ni da ltar ro //🔽brdzun du smra ba ni brdzun du smras pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu da ni da ltar ro // brdzun du smra ba ni brdzun du smras pa'o //
translated: The present is the present time.🔽Lying is the act of lying.🔽The act of lying is the act of speaking that is included in the category of lying.🔽The act of lying is the act of speaking that is included in the category of lying.

translated: The act of lying is the act of speaking that is included in the category of lying.🔽The word “also” indicates that the act of lying is also included in the category of lying.

analyzed: de yang bya ba'i tshul dang bya ba ma yin pa'i tshul lo //

original: de la bya ba'i tshul la mi byed pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa'i tshul la byed pa dag ni thams cad du yid kyir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bya ba'i tshul la mi byed pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa'i tshul la byed pa dag ni thams cad du yid kyir 'gyur ro //
translated: The mode of action is not acting and acting in the mode of non-action, and all of these are mental.

original: de da dris na chos bzhin du ni slar smros shig ces bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de da dris na chos bzhin du ni slar smros shig ces bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: If you are asked about this, then you should respond in accordance with the Dharma.

original: dngos po cung zhig 'ga' zhig gis dris par gyur pa na slar smra bar byed pa dang / lan gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dngos po cung zhig 'ga' zhig gis dris par gyur pa na slar smra bar byed pa dang / lan gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: When someone asks about some matter, you should respond and give an answer.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /🔽chos bzhin du zhes smos te /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na / chos bzhin du zhes smos te /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: chos bzhin ni /
analyzed: chos bzhin ni /
translated: It is said, in accordance with the Dharma.🔽 What is in accordance with the Dharma?

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: It is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: 'on kyang mi smra bar 'dug pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi smra bar 'dug pas ni ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not by remaining silent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gtso ba'i phyir ni zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //🔽gtso ba'i phyir 'gal ba'i lan gyi tshig ni gzhan @230a * //
analyzed: gtso ba'i phyir ni zhes bya ba smos pa yin no // gtso ba'i phyir 'gal ba'i lan gyi tshig ni gzhan @230a * //
translated: It is said, because it is primary.

original: gyis gang dris zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bkag pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gyis gang dris zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bkag pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because it is primary, the response that is contradictory to the question is refuted by the statement, What is asked by another... and so on.

original: 'dir ni gtse ba'i phyir cang mi smra bar gyur ba dgag pa'i phyir smra ba zhes bye brag tu byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni gtse ba'i phyir cang mi smra bar gyur ba dgag pa'i phyir smra ba zhes bye brag tu byas pa yin no //
translated: Here, in order to refute the silence that is a form of harm, the author specifies the silence that is a form of discipline.

original: dang ni 'gal ba'i tshig 'ba' zhig mi smra ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang mi smra ba kho nas kyang 'dul bar mi bya'o zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ni 'gal ba'i tshig 'ba' zhig mi smra ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang mi smra ba kho nas kyang 'dul bar mi bya'o zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “and” indicates that the bodhisattva is not only silent about what is contradictory, but also that he or she does not discipline others by remaining silent.

original: de bzhin du mkhan po dang slob dpon dang rgyal po'i bka' mnyan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mkhan po dang slob dpon dang rgyal po'i bka' mnyan par bya ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva listens to the words of a preceptor, an instructor, and a king.

analyzed: ci de lta bus sam 'on te tshig de dag 'dul ba dang ldan pa yin nam 'on te ma yin zhes dpyad par bya //
translated: But one should investigate whether the bodhisattva should do this or not, whether these words are in accord with the code of discipline or not.

original: de ji ltar bya zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de ji ltar bya zhe na smras pa /

original: rigs pa yin na mnyan te 'dul ba dang rjes su mthun pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs pa yin na mnyan te 'dul ba dang rjes su mthun pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If they are reasonable, then one should listen, because they are in accord with the code of discipline.

original: gal te dpyad pa na 'dul ba dang rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa dang 'dul ba dang 'gal bar gyur pa de'i tshe brda sprad pa ste /

original: lan gyi tshig mi rigs pa dang rung ba ma yin no zhes rab tu sbyin par bya'i cang mi smra ba'i bya ba dang / yan 'gal ba'i tshig gi lan gdab par mi bya'o //

analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bskos pa'i dge skos kyang yin te /

translated: Vow is a promise, such as “If it is so, then it is mine.”

original: dper na gal te 'di ltar gyur na bdag gi yin gyi de ston cig ces bya ba lta bu'o //🔽mna' ni mna' 'dor bar byed pa'o //🔽che ge mo'i zhabs la reg gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gal te 'di ltar gyur na bdag gi yin gyi de ston cig ces bya ba lta bu'o // mna' ni mna' 'dor bar byed pa'o // che ge mo'i zhabs la reg gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “If it is so, then let it be mine, but show it to me.”

original: mi smra ba ni smra ba las thams cad du ldog pa'am yi dam du byas pa'i tshul yin no //
analyzed: mi smra ba ni smra ba las thams cad du ldog pa'am yi dam du byas pa'i tshul yin no //
translated: Silence is the complete cessation of speech or the manner of a vow.🔽For example, “I touch the feet of so-and-so.”

original: mi smra ba dang bcas pas 'jug pa ni man 'dor mi smra bcas pa ste /
analyzed: mi smra ba dang bcas pas 'jug pa ni man 'dor mi smra bcas pa ste /
translated: The ascetic who is silent is one who is always silent.

original: de dag thams cad ma gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ma gnang ba yin no //
translated: All of these are prohibited.

original: gang gi phyir rab tu byung ba la da dag tshul ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rab tu byung ba la da dag tshul ma yin te /
translated: Because these are not proper for the renunciate.

original: gang rgyal gzugs pa ni khyim pa'i chos kyi dbang du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: gang rgyal gzugs pa ni khyim pa'i chos kyi dbang du byas pa yin la /
translated: The king's punishment is from the perspective of the householder's Dharma.

original: rab tu byung ba yin pa de bas na man 'dor pa tshul dang mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba yin pa de bas na man 'dor pa tshul dang mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: Since the renunciate is not like that, the ascetic is not proper.

original: sdom can dag brdzun smra ba ni man 'dor ba'i sgo nas bdag nyid bden par smra bar sgrub par byed do /
analyzed: sdom can dag brdzun smra ba ni man 'dor ba'i sgo nas bdag nyid bden par smra bar sgrub par byed do /
translated: Those who have vows who lie establish themselves as truthful through asceticism.

original: mi smra ba ni mu stegs kyi rgyal mtshan yin pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi smra ba ni mu stegs kyi rgyal mtshan yin pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Because silence is a tirthika banner, it is to be abandoned.

original: lam du zhugs pa ni ji ltar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: lam du zhugs pa ni ji ltar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: What should one do when on the road?🔽The ascetic should be silent.

original: mi smra ba'i dngos po ni mi smra ba @231a * //🔽nyid du bya'i /
analyzed: mi smra ba'i dngos po ni mi smra ba @231a * // nyid du bya'i /
translated: One should not speak

original: bud med la sogs gtam ngan mi bya ste //
analyzed: bud med la sogs gtam ngan mi bya ste //
translated: or engage in bad conversation with women and so on.

original: bud med kyi yul gyi gtam ma ma zas la sogs pa'i gtam ni 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pas mi bya zhing /
analyzed: bud med kyi yul gyi gtam ma ma zas la sogs pa'i gtam ni 'dod chags kyi rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pas mi bya zhing /
translated: One should not speak of women, countries, food, etc. because such talk is conducive to attachment.

original: skyo ba dang rjes su mthun pa yang bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir gtam ngan gyi tshig byas pa yin no //
analyzed: skyo ba dang rjes su mthun pa yang bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir gtam ngan gyi tshig byas pa yin no //
translated: One should not speak of what is conducive to discouragement. Therefore, one should not speak of unpleasant things.

original: sogs pa'i sgra ni de lta bu'i rigs can thams cad yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra ni de lta bu'i rigs can thams cad yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “etc.” includes all that is of that type.

original: yang gi sgra ni tshig gi kha bskang ba'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni tshig gi kha bskang ba'o //
translated: The word “also” is a filler.

original: gang lam la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu ngal ba so ba der /
analyzed: gang lam la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu ngal ba so ba der /
translated: When one is tired from walking, etc.,

original: gus pa ste mos pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi tshigs su bcad pa bklag par bya'o ;
analyzed: gus pa ste mos pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi tshigs su bcad pa bklag par bya'o ;
translated: one should read verses of the Bhagavat Buddha with devotion.

original: / rgyud gsum tshogs par gyur pa ni rgyud gsum pa ste /
analyzed: / rgyud gsum tshogs par gyur pa ni rgyud gsum pa ste /
translated: One who has the three continuums is a “tri-continuum-er.”

original: de las spyan drang ba dang gshegs su gsol ba dang / bar du mdo 'don pa ni rgyud gsum pa med na des lung gi tshigs su bcad pa bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: de las spyan drang ba dang gshegs su gsol ba dang / bar du mdo 'don pa ni rgyud gsum pa med na des lung gi tshigs su bcad pa bklag par bya'o //
translated: If there is no tri-continuum-er, one should read the verses of the scriptures.

original: gtsug lag khang du gnas par gyur na gtsug lag khang gi bdag po dang lha nyid kyi ched du tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bklag par bya ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du gnas par gyur na gtsug lag khang gi bdag po dang lha nyid kyi ched du tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bklag par bya ste /
translated: If he enters a temple, he should recite two verses for the sake of the owner of the temple and for the sake of the deity.

original: 'di dag thams cad de'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad de'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: All of this should be understood as it is expounded in the scriptures.

original: 'on te lha gzhan gyi rten mthong bar gyur pa de'i tshe ji ltar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lha gzhan gyi rten mthong bar gyur pa de'i tshe ji ltar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: But if he sees a shrine of another deity, what should he do?

original: se gol brdabs te der yang tshigs bcad klag / ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: se gol brdabs te der yang tshigs bcad klag / ces bya ba smos te /
translated: He should snap his fingers and recite a verse there.

original: de la lha stegs su zhugs pa na se gol brda byas nas btsam par bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: de la lha stegs su zhugs pa na se gol brda byas nas btsam par bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bklag par bya'o //
translated: When he enters the temple of another deity, he should snap his fingers and recite the verse, “I praise the chief of gods, the one who removes fear.

original: dang ni thams cad du mtshungs par sdud par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: dang ni thams cad du mtshungs par sdud par byed pa yin la /
translated: ” The word “or” is used to include all cases.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni tshig nye bar dgod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni tshig nye bar dgod pa yin no //
translated: Or, the word “or” is used to introduce an alternative.

original: de la mdza' bo 'byed par byed pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la mdza' bo 'byed par byed pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: He should avoid creating divisions among friends.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du phra ma mi bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du phra ma mi bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This teaches that one should not engage in slander.

original: de bzhin du tshig rtsub mo spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshig rtsub mo spang bar bya ste /
translated: Likewise, one should avoid harsh speech.

original: tshig rtsub mo ni phan pa ma yin pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: tshig rtsub mo ni phan pa ma yin pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: Harsh speech is speech that is not beneficial.

original: de bzhin du skyon nas brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skyon nas brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Likewise, one should not speak of the faults of others,

original: dper na khyod ni dmangs rigs las rab tu byung ba yin no zhes bya ba lta bu de dag ni spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na khyod ni dmangs rigs las rab tu byung ba yin no zhes bya ba lta bu de dag ni spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: for example, saying, “You are an outcaste who has gone forth.” These are the things to be abandoned.

original: dang ni spang bar bya ba'i sgra re re la sbyar bar bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang ni spang bar bya ba'i sgra re re la sbyar bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “and” in the root text is for the purpose of connecting each of the words “to be abandoned.”

original: 'dul ba las phra ma la sogs pa byas pas dge tshul dag la nyes byas su 'gyur bar gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dul ba las phra ma la sogs pa byas pas dge tshul dag la nyes byas su 'gyur bar gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it said in the Vinaya that when schism and so on are committed by novices, they are faults?

original: de ji ltar na yid kyir 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / dbye ba'i 'dul ba las gsungs nyes byas gang //
analyzed: de ji ltar na yid kyir 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir / dbye ba'i 'dul ba las gsungs nyes byas gang //
translated: How can they be mental actions?🔽Therefore, the root text says,

original: zhes bya ba la @231b sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la @231b sogs pa smos te /
translated: “The Vinaya says that schism and so on are faults.”

original: 'dul ba las nyes pa'i dbye ba gang gsungs pa gang yin pa 'dir nyes byas kyi dbye bar byas pa de ni yid kyi nyes byas kyi dbang du byas nas nyes byas kyi nyes pa bstan pa yin gyi bshags par bya ba dag ni ma yin no zhes
analyzed: 'dul ba las nyes pa'i dbye ba gang gsungs pa gang yin pa 'dir nyes byas kyi dbye bar byas pa de ni yid kyi nyes byas kyi dbang du byas nas nyes byas kyi nyes pa bstan pa yin gyi bshags par bya ba dag ni ma yin no zhes
translated: Whatever is stated in the Vinaya as a classification of faults is here classified as a misdeed. That is taught as a fault of a misdeed from the perspective of a mental misdeed, but they are not to be confessed.

original: bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan nyid ni ma yin te nyes byas ni smad par bya ba yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan nyid ni ma yin te nyes byas ni smad par bya ba yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not another, because a misdeed is to be deprecated.

original: dge tshul gyi tshig le'ur byas pa las brdzun du smra ba las slar ldog pa ste bslab pa'i gzhi bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: dge tshul gyi tshig le'ur byas pa las brdzun du smra ba las slar ldog pa ste bslab pa'i gzhi bzhi pa'o /
translated: In the Verses of the Novice Monk, lying is the fourth basis of training.

original: // /'bras bu la sogs pa khu ba mnan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bslab pa'i gzhi lnga pa 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: // /'bras bu la sogs pa khu ba mnan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bslab pa'i gzhi lnga pa 'chad par byed de /
translated: The fifth basis of training is explained by the words “pressing juice of fruit and so on.”

original: de la dang por myos par 'gyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang por myos par 'gyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo bstan par bya ste /
translated: First, the nature of intoxicating substances should be explained.

original: dgag pa'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the object of prohibition.

original: de la myos par byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la myos par byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Intoxicants are of two kinds:

original: 'bras bu'i chang dang / 'bru'i chang ngo //🔽de la 'bras bu'i chang bshad par bya ste //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chang dang / 'bru'i chang ngo // de la 'bras bu'i chang bshad par bya ste //
translated: alcoholic drinks and grain alcohol.🔽Alcoholic drinks are explained first.

original: 'bras bu dang por byas pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang por byas pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: Alcoholic drinks are the juice of fruits, etc.,🔽that have been pressed, fermented, and distilled.

original: de btsir ba'i khu ba mnan zhing yongs su sbyar ba ni 'bras bu'i chang yin no zhes myos byed shes pa dag smra'o //
analyzed: de btsir ba'i khu ba mnan zhing yongs su sbyar ba ni 'bras bu'i chang yin no zhes myos byed shes pa dag smra'o //
translated: The wise know that these are intoxicating drinks.

original: de'i dbye ba dag ston pa la /🔽rgun chang bu ram gyi chad zhes bya ba ni rgun chang dang bu ram gyi chang dang de dang 'dra ba ni rgun chang bu ram chang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de'i dbye ba dag ston pa la / rgun chang bu ram gyi chad zhes bya ba ni rgun chang dang bu ram gyi chang dang de dang 'dra ba ni rgun chang bu ram chang 'dra ste /
translated: The different kinds of alcoholic drinks are now taught:🔽wine, distilled liquor, and their like.🔽Wine is the distillation of grapes, etc. Distilled liquor is the distillation of molasses. Their like is like wine and like distilled liquor.

original: rgyun chang dang bu ram chang du byas pa ni chang yin la bu ram shing gi chang du byas pa yang ngo //
analyzed: rgyun chang dang bu ram chang du byas pa ni chang yin la bu ram shing gi chang du byas pa yang ngo //
translated: Wine and distilled liquor are made from the distillation of grapes and molasses.

original: de dang 'dra ba ni na li ke ra la sogs pa dang / me tog gi chang dag yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni na li ke ra la sogs pa dang / me tog gi chang dag yin no //
translated: Their like is the distillation of sugar cane, etc., and flower alcohol.

original: de'i sgra ni phyis par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sgra ni phyis par rig par bya'o //
translated: The term “and so on” should be understood to be applied here as well.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i bcos pa'i chang bstan nas 'bru'i chang gi rang gi ngo bo 'bru btags mnan las gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i bcos pa'i chang bstan nas 'bru'i chang gi rang gi ngo bo 'bru btags mnan las gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Having thus described the nature of medicated wine, the root text states, “Beer is the fermentation of grains and so on.”

original: ko tra ba la sogs pa'i 'bru btags pa dang gzhan dag kyang rung ba rtsa ba la sogs pa'i sman dang / mnan par gyur pa ni 'bru'i chang du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ko tra ba la sogs pa'i 'bru btags pa dang gzhan dag kyang rung ba rtsa ba la sogs pa'i sman dang / mnan par gyur pa ni 'bru'i chang du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term “and so on” includes the fermentation of other substances, such as molasses. The term “fermentation” means the transformation of grains and other substances, such as molasses and medicinal roots, into beer.

original: ni'i sgra ni gong ma las khyad par du bya ba dang / rim pa gzhan du'i don to //🔽rnam pa de gnyi ga yang rtsva'i mchog ma ni rtsva mchog ste /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gong ma las khyad par du bya ba dang / rim pa gzhan du'i don to // rnam pa de gnyi ga yang rtsva'i mchog ma ni rtsva mchog ste /
translated: The term “and so on” is used to indicate that beer is different from medicated wine and to introduce other types of beer.🔽The term “and so on” also includes the beer known as “supreme grass.”

original: phra mo bsnyugs pa des kyang btung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phra mo bsnyugs pa des kyang btung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “supreme grass” refers to a type of grass that is so fine that it is not even suitable to drink.

original: btung bar mi bya ba de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /🔽myos 'gyur zhes smos te /
analyzed: btung bar mi bya ba de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na / myos 'gyur zhes smos te /
translated: What is the quality of the beer that is prohibited?🔽The root text states, “that which causes intoxication.”

original: myos par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “intoxication” means a state of mental confusion.

original: rtsva mchog tsam yang zhes bya ba'i tshig ni thal ches pa spang ba'i phyir te /🔽rdzas kyi nus pa yongs @232a * //
analyzed: rtsva mchog tsam yang zhes bya ba'i tshig ni thal ches pa spang ba'i phyir te / rdzas kyi nus pa yongs @232a * //
translated: The words “not even a blade of grass” are for the purpose of excluding exaggeration.

original: su shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: su shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the potency of substances cannot be fully understood.

original: de la bcos pa'i chang dang sbyar ba'i chang myos par byed pa bag med pa'i gnas las slar ldog par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bcas pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la bcos pa'i chang dang sbyar ba'i chang myos par byed pa bag med pa'i gnas las slar ldog par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bcas pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The injunction “one should abstain from intoxicating drinks which cause heedlessness” is for the purpose of what?

original: de'i dgos pa /
analyzed: de'i dgos pa /
translated: The purpose is stated:

original: 'bru chang 'bras bu'i chang gnyis smos pa ni //
analyzed: 'bru chang 'bras bu'i chang gnyis smos pa ni //
translated: The mention of grain-alcohol and fruit-alcohol is

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par byed de /
translated: for the purpose of excluding the intoxicating drinks of kotrava, etc.🔽The mention of grain-alcohol and fruit-alcohol is for the purpose of excluding the intoxicating drinks of kotrava, etc.

original: 'bru chang 'bras bu'i chang zhes bya ba ni de lta bu gnyis bstan zhing gnyis smos pa ni dngos po bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'bru chang 'bras bu'i chang zhes bya ba ni de lta bu gnyis bstan zhing gnyis smos pa ni dngos po bstan pa'o //
translated: The mention of two, grain-alcohol and fruit-alcohol, is the teaching of two things.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ko tra ba la sogs pa dgag phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ko tra ba la sogs pa dgag phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to exclude kotrava, etc.🔽The mention of two, grain-alcohol and fruit-alcohol, is for the purpose of excluding the intoxicating drinks of kotrava, etc.

original: 'bru'i chang dang 'bras bu'i chang smos pa ni ko tra ba la sogs pa dgag pa'i phyir te myos par byed pa'i ko tra ba la sogs pa gsal ba'i phyir dang / myos par byed pa'i 'bras bu gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bru'i chang dang 'bras bu'i chang smos pa ni ko tra ba la sogs pa dgag pa'i phyir te myos par byed pa'i ko tra ba la sogs pa gsal ba'i phyir dang / myos par byed pa'i 'bras bu gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The terms “grain beer” and “fruit beer” are mentioned in order to prohibit the drinking of kottambara and so on, because it is clear that kottambara and so on intoxicate, and because it is clear that the fruit that causes intoxication is prohibited.

original: ji ste 'di skad du rtsa ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas myos par byed pa de dag kyang longs spyod par 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste 'di skad du rtsa ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas myos par byed pa de dag kyang longs spyod par 'thob pa yin no //
translated: If one says: “In that case, the drinking of those that intoxicate would not be a root downfall.”

original: 'bru'i chang dang 'bras bu'i chang smos pas ko tra ba la sogs ba gsal bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bru'i chang dang 'bras bu'i chang smos pas ko tra ba la sogs ba gsal bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: The terms “grain beer” and “fruit beer” clarify the prohibition of kottambara and so on.

original: de'i phyir ko tra ba la sogs pas myos par byed pa longs spyod pa ni de'i phyogs su gtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yid kyir 'gyur ba sus zlog par byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir ko tra ba la sogs pas myos par byed pa longs spyod pa ni de'i phyogs su gtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yid kyir 'gyur ba sus zlog par byed /
translated: Therefore, who can deny that the drinking of those that intoxicate, such as kottambara, is a mental downfall, because it belongs to that class?

original: dang gi sgra ni sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: The term “and” is a conjunction.

original: myos par 'gyur ba smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it said that they intoxicate?

original: ma red nyams phyir myos par 'gyur //
analyzed: ma red nyams phyir myos par 'gyur //
translated: Not so, because of the loss of the state of nonintoxication.

original: zhes brjod ces bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes brjod ces bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “it is said” is stated.

original: dgag pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dgag pa'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “in order to refute” is supplied.

original: myos par 'gyur zhes smos pa ni myos 'gyur zhes brjod pa ste myos par 'gyur ba'i sgra nye bar gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: myos par 'gyur zhes smos pa ni myos 'gyur zhes brjod pa ste myos par 'gyur ba'i sgra nye bar gzung ba yin no //
translated: The word “intoxication” is stated, and the word “intoxicant” is supplied.

original: ma red pa dang nyams pa ni gang myos byed kyi dngos por ma red pa dang / myos byed kyi dngos po las nyams pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ma red pa dang nyams pa ni gang myos byed kyi dngos por ma red pa dang / myos byed kyi dngos po las nyams pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The words “loss of the state of nonintoxication” refer to the loss of the state of nonintoxication and the loss of the state of being an intoxicant.🔽The phrase “in order to refute that” means in order to refute that state.

analyzed: de'i dngos po de bzlog pa'i phyir der smras pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // de dag gang longs spyod pa de'i phyir 'chad par 'gyur ro // bag med pa'i tshig smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: gal te myos 'gyur te myos par 'gyur ba de la yongs su rdzogs pa'i nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: nyid ni nyes byas kyi nyes pa kho nar 'gyur gyi tha ma ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'o //

original: myos par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /

original: 'on kyang snyigs ma za ba la yang nyes par 'gyur ro zhes ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang snyigs ma za ba la yang nyes par 'gyur ro zhes ston par byed de /

original: snyigs ma dag za ba ni snyigs ma zos pa ste /
analyzed: snyigs ma dag za ba ni snyigs ma zos pa ste /

original: snyigs ma za ba de las nyes byas kyi gnod par 'gyur zhing spang ma zos pa yang da bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: bcos pa'i chang gi nur rtsi ni snyigs ma yin la sbyar ba'i chang gi nur rtsi ni spang ma yin te /
analyzed: bcos pa'i chang gi nur rtsi ni snyigs ma yin la sbyar ba'i chang gi nur rtsi ni spang ma yin te /
translated: The dregs of medicinal alcohol are the dregs, and the dregs of medicinal beer are the dregs of beer.🔽If one eats them, the offense of wrongdoing is like the complete offense that arises from drinking alcohol.

original: de dag zos na yang ji ltar myos 'gyur 'thungs na yongs su rdzogs pa'i nyes byas su 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyes byas kyi rdo rje'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag zos na yang ji ltar myos 'gyur 'thungs na yongs su rdzogs pa'i nyes byas su 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyes byas kyi rdo rje'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
translated: The offense of wrongdoing is the offense of wrongdoing.

original: rdo rje'i gnod pa ni rdo rje'i gnod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gnod pa ni rdo rje'i gnod pa'o //
translated: The offense of wrongdoing is the offense of wrongdoing.

original: nyes byas kho na'i rdo rje'i gnod pa ni nyes byas rdo rje'i gnod par 'gyur te rdo rjes gnod pa bzhin du nyes byas kyi nyes pa yang gdung bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The offense of wrongdoing is like the offense of drinking alcohol, because it is the offense of wrongdoing that torments one, just as a thunderbolt torments one.

original: dang ni nyes byas su sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dang ni nyes byas su sdud par byed pa'o //

original: pa'i don te /

original: myos skyed ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: myos skyed ces bya ba smos te /
