analyzed: gal te rtsa ba la sogs pa myos pa skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de ni de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it is a root, etc. that produces intoxication, it is of that kind, is the meaning.

original: de la phabs kyi rdog ni myos par 'gyur ba'i don gyis bon gang zhig sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: de la phabs kyi rdog ni myos par 'gyur ba'i don gyis bon gang zhig sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Therein, a pellet of yeast is any seed that is applied for the purpose of intoxication.

original: gang dag la myos par 'gyur ba med pa de ci btung bar bya ba'am zhe na /🔽gang la myos 'gyur ro dang dri yod pa //
analyzed: gang dag la myos par 'gyur ba med pa de ci btung bar bya ba'am zhe na / gang la myos 'gyur ro dang dri yod pa //
translated: If one asks, “What is it that is not intoxicating?”

original: myos 'gyur med kyang btung bar bya ba min //
analyzed: myos 'gyur med kyang btung bar bya ba min //

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, “That which has the intoxicating scent or taste.”

original: myos par 'gyur ba ni myos 'gyur te /
analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba ni myos 'gyur te /

analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba de nyid la med du zin kyang btung bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Even if it is not intoxicating, it should not be drunk.

original: ci'i phyir btung bar mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir btung bar mi bya zhe na /

original: smras pa / gang la myos 'gyur dri dang ro yod pa ste /🔽myos par 'gyur pa'i dri dang ro rdzas gang dag la yod cing de lta bur gyur ba gang yin pa de ni myos par byed pa ma yin du zin kyang btung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang la myos 'gyur dri dang ro yod pa ste / myos par 'gyur pa'i dri dang ro rdzas gang dag la yod cing de lta bur gyur ba gang yin pa de ni myos par byed pa ma yin du zin kyang btung bar mi bya'o //
translated: The root text states, “That which has the intoxicating scent or taste.”🔽Even if it is not intoxicating, it should not be drunk.

original: kyang gi sgra ni myos par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi 'on kyang myos par 'gyur ba ma yin yang btung bar mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni myos par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi 'on kyang myos par 'gyur ba ma yin yang btung bar mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “even” indicates that it should not be drunk not only because it is intoxicating, but also because it is not intoxicating.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te gang gi phyir myos par 'gyur ba med kyang dri dang ro yod pa de'i phyir spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa dang rim pa gzhan du blta bar bya ba'i don yin no //

translated: The word “ni” has the meaning of “hi” (for what reason). For what reason is it to be abandoned even though it does not cause intoxication? Because it has odor and taste.

original: 'di la yang nyes pa chung bar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang nyes pa chung bar bshad par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is another way of explaining the same point.

original: lus la bsku ba la sogs pa nad kyi gnyen po'i phyogs kyi don du nad pa kho nas bya'i gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir dang / lus la bsku dang khur bar bcang ba ni //

translated: In order to show that anointing and massaging the body are only for the sick, not for others, because they are a means of treating illness, he says:🔽“Do not anoint and massage the body

original: myos 'gyur nad pa ma gtogs ma byed cig / ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: myos 'gyur nad pa ma gtogs ma byed cig / ces bya ba smos te /
translated: except when sick and in need of it.”

original: chang gis lus la bsku ba dang khur bar bcang bar bya'o zhes sdud pa de'i phyir gzhan du nad kyi rgyu mtshan gyis kyang btung bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chang gis lus la bsku ba dang khur bar bcang bar bya'o zhes sdud pa de'i phyir gzhan du nad kyi rgyu mtshan gyis kyang btung bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning is that anointing and massaging the body with alcohol is not to be done except when sick and in need of it.

original: ci ste yang myos byed btung ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa de lta na yang nad kyi rgyu mtshan gyis lus la bsdu ba dang / khur bar bcang ba ma gtogs pa gzhan gyi don du mi bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste yang myos byed btung ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa de lta na yang nad kyi rgyu mtshan gyis lus la bsdu ba dang / khur bar bcang ba ma gtogs pa gzhan gyi don du mi bya ste /
translated: Even if alcohol is a natural offense, it is not to be used for one’s own purposes, except for the purpose of curing illness, or for the purpose of preserving one’s health.

original: nad gyi gnyen po'i phyir btung bar bya ba yang ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: nad gyi gnyen po'i phyir btung bar bya ba yang ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is not to be used as a remedy for illness, because it is said:

original: myos 'gyur rtsva mchog tsam yang btung mi bya //🔽zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: myos 'gyur rtsva mchog tsam yang btung mi bya // zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Do not drink alcohol, not even a blade of grass dipped in it.

original: bskol bar @233b gyur tam zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba smras pa yin te /
analyzed: bskol bar @233b gyur tam zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba smras pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “if it is boiled” and so on, refers to the exception to the above rule.

original: bskol ba de myos par 'gyur ba bskol bar gyur pa gang gi tshe 'thungs par gyur pa de'i tshe nyes pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: bskol ba de myos par 'gyur ba bskol bar gyur pa gang gi tshe 'thungs par gyur pa de'i tshe nyes pa med pa yin no //
translated: There is no offense if one drinks alcohol that has been boiled so that it is no longer intoxicating.

original: nyid ni gang gi phyir bskol bas myos par 'gyur pa'i dngos po las nyams par gyur pa de'i phyir 'thungs pa la nyes pa med pa kho na yin zhes nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: nyid ni gang gi phyir bskol bas myos par 'gyur pa'i dngos po las nyams par gyur pa de'i phyir 'thungs pa la nyes pa med pa kho na yin zhes nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: “But” means that because the intoxicating property has been removed by boiling, therefore there is no fault in drinking it.

original: de bzhin du de dang kha dog tsam 'dra bar gyur tam zhes bya ba la myos par 'gyur ba de dang kha dog tsam 'dra bar gyur pa yang 'thungs na nyes pa med do zhes bya ba sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de dang kha dog tsam 'dra bar gyur tam zhes bya ba la myos par 'gyur ba de dang kha dog tsam 'dra bar gyur pa yang 'thungs na nyes pa med do zhes bya ba sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, “if it is just the same color” means that if it is just the same color as that which is intoxicating, there is no fault in drinking it.

original: 'am ni sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'am ni sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “or” is a conjunctive particle.

original: de bzhin du ma red gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang yang ma red pa dang / nyams pa myos par 'gyur ba'i dngos po gang la yod pa de yang 'thungs pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //

translated: Similarly, “if it is not intoxicating” means that if it is not intoxicating, and the intoxicating property has been removed, there is no fault in drinking it.

original: 'am gyi sgra ni kyang gi sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'am gyi sgra ni kyang gi sgra'i don yin no //
translated: The word “or” has the sense of “also.”

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la myos par 'gyur ba'i rgyu spangs pa de'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽da ni myos 'gyur phyogs su gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid kyi nyes byas 'chad par byed de /

translated: Because the cause of intoxication is abandoned in this precept, there is no fault.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Now, in the verse that begins, “Intoxicants, garlic, and leeks,” mental misdeeds are explained.

original: btsong dang / ri sgog dang / sgog skya ni myos 'gyur gyi phyogs su 'dod cing sems te /
analyzed: btsong dang / ri sgog dang / sgog skya ni myos 'gyur gyi phyogs su 'dod cing sems te /
translated: Intoxicants, garlic, and leeks are considered to be in the category of intoxicants.

original: ji ltar myos par 'gyur ba shin tu smad pa de bzhin du 'di yang zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar myos par 'gyur ba shin tu smad pa de bzhin du 'di yang zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //

original: 'di lta ste'i sgra ni yang gi sgra yin pas ni 'di skad du myos par 'gyur ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi dus ma yin pa'i zas kyi phyogs su gtogs pa yang yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste'i sgra ni yang gi sgra yin pas ni 'di skad du myos par 'gyur ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi dus ma yin pa'i zas kyi phyogs su gtogs pa yang yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “such as” indicates that it is not only intoxicants that are in the category of intoxicants, but also food at inappropriate times.

original: de ltar yang ni zhes bya pa nye bar dgod par bya ba yin te myos par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar shin tu smad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes de ltar 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa las rnam par dpyad pa yin no //

translated: Thus, it is analyzed in the Vinaya commentary.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis nad pa la rjes su gnang ba yin gyi gzhan dag la ni nyes pa dag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis nad pa la rjes su gnang ba yin gyi gzhan dag la ni nyes pa dag tu 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the Lord permitted intoxicants for the sick, but not for others, because they are faults.

original: myos par byed pa dang 'dra bar dregs par byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myos par byed pa dang 'dra bar dregs par byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the cause of intoxication, like intoxicants.

analyzed: de dag mkhas pa'i lung gis nad pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ston par byed de /

analyzed: ma dad mngon sum min zhes bya ba smras te /

original: mi ma dad ba'i mngon sum min to /
analyzed: mi ma dad ba'i mngon sum min to /
translated: It is not the direct perception of a non-believer.

original: mthong ba'i phyogs su ma yin te de la smod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i phyogs su ma yin te de la smod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not in the direction of seeing, because it is possible to criticize it there.

original: de la longs spyod pa'i don du ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la longs spyod pa'i don du ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one act for the sake of enjoyment there?

original: gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol khyim byas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol khyim byas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said: Having made a house outside the monastery, etc.

original: gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du khyim byas pa la zhugs nas so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du khyim byas pa la zhugs nas so //
translated: Having entered a house made outside the monastery.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phan par bya phyir zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: phan par bya phyir zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: It is said: For the sake of benefit.

original: khyim khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyim khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of special house?

original: dben par zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dben par zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: In a secluded place.

original: skabs dang mthongs bsgribs par gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni dben pa yin te der zhugs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skabs dang mthongs bsgribs par gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni dben pa yin te der zhugs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which has a covered space is secluded. The meaning is: having entered there.

original: de la phan pa byed pa'i dus der yang dge 'dun gyi mal stan dag nad pa la nam yang /
analyzed: de la phan pa byed pa'i dus der yang dge 'dun gyi mal stan dag nad pa la nam yang /
translated: Even at that time of benefiting, the bedding of the Saṅgha should never be given to the sick.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba yang med de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba yang med de /
translated: The Blessed One did not allow it.

original: dri ngan pas sme bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dri ngan pas sme bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the meaning of the verse is that one becomes defiled by a bad smell.

original: ci tsam na gtsug lag khang du 'jug par bya ba yin zhe na /🔽dri nga bral bar gyur nas de'i 'og tu ;
analyzed: ci tsam na gtsug lag khang du 'jug par bya ba yin zhe na / dri nga bral bar gyur nas de'i 'og tu ;
translated: How long does one remain outside the monastery?

original: / zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text continues:🔽“When he is free from the bad smell, then afterwards…”

original: dge tshul gang gi lus dri nga ba dang bral bar gyur pa na ste /
analyzed: dge tshul gang gi lus dri nga ba dang bral bar gyur pa na ste /
translated: When the postulant’s body is free from the bad smell,

original: zhag bdun dag na dri nga ba yang lus dang bral bar gyur pa'i 'og tu gtsug lag khang du 'jug cing rab tu 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun dag na dri nga ba yang lus dang bral bar gyur pa'i 'og tu gtsug lag khang du 'jug cing rab tu 'jug par bya'o //
translated: then after seven days, he should enter the monastery and live there.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gzhan gnas nas zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gzhan gnas nas zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The text says, “because of the danger of defiling oneself and others.”

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word “only” is for emphasis.

original: dge tshul gyi tshig le'ur byas pa las myos par byed pa btung ba las slar ldog pa ste bslab pa'i gzhi lnga pa'o /
analyzed: dge tshul gyi tshig le'ur byas pa las myos par byed pa btung ba las slar ldog pa ste bslab pa'i gzhi lnga pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fifth precept of the novice monk, the vow to refrain from drinking alcohol, from the Verse Summary on the Training of Novices.

original: // / da ni /
analyzed: // / da ni /
translated: Now,

original: gar dang glu dang brdung bar bya ba rnams //
analyzed: gar dang glu dang brdung bar bya ba rnams //
translated: dancing, singing, and playing music,

original: sdom can bdag dang gzhan gyis bya ba min //
analyzed: sdom can bdag dang gzhan gyis bya ba min //
translated: are not to be done by one who is restrained, either by oneself or by others.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bslab pa'i gzhi drug pa 'chad par byed pa yin te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bslab pa'i gzhi drug pa 'chad par byed pa yin te ;
translated: This passage explains the sixth rule of training.

original: gar dang glu dang brdung bar bya ba dag sdom can bdag rang gis mi bya zhing gzhan gyis kyang bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gar dang glu dang brdung bar bya ba dag sdom can bdag rang gis mi bya zhing gzhan gyis kyang bya ba ma yin no //
translated: One should not dance, sing, or play music oneself, nor should one cause others to do so.

original: gang cung zhig rgod pa'i bsam pas lus rab tu skyod par byed pa ni gar yin la /
analyzed: gang cung zhig rgod pa'i bsam pas lus rab tu skyod par byed pa ni gar yin la /
translated: Dancing is to move one’s body with a frivolous mind.

original: gang cung zhig de nyid kyi bsam pas dbyangs len par byed pa ni glu yin no //🔽brdung bar bya ba dag ni gang 'ga' zhig tu rdza rnga dang rnga bo che dag la tha na sor mo dag gis kyang rim gyis sam /🔽go rims ma yin pas rdung bar byed cing rab tu skyod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang cung zhig de nyid kyi bsam pas dbyangs len par byed pa ni glu yin no // brdung bar bya ba dag ni gang 'ga' zhig tu rdza rnga dang rnga bo che dag la tha na sor mo dag gis kyang rim gyis sam / go rims ma yin pas rdung bar byed cing rab tu skyod par byed pa yin te /
translated: Singing is to make music with a frivolous mind.🔽Playing music is to play a musical instrument, even with one’s fingers, in a frivolous manner, such as playing a drum or a lute.🔽One should not dance, sing, or play music oneself, nor should one cause others to do so.

original: rang gi brla la sogs pa la brdeg pa la sogs pas kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi brla la sogs pa la brdeg pa la sogs pas kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should not dance, sing, or play music oneself, nor should one cause others to do so.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ni 'du shes gtso bor gyur ba @234b nyid yin pas gang gi phyir blo sngon du btang bas byas na blo sngon du song bas zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas nyes pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ni 'du shes gtso bor gyur ba @234b nyid yin pas gang gi phyir blo sngon du btang bas byas na blo sngon du song bas zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas nyes pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Since this precept is primarily a matter of attitude, if one does it with a prior intention, then there is an offense, in terms of the prior intention.

original: ci 'di rgyu gang gis mi bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'di rgyu gang gis mi bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: By what cause is this not to be done?

original: 'di dag 'khor bar chags par byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di dag 'khor bar chags par byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “because it is the cause of attachment to cyclic existence.”

original: 'khor ba la chags pa ni 'khor bar chags pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba la chags pa ni 'khor bar chags pa ste /
translated: Attachment to cyclic existence is attachment to cyclic existence.

original: kun nas zhen pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun nas zhen pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is “complete attachment.”

original: gar la sogs pa byed pa 'di ni 'dir rgyu ste byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gar la sogs pa byed pa 'di ni 'dir rgyu ste byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The performance of dance and so on is the cause here, in the sense of the cause of action.

original: gang gi phyir gar la sogs pa la rab tu dga' ba ni skyo bar mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir mngon par dga' ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gar la sogs pa la rab tu dga' ba ni skyo bar mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir mngon par dga' ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Since one who is delighted with dance and so on does not become disgusted, therefore delight is the cause of cyclic existence.

original: de lta bur gyur pa byas na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa byas na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens if one does it in that way?

original: 'on kyang ji ste byas na nyes byas su 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te /🔽gang la sogs pa 'on kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ste byas na nyes byas su 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te / gang la sogs pa 'on kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: What is the offense?

original: 'di la nyes byas yod pa'i phyir nyes byas dang dge tshul ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la nyes byas yod pa'i phyir nyes byas dang dge tshul ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is an offense here, there is an offense for the novice monk.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni gal te yang 'khor bar chags pa'i rgyu yin pa de lta na yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni gal te yang 'khor bar chags pa'i rgyu yin pa de lta na yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But if, even though it is the cause of attachment to cyclic existence, one does not make offerings to the Buddha,

original: bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i don du ji ltar bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i don du ji ltar bsgrub par bya //
translated: how can one make offerings to the Buddha?🔽If one does not make offerings to the Buddha, how can one make offerings to the Buddha?

original: de'i phyir yang mi bskul lam zhe na smras pa /🔽de la gzhan gyi don lta zhog / bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa bya ba'i don dang dgos pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang mi bskul lam zhe na smras pa / de la gzhan gyi don lta zhog / bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa bya ba'i don dang dgos pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽Even for the sake of making offerings to the Buddha, one should not make offerings to the Buddha.

original: de'i dngos po de la yang mchod pa'i rgyu mtshan du yang bskul bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po de la yang mchod pa'i rgyu mtshan du yang bskul bar mi bya'o //
translated: Even for the sake of making offerings to the Buddha, one should not make offerings to the Buddha.

original: ji ltar mi bskul zhes /
analyzed: ji ltar mi bskul zhes /
translated: How is it that one should not make offerings to the Buddha?

original: brdung ba dang glu long zhes bya ba smos pa yin no zhes ni de ltar zhes bya ba'i don yin te /🔽'di skad du de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos kyi tshig brjod par mi bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdung ba dang glu long zhes bya ba smos pa yin no zhes ni de ltar zhes bya ba'i don yin te / 'di skad du de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos kyi tshig brjod par mi bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of thus is that one should not speak the actual words in that way.🔽It is taught that one should not speak the actual words in that way.

original: de bzhin du gar la yang de skad du brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gar la yang de skad du brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should not speak in that way with regard to dancing.

original: 'o na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir bskul bar bya zhe na //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir bskul bar bya zhe na //
translated: If that is so, then how should one request the Blessed One to worship?

original: lha dang lha min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lha dang lha min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says gods and demigods, etc.

original: lha dang lha ma yin ni lha dang lha min dbang po ste /
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin ni lha dang lha min dbang po ste /
translated: The gods and demigods are the lords of the gods and demigods.

original: des mchod pa'i zhags kyi rdul sangs rgyas gang la mnga' ba de ni lha dang lha min dbang pos mchod pa'i zhabs rdul can te /
analyzed: des mchod pa'i zhags kyi rdul sangs rgyas gang la mnga' ba de ni lha dang lha min dbang pos mchod pa'i zhabs rdul can te /
translated: The one whose feet are worshipped by the lords of the gods and demigods is the one whose dust of feet is worshipped by the lords of the gods and demigods.

original: de la rang gi bzos mchod pa gyis zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi bzos mchod pa gyis zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The meaning is that one should worship him with one's own creation.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni ji ste yang zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni ji ste yang zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: However, the meaning of if is even though.

original: glu'i dmigs kyis bsal ba ni /
analyzed: glu'i dmigs kyis bsal ba ni /
translated: The exception to the rule is stated in the verse:

original: chos rnams dbyangs su 'don la nyes pa med //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: chos rnams dbyangs su 'don la nyes pa med // ces bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: There is no fault in singing the Dharma.

original: chos mnyan pa sbyin pa'i glu la ni nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //🔽ni'i sgra ni snga ma las khyad par du bya ba dang / rim pa gzhan @235a * //
analyzed: chos mnyan pa sbyin pa'i glu la ni nyes pa yod pa ma yin no // ni'i sgra ni snga ma las khyad par du bya ba dang / rim pa gzhan @235a * //
translated: In this verse, there is no fault in singing the Dharma when one is giving a gift of Dharma.

original: du'i don to //
analyzed: du'i don to //
translated: The word “also” indicates a difference from the previous verse and a different order.

original: ston pa'i yon tan brjod kyang de bzhin no //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ston pa'i yon tan brjod kyang de bzhin no // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the same when one praises the virtues of the Teacher.

original: ji ltar snga ma la nyes pa yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du ston pa bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan brjod pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar snga ma la nyes pa yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du ston pa bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan brjod pa ste /
translated: Just as there is no fault in the previous case, there is no fault in praising the virtues of the Teacher, the Blessed One.

original: ston pas nye bar mchod pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ston pas nye bar mchod pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no fault in praising the Teacher.

original: gang yang dbyangs mi shes pa yin na ji ltar bya zhe na /🔽dbyangs la mi mkhas dam pa'i chos kyi phyir //
analyzed: gang yang dbyangs mi shes pa yin na ji ltar bya zhe na / dbyangs la mi mkhas dam pa'i chos kyi phyir //
translated: But what if one does not know how to sing?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse says, “If one is not skilled in singing, one should sing the Dharma with a pleasant voice.”

original: dbyangs mi shes pa ni dbyangs la mi mkhas pa'i dge tshul dben par zhugs te bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyangs mi shes pa ni dbyangs la mi mkhas pa'i dge tshul dben par zhugs te bslab par bya'o //
translated: One who does not know the melody should be secluded and train in the melody.

original: ci'i rgyu mtshan gyis she na /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu mtshan gyis she na /
translated: For what reason?

original: dam pa'i chos kyi phyir zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi phyir zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: Because of the true Dharma.

original: ni'i sgra ni 'dir yang dbyangs la mi mkhas na zhes snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni 'dir yang dbyangs la mi mkhas na zhes snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
translated: The word also here has the meaning of distinguishing from the previous, that if one is not skilled in the melody.

original: nyid ni don gzhan rnam par gcod pa'o //
analyzed: nyid ni don gzhan rnam par gcod pa'o //
translated: Itself excludes other meanings.

original: dben par zhugs te zhes smos pa ni bag med pa rnam par spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dben par zhugs te zhes smos pa ni bag med pa rnam par spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Should be secluded and train is said in order to abandon heedlessness.

original: bslab par bya zhes bya ba ni 'di bslab pa'i gzhi ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bslab par bya zhes bya ba ni 'di bslab pa'i gzhi ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Should train does not mean this is a basis for training.

original: gal te dam pa'i chos la bstod pas nye bar mchod pa'i phyir bslab pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tshig de dag ni mchog tu zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dam pa'i chos la bstod pas nye bar mchod pa'i phyir bslab pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tshig de dag ni mchog tu zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: If it is said that there is no fault in training because of worshipping with praise of the true Dharma, those words should be understood as supreme.

original: 'dir gar la sogs pa bdag nyid byed pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug na yongs su rdzogs pa'i nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir gar la sogs pa bdag nyid byed pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug na yongs su rdzogs pa'i nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: Here, if one acts as a dancer, etc., or causes another to act, then there is a complete offense.

original: gal te mchod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis byed na de'i tshe na snad do /
analyzed: gal te mchod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis byed na de'i tshe na snad do /
translated: If one acts for the sake of worship, then there is no offense.

original: da ni gar la sogs gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid kyir 'gyur ba 'chad par byed de /🔽chu'i rnga la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni chu'i rnga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni gar la sogs gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid kyir 'gyur ba 'chad par byed de / chu'i rnga la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni chu'i rnga la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the verse reads:🔽“If one engages in dancing, singing, or instrumental music, or if one enjoys watching or listening, there is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: gang de ni gar la sogs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin pa de'i phyir yid kyir 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang de ni gar la sogs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin pa de'i phyir yid kyir 'gyur te /
translated: Dancing, etc., is included in the category of dancing, etc. Therefore, it is mental.

original: chu'i yul la rtse ba nyams su myong bar byed na /
analyzed: chu'i yul la rtse ba nyams su myong bar byed na /
translated: If one enjoys the experience of playing in the water,

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: this is the meaning.

original: sogs pa'i sgra ni rgyal la / sogs pa'i bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra ni rgyal la / sogs pa'i bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the king, etc.

original: chu'i rnga ni chu la brdung ba yin no //
analyzed: chu'i rnga ni chu la brdung ba yin no //
translated: A water drum is beaten in the water.

original: de bzhin du chu la byi 'dzul byed pa ni 'og tu 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu la byi 'dzul byed pa ni 'og tu 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, one dives in the water, going under.

original: de bzhin du ring du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni chu'i nang du nub par gyur pa nyid kyis dung 'gro bzhin du 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ring du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni chu'i nang du nub par gyur pa nyid kyis dung 'gro bzhin du 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: Likewise, “going far” means going like a conch, that is, by sinking into the water.

original: 'byung ba ni 'og tu 'jug pa las steng du 'byung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'og tu 'jug pa las steng du 'byung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Emerging” means going up after going down.

original: de bzhin du mchong ba dang rgyug pa ni mchod ba dang rgyug pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mchong ba dang rgyug pa ni mchod ba dang rgyug pa ste /
translated: Likewise, “jumping” and “running” mean jumping and running.

original: de la sogs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is like that is called “that kind of thing.”

original: mchong ba ni lteng ka la sogs pa'o //🔽sogs pa smos pas ni rkang ba phyung zhing phyung zhing 'gro ba 'am /
analyzed: mchong ba ni lteng ka la sogs pa'o // sogs pa smos pas ni rkang ba phyung zhing phyung zhing 'gro ba 'am /
translated: “Jumping” means jumping over a pond, and so on.🔽The word “and so on” includes stretching out the legs while walking,

original: bgrad par @235b byas nas 'gro ba bsdu'o //
analyzed: bgrad par @235b byas nas 'gro ba bsdu'o //
translated: or going with a limp.

original: de dag thams cad rtsed mo'i rgyu mtshan yin na bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad rtsed mo'i rgyu mtshan yin na bkag pa yin no //
translated: All of these are the reasons for play, and they are prohibited.

original: de dag nyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyir rlung la sogs pa la nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir rtsed mo smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyes pa'i gnyen po'i phyir rlung la sogs pa la nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir rtsed mo smos pa yin no //
translated: Play is mentioned in order to show that there is no fault in the wind and so on for the purpose of countering faults.

original: so snang gyur cing de bzhin sgra che ba //
analyzed: so snang gyur cing de bzhin sgra che ba //
translated: The teeth are bared, and likewise there is loud sound.

original: 'phags pas rta gang dang ni gtam mi bya //
analyzed: 'phags pas rta gang dang ni gtam mi bya //
translated: The noble ones do not speak of the horse and the chariot.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The noble one should not laugh loudly or talk.

original: so snang bar gyur ba ni gsal por gyur pas 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: so snang bar gyur ba ni gsal por gyur pas 'phags pa ste /
translated: The noble one is one who has become clear, i.e., lucid.

original: rab tu byung bas dgod par mi bya zhing gtam mi bya zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rab tu byung bas dgod par mi bya zhing gtam mi bya zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The monk should not laugh loudly or talk.

original: de bzhin gyi sgra ni de bzhin sgra che bar bshad ma thag pa de mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gyi sgra ni de bzhin sgra che bar bshad ma thag pa de mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “also” is used to include the immediately preceding statement about not laughing loudly.

original: dang ni sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ni sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “and” is a conjunction.

original: sgra che ba smos pas cung zhig dgod pa la nyes pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra che ba smos pas cung zhig dgod pa la nyes pa med pa yin te /
translated: The statement about laughing loudly shows that there is no fault in laughing a little.

original: de skad du yang bzhin gyi mdog gsal ba dang / 'dzum pa sngon du 'gro bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin pas kha shin tu gdangs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de skad du yang bzhin gyi mdog gsal ba dang / 'dzum pa sngon du 'gro bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin pas kha shin tu gdangs par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that one should not open one’s mouth too wide when smiling, etc.

original: gang gi tshe kha glal bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ji ltar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kha glal bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ji ltar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: What should one do when yawning?

original: gla la byung na ni lag pa'am chos gos kyi gra yang rung ste /
analyzed: gla la byung na ni lag pa'am chos gos kyi gra yang rung ste /
translated: When yawning, one should cover one’s mouth with one’s hand or the edge of one’s saṃghāṭī robe.

original: kha ni dag ba par bya zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kha ni dag ba par bya zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One should cover one’s mouth.

original: lag pa'am gos kyi mtha' ma dag gis kha legs par bkag ste glal bar bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa'am gos kyi mtha' ma dag gis kha legs par bkag ste glal bar bya'o //
translated: One should yawn, covering one’s mouth with the edge of one’s garment or hand.

original: 'on te 'ga' zhig tu gzhan gyi dbang gis mi nus pa de'i tshe na nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'on te 'ga' zhig tu gzhan gyi dbang gis mi nus pa de'i tshe na nyes pa med de /
translated: But if one is unable to do so because of some other compelling circumstance, there is no offense.

original: dang ni ma bstan pa sdud par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dang ni ma bstan pa sdud par byed pa yin te /
translated: The word “or” in the verse includes what is not mentioned.

original: dper na kha gdangs nas chu btung ba de lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na kha gdangs nas chu btung ba de lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is not an offense to drink water with an open mouth if one is thirsty.

original: sngar bshad pa'i 'byung ba la sogs pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba ni /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i 'byung ba la sogs pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba ni /
translated: The exceptions to the above rules are stated in the verse:

original: sman pa'i lung ngam yang na bslab pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sman pa'i lung ngam yang na bslab pa'i phyir //
translated: If one is ill, or if one is learning,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: or if one is reciting, there is no offense.

original: nad pa la phan pa'i don du sman pa'i lung gis dben pa'i sa phyogs su 'byung ba la sogs pa byas na nyes pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: nad pa la phan pa'i don du sman pa'i lung gis dben pa'i sa phyogs su 'byung ba la sogs pa byas na nyes pa med pa yin te /
translated: If one is ill, there is no offense if one yawns, etc., in an isolated place, following the advice of a physician, in order to benefit a patient.

original: sman pa'i lu nga kho nas rgyal ba la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sman pa'i lu nga kho nas rgyal ba la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say that there is no offense for a king if he yawns, etc., following the advice of a physician.

original: yang na bslab pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na bslab pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, if one is learning, or if one is reciting, there is no offense.

original: de lta na yang dben pa'i phyogs su rkyal pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de lta na yang dben pa'i phyogs su rkyal pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: However, there is no fault in bathing in a secluded place.

original: aa tha'i sgra ni yang na zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: aa tha'i sgra ni yang na zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The word “or” means “alternatively.”

original: gang du bud med sgrub byed khung byed pa //🔽mu de thag ring du ni spang bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la gang du bud med khrus byed pa dang / gang du sgrub par byed pa glang po la sogs pa khrus byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang du bud med sgrub byed khung byed pa // mu de thag ring du ni spang bar bya // zhes bya ba la gang du bud med khrus byed pa dang / gang du sgrub par byed pa glang po la sogs pa khrus byed pa'am /
translated: One should avoid a place where women bathe🔽and a place where elephants and so on bathe and drink.

original: chu 'thung ba'i mu de thag ring ste /
analyzed: chu 'thung ba'i mu de thag ring ste /
translated: In a place where women bathe, or in a place where elephants and so on bathe and drink,

original: ring ba nas ring por spang bar bya ba yin no //🔽'dod chags skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan rab tu bcom par bya ba'i phyir dang / kun nas rtsod @236a * //
analyzed: ring ba nas ring por spang bar bya ba yin no // 'dod chags skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan rab tu bcom par bya ba'i phyir dang / kun nas rtsod @236a * //
translated: one should avoid a place that is far away.🔽One should avoid a place that is far away from a place that is far away.

original: pa yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dgos pa yod par rig par bya'o //🔽dge tshul gyi tshig le'ur byas pa las gar la sogs pa las slar ldog pa ste /
analyzed: pa yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dgos pa yod par rig par bya'o // dge tshul gyi tshig le'ur byas pa las gar la sogs pa las slar ldog pa ste /
translated: One should understand that the purpose of this rule is to destroy the causes of the arising of passion and to avoid complete conflict.🔽The sixth rule for novices is to avoid dancing and so on.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi drug pa'o /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi drug pa'o /
translated: The sixth rule for novices is to avoid dancing and so on.

original: // / da ni dri'i byug pa'am me tog phreng ba'ang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas bslab pa'i gzhi bdun pa 'chad pa yin te /
analyzed: // / da ni dri'i byug pa'am me tog phreng ba'ang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas bslab pa'i gzhi bdun pa 'chad pa yin te /
translated: Now, the seventh rule of training is stated by “one should not apply perfume or wear garlands,” and so on.

original: tsan dan la sogs pa'i dris rjes su bskus pa de ni dri'i byug pa ste /
analyzed: tsan dan la sogs pa'i dris rjes su bskus pa de ni dri'i byug pa ste /
translated: Perfume is the application of scents such as sandalwood.

original: dge tshul gang gis bcangs na /
analyzed: dge tshul gang gis bcangs na /
translated: If a novice monk wears it,

original: glen pa de ni nyes byas nyid kyis gtses par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: glen pa de ni nyes byas nyid kyis gtses par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: he is afflicted by the mere misdeed.

original: de bzhin du me tog phreng ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du me tog phreng ba ste /
translated: Likewise, a garland is a string of flowers.

original: brgyud ma de yang mgo bo 'am ske la btags na de yang nyes byas nyid kyis gtses par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: brgyud ma de yang mgo bo 'am ske la btags na de yang nyes byas nyid kyis gtses par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If he wears it on his head or neck, he is afflicted by the mere misdeed.

original: phreng pa ni me tog tsam gyi nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phreng pa ni me tog tsam gyi nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin no //
translated: A garland is an illustration of just flowers.

original: de ltar lus la gur gum la sogs pa'i mdog gi kha dog gis bcangs pa de yang gtses par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lus la gur gum la sogs pa'i mdog gi kha dog gis bcangs pa de yang gtses par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: If he wears a body that is colored with saffron and so on, he is afflicted by the mere misdeed.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: lus la zhas smos pa yin no //
analyzed: lus la zhas smos pa yin no //
translated: It is said to be the body.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: mi gtsang snod kyi zhes bya ba la mi gtsang ba ni gtsang ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mi gtsang snod kyi zhes bya ba la mi gtsang ba ni gtsang ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: The term “impure vessel” means an impure vessel.

original: de'i snod du gyur pa de la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i snod du gyur pa de la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is a vessel for that.

original: gtses pa ni rnam par gtses pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽nyid ni nyes byas kyi nyes pas gtses pa kho na zhes rim pa gzhan dang nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gtses pa ni rnam par gtses pa zhes bya ba'i don to // nyid ni nyes byas kyi nyes pas gtses pa kho na zhes rim pa gzhan dang nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: “Afflicted” means afflicted by affliction.🔽“Only” has the meaning of a restrictive particle.

original: 'di skad du dge tshul nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du dge tshul nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning is that it is taught that a novice monk is afflicted by the fault of a minor offense.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,🔽the purification, the robe, the incense,

original: dag byed dang ni chos gos bdug pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dag byed dang ni chos gos bdug pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: dag byed dang chos gos la spos kyis bdug pa dang / sen mo bdar bas 'chos pa dang / mig sman dang / mchu dmar por byed pa dang / de bzhin du long mo yan chad de gong du so phag gis bdar zhing dri ma med par sbyangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu la sogs pa kun du spyod pa na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //🔽ci thams cad du'am zhe na /🔽g-yan pa med par zhes smras te /🔽gal te g-yan pa yod pa de'i tshe nyes par mi 'gyur ro //🔽dag byed ces bya ba ni rdzas dri bzang ba can gyis dag byed du byas pa mgo la bcangs pa'o //🔽gzhan yang chos gos la dri bzang pos bdug par byed pa dang / sen mo 'chos pa zhes bya ba ni 'tsher bar byed pa'i bsam pas yin gyi dri ma bsal bar byed pa'i @236b phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dag byed dang chos gos la spos kyis bdug pa dang / sen mo bdar bas 'chos pa dang / mig sman dang / mchu dmar por byed pa dang / de bzhin du long mo yan chad de gong du so phag gis bdar zhing dri ma med par sbyangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu la sogs pa kun du spyod pa na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //🔽ci thams cad du'am zhe na /🔽g-yan pa med par zhes smras te /🔽gal te g-yan pa yod pa de'i tshe nyes par mi 'gyur ro //🔽dag byed ces bya ba ni rdzas dri bzang ba can gyis dag byed du byas pa mgo la bcangs pa'o //🔽gzhan yang chos gos la dri bzang pos bdug par byed pa dang / sen mo 'chos pa zhes bya ba ni 'tsher bar byed pa'i bsam pas yin gyi dri ma bsal bar byed pa'i @236b phyir ni ma yin no //
