original: gzhan yang mchu dmar por byed pa ni so rtsi zab la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang mchu dmar por byed pa ni so rtsi zab la sogs pas so //
translated: Moreover, the red lips are a sign of the use of deep red tooth powder, etc.

original: g-yan pa ni tshig rlung dang khrag la sogs pa'i nyes par mtshon par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: g-yan pa ni tshig rlung dang khrag la sogs pa'i nyes par mtshon par byed pa yin te /
translated: The moles are a sign of the faults of wind, bile, blood, etc.

original: long mo'i 'og man chad la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: long mo'i 'og man chad la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault below the ankle.

original: nyes byas nyid ces bya ba nyid ni lhag ma yang ma yin la yid kyir 'gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes byas nyid ces bya ba nyid ni lhag ma yang ma yin la yid kyir 'gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “only” in the root text indicates that the offense is not a serious transgression and is not a downfall that requires confession by a formal ceremony.

original: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dri'i byug pa nyes byas su 'gyur ba de lta na yang nang pa des dben par 'dug ste nad la phan pa'i phyir tsan dan la sogs pas bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dri'i byug pa nyes byas su 'gyur ba de lta na yang nang pa des dben par 'dug ste nad la phan pa'i phyir tsan dan la sogs pas bsku bar bya'o //
translated: Even though the application of perfume is an offense because it is a natural offense, an insider may apply sandalwood, etc., to an isolated place for the sake of curing an illness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spras pa 'jig rten gyi ma dad pa ni 'jig rten ma dad par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: spras pa 'jig rten gyi ma dad pa ni 'jig rten ma dad par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The world loses faith in the one who is adorned, and the world loses faith in the one who is perfumed.

original: de spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The purpose of the rule is to avoid that loss of faith.

original: gang gi phyir de 'dra ba mthong bar 'gyur na ma dad pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'dra ba mthong bar 'gyur na ma dad pa ste /
translated: The world loses faith when it sees such things.

original: dad pa ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir yongs su spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dad pa ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir yongs su spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Because faithlessness would arise, it is to be avoided.

original: gang gi tshe chos ston pa la sogs pas nye bar 'khod pa na yon bdag gis dri byin na de ci ltar bya zhe na /🔽dad pa dag gis rkang pa dris bskus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos ston pa la sogs pas nye bar 'khod pa na yon bdag gis dri byin na de ci ltar bya zhe na / dad pa dag gis rkang pa dris bskus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: When one is seated to teach the Dharma, etc., and the patron offers perfume, what should one do?

original: dad pa dge bsnyen gyis rkang pa la dris bskus na sdom can gyis chos ston gyi dus phyis bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa dge bsnyen gyis rkang pa la dris bskus na sdom can gyis chos ston gyi dus phyis bkru bar bya'o //
translated: The root text states, “If a layperson with faith offers perfume for the feet, a monastic should teach the Dharma, but should not wash the feet at that time.”

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /🔽smras pa yon bdag gis ma mthong bar ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na / smras pa yon bdag gis ma mthong bar ro //
translated: When should one wash the feet?🔽The root text states, “after the patron has left.”

original: ni ni snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: ni ni snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don yin no //
translated: The word “also” indicates that this applies to the other senses as well.

original: de bzhin du dad pas phul ba'i me tog dri zhim po can 'phags pa ste rab tu byung bas bsnam par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dad pas phul ba'i me tog dri zhim po can 'phags pa ste rab tu byung bas bsnam par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, a noble one, that is, a monastic, should smell the fragrant flowers offered by the faithful.

original: ci zhig byas nas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas she na /
translated: What is the benefit of doing this?

original: mig la phan no zhes smos te /
analyzed: mig la phan no zhes smos te /
translated: The root text states, “It is beneficial for the eyes.”

original: me tog dri zhim po can thams cad mig la phan no zhes bya ba ni dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: me tog dri zhim po can thams cad mig la phan no zhes bya ba ni dbang du byas nas so //
translated: This is stated from the perspective of one who is in control.

original: chags pa'i blo gros ni chags blo ste nyes byas chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chags pa'i blo gros ni chags blo ste nyes byas chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: A mind of attachment is a mind of desire.

original: da ni dri la sogs pa'i skabs dbye'o //
analyzed: da ni dri la sogs pa'i skabs dbye'o //
translated: Now the opportunity for smell, etc. is distinguished.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yid kyir 'gyur ba rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yid kyir 'gyur ba rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: This is stated by one who is expressing the opportunity for the mind.

original: dri la sogs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi skabs 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi skabs 'byed pa'o //
translated: The opportunity for those belonging to the class of smell, etc. is distinguished.

original: da ni da ltar te nyes byas kyi de ma thag pa'i skabs su zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ni da ltar te nyes byas kyi de ma thag pa'i skabs su zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Now is the present. The opportunity for the present is the opportunity for the immediately preceding misdeed.

original: chu la sogs par gdong ni blta mi bya //
analyzed: chu la sogs par gdong ni blta mi bya //
translated: One should not look at one's face in water, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ston pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ston pa yin te /
translated: This is taught by this and the following.

original: chags pa'i sems kyis chu la sogs pa dag la gdong blta bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i sems kyis chu la sogs pa dag la gdong blta bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not look at one's face in water, etc. with a mind of desire.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni me long la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni me long la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes a mirror, etc.

original: ci rnam pa thams cad du nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci rnam pa thams cad du nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Is there a misdeed in every way?

original: sngon dang da ltar bdag @237a * //
analyzed: sngon dang da ltar bdag @237a * //
translated: In the past and also in the present,🔽

original: lus cir 'gyur zhe 'am //
analyzed: lus cir 'gyur zhe 'am //
translated: In the past and now, what has my body become?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: rang gi lus dang khog pa'i sngon dang da ltar gyi gnas skabs gang la rnam par dpyod pa'i bsam pa dang / skyo ba skyid pa'i phyir sngon bdag gi lus ngar la bab pa da ltar gyi gnas skabs ji 'dra snyam pas gdong la ltan nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rang gi lus dang khog pa'i sngon dang da ltar gyi gnas skabs gang la rnam par dpyod pa'i bsam pa dang / skyo ba skyid pa'i phyir sngon bdag gi lus ngar la bab pa da ltar gyi gnas skabs ji 'dra snyam pas gdong la ltan nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in looking at one’s face with the intention of examining the past and present condition of one’s body and mind, thinking, “What was my body like in the past, and what is it like now?”

original: ci ngo gdong du gtogs pa'i rma 'di drubs sam 'on te ma yin zhes rnam par brtag pa'i phyir blta ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ci ngo gdong du gtogs pa'i rma 'di drubs sam 'on te ma yin zhes rnam par brtag pa'i phyir blta ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in looking at one’s face in order to examine whether or not a wound on one’s face is healing.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When is there no fault?

original: nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: It is said that there is no fault.

original: gang gi gdong la sogs pa la lta ba la nyes par mi 'gyur te bsam pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi gdong la sogs pa la lta ba la nyes par mi 'gyur te bsam pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is no fault in looking at one’s face and so on, by the power of intention. This is the meaning.

original: se ral kha dang mdzub ris tshud gsum dang // rgyan rnams thams cad yongs su spang bar bya //
analyzed: se ral kha dang mdzub ris tshud gsum dang // rgyan rnams thams cad yongs su spang bar bya //
translated: and all ornaments should be completely abandoned.

original: zhes bya ba la se ral kha ni tshangs pa'i skud pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la se ral kha ni tshangs pa'i skud pa'o //
translated: The sacred thread is the brahminical thread.

original: mdzub ris ni dpral ba'i phyogs su thal ba 'am /
analyzed: mdzub ris ni dpral ba'i phyogs su thal ba 'am /
translated: The forehead mark is ashes on the forehead,

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig gis mdzub ris byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig gis mdzub ris byas pa'o //
translated: or a mark made by something else.

original: tshud gsum ni bkra shis pa'i phyir la gdar gyi phyogs su skud pa btags pa'o //
analyzed: tshud gsum ni bkra shis pa'i phyir la gdar gyi phyogs su skud pa btags pa'o //
translated: The three lines are three lines drawn on the forehead for the sake of good fortune.

original: se ral kha dang mdzub ris dang tshud gsum ni zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: se ral kha dang mdzub ris dang tshud gsum ni zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The sacred thread, the forehead mark, and the three lines should be mentioned.

original: bshad ma thag pa de dag sor gdub la sogs pa'i rgyun gzhan dang gzhan thams cad kyang yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa de dag sor gdub la sogs pa'i rgyun gzhan dang gzhan thams cad kyang yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: All other ornaments such as rings should be completely abandoned.

original: nad sogs zhi phyir dpung ba g-yon pa la //
analyzed: nad sogs zhi phyir dpung ba g-yon pa la //
translated: For the sake of pacifying illness and so on,🔽on the left arm🔽the mantra and so on.

original: sngags la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba smras te /
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba smras te /
translated: The mantra and so on are mentioned as an exception.

original: nad la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa ni nad sogs zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nad la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa ni nad sogs zhi ba'o //
translated: Pacifying illness and so on is pacifying illness and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mi ma yin pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mi ma yin pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The word “etc.” includes non-humans and so on.

original: de'i don ni nad sogs zhi phyir sngags la sogs pa'i skud pa sdom can gyis gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni nad sogs zhi phyir sngags la sogs pa'i skud pa sdom can gyis gdags par bya'o //
translated: The meaning is that one should wear the thread with mantras and so on in order to pacify illness and so on.

original: sngags la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni sngags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni sngags la sogs pa ste /
translated: What are mantras and so on? They are mantras and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras sman yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras sman yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes medicine.

original: de dang ldan pa'i skud pa ni sngags la sogs pa'i skud pa ste /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i skud pa ni sngags la sogs pa'i skud pa ste /
translated: The thread that has them is the thread with mantras and so on.

original: sdom can dge tshul gyis bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdom can dge tshul gyis bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The novitiate should wear it. This is the meaning.

original: gang du gdags par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang du gdags par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: Where should it be worn?

original: dpung pa g-yon par zhes smras te /
analyzed: dpung pa g-yon par zhes smras te /
translated: It is said on the left arm.

original: de yang dpung pa'i rtsa bar zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang dpung pa'i rtsa bar zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: And that should be understood as at the base of the arm.

original: ni'i sgra ni nang la sogs pa'i gnyen por gdags pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nang la sogs pa'i gnyen por gdags pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
translated: The word “ni” distinguishes it from the previous, meaning that there is no fault in wearing it as an antidote to internal and so on.

original: kyang gi sgra ni gzhan rang bzhin @237b gyis kha na ma tho ba nad kyi gnyen po'i don du gdags par bya ba ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang sngags la sogs pa'i skud pa dag kyang zhes sdus pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni gzhan rang bzhin @237b gyis kha na ma tho ba nad kyi gnyen po'i don du gdags par bya ba ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang sngags la sogs pa'i skud pa dag kyang zhes sdus pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: But also the thread of mantra, etc., is not to be imagined.

original: rim pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: rim pa gzhan yin no //
translated: The order is different.

original: nad la sogs pa sos par gyur na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: nad la sogs pa sos par gyur na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What is to be done when the illness, etc., is cured?

original: nad sos nas ni skud pa bkrol nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nad sos nas ni skud pa bkrol nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “When the illness is cured, the thread is to be removed, etc.”

original: nad sos shing bral bar gyur nas skung pa de dpung ba las bkrol nas gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: nad sos shing bral bar gyur nas skung pa de dpung ba las bkrol nas gzhag par bya'o //
translated: When the illness is cured and removed, the thread is to be removed from the arm and put aside.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: bu ga gtsang ma'i phyogs su zhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: bu ga gtsang ma'i phyogs su zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: He says, “In a clean opening.”

original: gtsang mar gyur pa'i bu ga'i cha ni bu ga gtsang ma'i phyogs te /
analyzed: gtsang mar gyur pa'i bu ga'i cha ni bu ga gtsang ma'i phyogs te /
translated: The part of a clean opening is a clean opening.

original: ka ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
translated: The remainder of the sentence is “in a pillar, etc.”

original: gtsang ba nyid kyang gnod pa med par gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsang ba nyid kyang gnod pa med par gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because purity is the absence of harm.

original: sdom can gyis ni sna tshogs gdugs mi bcang //
analyzed: sdom can gyis ni sna tshogs gdugs mi bcang //
translated: One who possesses vows should not hold a parasol of various colors.

original: grong du yu ba bsgreng ba gnang ba med //🔽lo ma dang ni smyug ma gnyis kyi gdugs //
analyzed: grong du yu ba bsgreng ba gnang ba med // lo ma dang ni smyug ma gnyis kyi gdugs //
translated: It is not permitted to hold up the handle in a village.🔽A parasol of leaves or bamboo,

original: yu ba'i tshad ni gdugs kyi tshad tsam yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yu ba'i tshad ni gdugs kyi tshad tsam yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the handle of which is the size of the parasol.

original: sdom can gyis gdugs bcang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sdom can gyis gdugs bcang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One who possesses vows should not hold a parasol.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “of various colors.”

original: rma bya'i gdugs lta bu'o //
analyzed: rma bya'i gdugs lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a peacock parasol.

original: sna tshogs pa bkag pas khra bo ma yin pa bcangs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa bkag pas khra bo ma yin pa bcangs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: Since it prohibits various colors, there is no fault in holding a parasol that is not multicolored.

original: de'i tshe yang grong du gnang ba med pa ste bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang grong du gnang ba med pa ste bkag pa yin no //
translated: At that time, it is not permitted in a village; it is prohibited.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: yu ba bsgreng ba ste yu ba gyen du bsgreng ba yin pa de'i phyir grong gi nang du gdugs logs su bsnyal nas 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: yu ba bsgreng ba ste yu ba gyen du bsgreng ba yin pa de'i phyir grong gi nang du gdugs logs su bsnyal nas 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: The handle is held up; the handle is held up high. Therefore, one should go to the village holding the parasol sideways.

original: dang ni sna tshogs pa bkag pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi phra bo ma yin pa yang grong du bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ni sna tshogs pa bkag pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi phra bo ma yin pa yang grong du bkag pa yin no //
translated: The word “and” indicates that not only is the variety of umbrellas prohibited, but also the large umbrellas are prohibited.

original: zhes sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the summary.

original: gdugs de yang rnam pa gnyis te zhes bstan pa'i phyir lo ma dang ni smyug ma gnyis kyi gdugs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gdugs de yang rnam pa gnyis te zhes bstan pa'i phyir lo ma dang ni smyug ma gnyis kyi gdugs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there are two types of umbrellas, he says: “an umbrella made of leaves or bamboo.”

original: lo ma las byas pa ni lo ma'i yin te lo ma zhes bya ba ni shing lo rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: lo ma las byas pa ni lo ma'i yin te lo ma zhes bya ba ni shing lo rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: An umbrella made of leaves is one made of leaves. The word “leaves” refers to the leaves of trees.

original: dper na ta la'i gdugs lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ta la'i gdugs lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a palm-leaf umbrella.

original: smyug ma las byas pa ni smyug ma'i yin te /
analyzed: smyug ma las byas pa ni smyug ma'i yin te /
translated: An umbrella made of bamboo is one made of bamboo.

original: rnam pa 'dis gdugs rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis gdugs rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: By this method, there are two types of umbrellas.

original: tshad pa las skyob par byed pas na de ni gdugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshad pa las skyob par byed pas na de ni gdugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it protects from the heat, it is called an “umbrella.”

original: de lta bur gyur pa bshad cing gnang ba'i gdugs de'i tshad tsam zhes bya ba la gdugs kyi tshad du yu ba bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa bshad cing gnang ba'i gdugs de'i tshad tsam zhes bya ba la gdugs kyi tshad du yu ba bshad pa yin te /
translated: The size of that umbrella, which is explained and permitted, is the size of the handle of an umbrella.

original: khog pa'i tshad kyi yu ba bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khog pa'i tshad kyi yu ba bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the handle should be the size of the forearm.

original: dang ni lo ma la @238a * //
analyzed: dang ni lo ma la @238a * //
translated: The word “and” in the root text indicates that the explanation of the parasol made of leaves, etc.,

original: sogs pa'i gdugs bshad pa dang / de'i tshad kyi yu ba bshad pa yin no zhes sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i gdugs bshad pa dang / de'i tshad kyi yu ba bshad pa yin no zhes sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: and the explanation of the handle for that parasol are to be combined.

original: dge tshul gyi tshig le'ur byas pa las dri la sogs pa las slar ldog pa ste bslab pa'i gzhi bdun pa'o /
analyzed: dge tshul gyi tshig le'ur byas pa las dri la sogs pa las slar ldog pa ste bslab pa'i gzhi bdun pa'o /
translated: This concludes the seventh training rule on turning away from scents, etc., in the monastic code of the novice monk.

original: // / da ni /
analyzed: // / da ni /
translated: Now,

original: che zhing mtho ba'i mal stan nyal ba ni //
analyzed: che zhing mtho ba'i mal stan nyal ba ni //
translated: lying on a large or high bed,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bslab pa'i gzhi brgyad pa 'chad pa yin te mal stan chen po la dge tshul nyal bar byed na gzir bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bslab pa'i gzhi brgyad pa 'chad pa yin te mal stan chen po la dge tshul nyal bar byed na gzir bar 'gyur ro //
translated: etc., explains the eighth training rule. If a novice monk lies on a large bed, he will be excommunicated.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: nyes byas bkra mi shis pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyes byas bkra mi shis pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text says, “by the misfortune of a minor infraction.”

original: nyes byas kho na bkra mi shis pa yin pas nyes byas bkra mi shis pa ste /
analyzed: nyes byas kho na bkra mi shis pa yin pas nyes byas bkra mi shis pa ste /
translated: A minor infraction is misfortune.

original: shis pa ma yin pa de'i phyir des zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shis pa ma yin pa de'i phyir des zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is inauspicious, it is misfortune. Therefore, the meaning is “by that.”

original: yang na mal stan mthon po la nyal ba ste de la yang nyal bar byed na gzir bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba thams cad brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na mal stan mthon po la nyal ba ste de la yang nyal bar byed na gzir bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba thams cad brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Or, one should not lie down on a high bed, and one should not lie down on a bed that is too low, and one should not lie down on a bed that is too high.

original: de la nyal na nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la nyal na nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that if one lies down on those beds, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mal stan de gnyis kyi rang bzhin ci yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mal stan de gnyis kyi rang bzhin ci yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show what the nature of those two beds is, he says:

original: khru gang tshad las 'das pa mtho ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khru gang tshad las 'das pa mtho ba yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: A bed is high if it exceeds a cubit.

original: khru gang tshad las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni khru'i tshad las lhag par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khru gang tshad las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni khru'i tshad las lhag par gyur pa'o //
translated: A bed is high if it exceeds a cubit.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don yin te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don yin te /
translated: The word “ni” has the meaning of “because.”

original: gang gi phyir de lta bur gyur pa de ni mthon po yin pa de'i phyir 'di la nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bur gyur pa de ni mthon po yin pa de'i phyir 'di la nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: Because it is like that, it is high. Therefore, one should not lie down on it.

original: rin chen la sogs rkang rgyan che ba yin //
analyzed: rin chen la sogs rkang rgyan che ba yin //
translated: A bed is luxurious if it is adorned with jewels and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la rin po che la sogs pas rkang ba rnam par spras pa'i phyir rin chen la sogs rkang rgyan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rin po che la sogs pas rkang ba rnam par spras pa'i phyir rin chen la sogs rkang rgyan te /
translated: The ornaments for the feet are jewels, etc. because they are attached to the feet.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de ni mal stan chen po yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de ni mal stan chen po yin no //
translated: Such are the great beds.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gser la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gser la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word etc. includes gold, etc.

original: ni'i sgra ni snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
translated: The word ni is for the purpose of distinguishing from the previous.

original: mtho ba'i mal stan rin chen 'od spras pa //
analyzed: mtho ba'i mal stan rin chen 'od spras pa //
translated: The verse says, a high bed adorned with precious lights.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dmigs kyis bsal ba smras pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dmigs kyis bsal ba smras pa yin te /
translated: This is a special case.

original: stan mthon po la 'dzegs nas chos bsgrags pa rab tu sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: stan mthon po la 'dzegs nas chos bsgrags pa rab tu sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One should give the gift of Dharma while ascending a high seat.

original: gang gi phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i chos sri zhu bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i chos sri zhu bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Dharma of the Well-Gone Ones is to be served and worshipped.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: rin chen 'od spras zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rin chen 'od spras zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said adorned with precious lights.

original: rin po che dag gi 'od ni rin chen 'od zer de dang 'dra bar 'bar ba'i gzi brjid bzang po dang ldan pa de lta bur gyur pa de la 'dzegs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rin po che dag gi 'od ni rin chen 'od zer de dang 'dra bar 'bar ba'i gzi brjid bzang po dang ldan pa de lta bur gyur pa de la 'dzegs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The light of the jewels is like the light of the jewels. Having climbed to that which is endowed with good splendor, is the meaning of the verse.

original: ci zhig mngon sum du byas nas she na /🔽'dir ni 'du byed 'jig @238b par bsams nas ni //
analyzed: ci zhig mngon sum du byas nas she na / 'dir ni 'du byed 'jig @238b par bsams nas ni //
translated: What is perceived?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, it is said: “Having reflected on the destruction of the compounded. ”

original: 'du byed rnams 'jig cing nyams pa de ni 'du byed 'jig par bsam pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams 'jig cing nyams pa de ni 'du byed 'jig par bsam pa ste /
translated: The destruction of the compounded, the decay of the compounded, is the destruction of the compounded.

original: dmigs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having perceived, is the meaning of the verse.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni chos sgrogs pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni chos sgrogs pa'i dus su'o //
translated: Here, is at the time of the proclamation of the Dharma.

original: de lta bur dmigs pas rin po che la sogs pas spras pa'i stan la 'dzegs nas chos bsgrags pa sbyin pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur dmigs pas rin po che la sogs pas spras pa'i stan la 'dzegs nas chos bsgrags pa sbyin pa la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: By perceiving in that way, there is no fault in the gift of the proclamation of the Dharma, even if it is on a seat adorned with jewels, etc.

original: gnod sbyin gnas dang lha yi gnas dag dang // klu yi gnas su rin chen 'bar pa rnams //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gnas dang lha yi gnas dag dang // klu yi gnas su rin chen 'bar pa rnams //
translated: The shining jewels in the abodes of the yakshas, the abodes of the gods, and the abodes of the nagas,

original: khyim pas bstabs kyang sdom can mi dag par //
analyzed: khyim pas bstabs kyang sdom can mi dag par //
translated: Even if offered by a householder, are not pure for the one who is restrained.

original: bsgoms nas 'dug par gyur kyang nyes pa med //
analyzed: bsgoms nas 'dug par gyur kyang nyes pa med //
translated: There is no fault in sitting down to meditate.

original: de bzhin du khyim gyi nang du khyim pas bstabs pa ste khyim gyi nang der khyim pas bstabs pa'i stan la chos bsgrags pa sbyin pa las dus gzhan gyi tshe yang 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyim gyi nang du khyim pas bstabs pa ste khyim gyi nang der khyim pas bstabs pa'i stan la chos bsgrags pa sbyin pa las dus gzhan gyi tshe yang 'dug par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in a house, on a seat prepared by a layperson in the house, one should sit down to give a Dharma talk, even at another time, when invited by a layperson.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: rin po che de dag gi 'od zer 'bar ba des gsal bar byas pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: rin po che de dag gi 'od zer 'bar ba des gsal bar byas pa la yang ngo //
translated: It is illuminated by the blazing light rays of those jewels.

original: 'di skad du khyim pas khyim nang du rin po che la sogs pas spras pa'i stan bshams pa la rjes su gzung ba'i blos 'dug par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du khyim pas khyim nang du rin po che la sogs pas spras pa'i stan bshams pa la rjes su gzung ba'i blos 'dug par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is taught: “One should sit down on a seat in a house, strewn with jewels, etc., by a layperson, with the intention of being helpful.”

original: ji ltar bsams nas 'dug par bya zhe na /🔽mi rtag par bsgoms nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar bsams nas 'dug par bya zhe na / mi rtag par bsgoms nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: How should one sit down, having reflected on what?🔽The text says, “Having meditated on impermanence.”

original: mi rtag par bsgoms pa ni mngon sum du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag par bsgoms pa ni mngon sum du byas pa yin te /
translated: Having meditated on impermanence means having made it present.

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bsgoms pa 'dis de'i rgyu can sems rgod pa mngon par bcom nas yon bdag gi bsod nams spel bar bya ba'i phyir 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bsgoms pa 'dis de'i rgyu can sems rgod pa mngon par bcom nas yon bdag gi bsod nams spel bar bya ba'i phyir 'dug par bya'o //
translated: By this meditation on “all conditioned things are impermanent,” he conquers the cause of agitation of mind, and he should stay in order to increase the merit of the patron.

original: de bzhin du gnod sbyin gyi gnas te khyim pa de dang de bzhin du lha'i gnas te khyim du sdom can yid la byed pa des 'dug pa de la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnod sbyin gyi gnas te khyim pa de dang de bzhin du lha'i gnas te khyim du sdom can yid la byed pa des 'dug pa de la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, there is no fault in his staying in the abode of the yakshas, i.e., the house, and in the abode of the gods, i.e., the house, with the attention of the one who is restrained.

original: klu'i gnas te khyim du bsam pa de nyid kyis 'dug pa de la nyes pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: klu'i gnas te khyim du bsam pa de nyid kyis 'dug pa de la nyes pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no fault in his staying in the abode of the nagas, i.e., the house, with that very intention.

original: gang gi phyir sa gzhi dang them skas rin po che'i rang bzhin ni de dag gi bsod nams las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa gzhi dang them skas rin po che'i rang bzhin ni de dag gi bsod nams las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ground and the stairs are of precious substance, which arises from their merit.

original: dang ni thams cad du sdud pa'o //
analyzed: dang ni thams cad du sdud pa'o //
translated: The word “and” includes everything.

original: ji ltar yang bslab pa'i gzhi 'di dngos po gtso bor gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar yang bslab pa'i gzhi 'di dngos po gtso bor gyur pa yin te /
translated: And how is this precept the principal thing?

original: rtog pa spangs pa tsam gyis gnas pa la sogs pa la nyes par 'gyur ba de lta na yang mi rtag pa'i yid la byed pa'i rnam pa med par 'dug na kha na ma tho ba chung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rtog pa spangs pa tsam gyis gnas pa la sogs pa la nyes par 'gyur ba de lta na yang mi rtag pa'i yid la byed pa'i rnam pa med par 'dug na kha na ma tho ba chung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Even though there is a fault in abiding, etc., merely by abandoning discursive thought, still, if one is not abiding in the aspect of the mindfulness of impermanence, there is a minor transgression.

original: yid la byed pa'i rnam pa des kyang yod pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //🔽da ni / mtho la @239a * //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rnam pa des kyang yod pa ma yin par rig par bya'o // da ni / mtho la @239a * //
translated: And one should understand that by that aspect of mindfulness, it is not existent.

original: sogs phyogs nyin par nyal ba dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid kyi nyes par 'gyur ba 'chad pa yin te /
analyzed: sogs phyogs nyin par nyal ba dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid kyi nyes par 'gyur ba 'chad pa yin te /
translated: Now, beginning with “lying down during the day in a high place, etc.,” he explains the mental faults.

original: nyin par nyal na stan mthon po la sogs pa'i phyogs su gtogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don yin pa de'i phyir nyin par nyal ba yid kyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyin par nyal na stan mthon po la sogs pa'i phyogs su gtogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don yin pa de'i phyir nyin par nyal ba yid kyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that if one lies down during the day, one is included in the group of those who lie down on high beds, etc. Therefore, the meaning is that lying down during the day is a mental fault.

original: de la gnyid kyis zil gyis mnan par gyur pa de'i tshe ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnyid kyis zil gyis mnan par gyur pa de'i tshe ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: If one is overcome by sleep at that time, how should one practice?

original: gnyid kyi nad du gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnyid kyi nad du gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “when the disease of sleep arises,”

original: gal te gnyid kyis nad du gyur cing gcing bar gyur pa de dag la gnang ba ste /
analyzed: gal te gnyid kyis nad du gyur cing gcing bar gyur pa de dag la gnang ba ste /
translated: If they are sick and exhausted from sleep, they are permitted.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyin par nyal ba de rjes su gnang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyin par nyal ba de rjes su gnang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The Blessed One permitted sleeping during the day.

original: dus ci srid cig tu zhe na /
analyzed: dus ci srid cig tu zhe na /
translated: For how long a time?

original: cung zad ces bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: cung zad ces bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The word “a little” is stated.

original: cung zad ces bya ba'i tshig ni dus ci tsam gyis gnyid sangs par gyur nas dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bar bzod pa de tsam nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: cung zad ces bya ba'i tshig ni dus ci tsam gyis gnyid sangs par gyur nas dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bar bzod pa de tsam nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The word “a little” should be understood to indicate the time that is tolerated for engaging in virtue after waking from sleep.

original: nad pa dang ni nad g-yog ma gtogs par //🔽sdom can mar me snang la nyal ma gnang //
analyzed: nad pa dang ni nad g-yog ma gtogs par // sdom can mar me snang la nyal ma gnang //
translated: Except for the sick and nurses,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is not permitted for those with vows to sleep in the light of a lamp.

original: mar me'i snang ba la nyal ba ni mar me snang la nyal ba ste /
analyzed: mar me'i snang ba la nyal ba ni mar me snang la nyal ba ste /
translated: Sleeping in the light of a lamp is sleeping in the light of a lamp.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba'i snang ba las snang ba dang ldan pa'i phyogs gzhan de la sdom can ma gnang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba'i snang ba las snang ba dang ldan pa'i phyogs gzhan de la sdom can ma gnang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not permitted for those with vows to sleep in any other place that is illuminated by the light of the sun or moon. This is the meaning.

original: ci thams cad dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci thams cad dam zhe na /
translated: Is it all of them?

original: smras pa / nad pa ma gtogs pa dang nad pa de'i nad g-yog byed pa'i sdom can ma gtogs par sdom can gzhan dag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smras pa / nad pa ma gtogs pa dang nad pa de'i nad g-yog byed pa'i sdom can ma gtogs par sdom can gzhan dag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said: except for the sick, and except for the one who is observing the vow who is the attendant of that sick person, the rest of the ones who are observing the vow.🔽The meaning is that.

original: dang ni sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ni sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “and” is a conjunction.

original: gding ba med par nyal ba rigs pa min //
analyzed: gding ba med par nyal ba rigs pa min //
translated: It is not proper to sleep without a covering.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,🔽it is not proper to sleep without a covering, without a spread, on the bedding of the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi mal stan las gding ba med cing gding ba dang bral bas nyal bar rigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi mal stan las gding ba med cing gding ba dang bral bas nyal bar rigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: dge 'dun gyi mal stan gding bas g-yogs nas yongs su longs spyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi mal stan gding bas g-yogs nas yongs su longs spyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: one should use the bedding of the Saṅgha after covering it with one’s own spread.

original: longs spyod pa de la yang g-yogs ma med pa nyid la gding bas g-yogs pa nyid ni 'dug pa la bar du chod pa'i dgos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod pa de la yang g-yogs ma med pa nyid la gding bas g-yogs pa nyid ni 'dug pa la bar du chod pa'i dgos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, in that use, the absence of a covering is the purpose of the spread, which is an obstruction to sitting.

original: de yang 'dir khri dang khri'u las gzhan pa nyid la zhes rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang 'dir khri dang khri'u las gzhan pa nyid la zhes rtogs par bya ste /
translated: And that should be understood here as something other than a bed or bench,

original: de nyams par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyams par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is damaged by those.

original: gzhan yang / mal stan ko lpags nam yang gnang ba med //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang / mal stan ko lpags nam yang gnang ba med // ces bya ba la /
translated: a bed or seat of animal skin is never permitted.

original: ko lpags kyi mal stan longs spyod pa nam yang gnang ba med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: ko lpags kyi mal stan longs spyod pa nam yang gnang ba med pa kho na yin te /
translated: A bed or seat of animal skin is never permitted at all.

original: ko lpags @239b kyi mal stan yongs su longs spyod par byed na nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ko lpags @239b kyi mal stan yongs su longs spyod par byed na nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: if one uses a bed or seat of animal skin, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ci rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du ma gnang ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du ma gnang ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it never permitted in any way?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / khyim pa'i khyim du stan tsam nyi tshe gnang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smras pa / khyim pa'i khyim du stan tsam nyi tshe gnang zhes bya ba la /
translated: A mere seat is permitted in the house of a layperson.

original: khyim pa'i khyim du stan nyi tshe tsam yongs su longs spyod par gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa'i khyim du stan nyi tshe tsam yongs su longs spyod par gnang ba yin no //
translated: A mere seat is permitted for use in the house of a layperson.

original: ni'i sgra ni gzhan gtsug lag khang la sogs par ma yin no zhes khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gzhan gtsug lag khang la sogs par ma yin no zhes khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word mere is stated to indicate that it is not permitted in other places such as a temple.

original: tsam zhes smos pa ni mal stan rnam par bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: tsam zhes smos pa ni mal stan rnam par bcad pa yin no //
translated: The word mere excludes beds and seats.

original: ci thams cad du tshul 'di yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci thams cad du tshul 'di yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is this rule always so?

original: rdo 'jog tu ni gnyi ga 'ang gnang ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo 'jog tu ni gnyi ga 'ang gnang ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: In Takṣaśilā, both are permitted.🔽In the passage, “In Takṣaśilā, both are permitted,”

original: rdo 'jog ces bya ba ni yul mtha' 'khob yin te /
analyzed: rdo 'jog ces bya ba ni yul mtha' 'khob yin te /
translated: Takṣaśilā is a barbarian land.

original: de la mal dang stan gnyi ga yang gnang ba ste /
analyzed: de la mal dang stan gnyi ga yang gnang ba ste /
translated: Both the woolen and the leather mats are permitted there.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gnang ngo zhes bya ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gnang ngo zhes bya ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase, “the Blessed One permitted,” is a remainder.

original: rdo 'jog las gzhan 'ga' zhig tu yang ko lpags kyi mal stan longs spyod par gnang ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon yon tan yod kyis /
analyzed: rdo 'jog las gzhan 'ga' zhig tu yang ko lpags kyi mal stan longs spyod par gnang ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon yon tan yod kyis /
translated: Since there is no permission to use a leather mat anywhere other than Takṣaśilā, the master Guṇamati said,

original: aa mra pa ranta dag tu ko lpags mi bcang bar mi bya'o gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: aa mra pa ranta dag tu ko lpags mi bcang bar mi bya'o gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “One should not carry leather in Aṅga and Magadha.”

original: kha cig yul gyi dbus su mal stan ko lpags min //
analyzed: kha cig yul gyi dbus su mal stan ko lpags min //
translated: Some say: In the middle region, one should not use a leather mat.
